<m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${i=1}$ and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${i=2}$ ) have been considered in the literature. We establish the integrability of the solutions to the above Hardy‚ÄìSobolev type system and the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>C</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> ${C^{\infty}}$ regularity of solutions to this system away from the origin, which improves significantly the Lipschitz continuity in most works in the literature. Moreover, we also use the moving plane method of [8] in integral forms developed in [6] to prove that each pair <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>v</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${(u,v)}$ of positive solutions of the above integral system is radially symmetric and strictly decreasing about the origin.

title: Levinson‚Äôs Problem on Affine-Periodic Solutions
abstract: Abstract In this paper, Levinson‚Äôs problem is introduced to affine-periodic systems. It is proved that every affine-dissipative-repulsive system admits an affine-periodic solution, which extends previous well-known results for dissipative systems.

title: Fractional Perimeters from a Fractal Perspective
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper consists in a better understanding of the fractional nature of the nonlocal perimeters introduced in [L. Caffarelli, J.-M. Roquejoffre and O. Savin, Nonlocal minimal surfaces, Comm. Pure Appl. Math. 63 2010, 9, 1111‚Äì1144]. Following [A. Visintin, Generalized coarea formula and fractal sets, Japan J. Indust. Appl. Math. 8 1991, 2, 175‚Äì201], we exploit these fractional perimeters to introduce a definition of fractal dimension for the measure theoretic boundary of a set. We calculate the fractal dimension of sets which can be defined in a recursive way, and we give some examples of this kind of sets, explaining how to construct them starting from well-known self-similar fractals. In particular, we show that in the case of the von Koch snowflake <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>S</m:mi> <m:mo>‚äÜ</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:math> {S\subseteq\mathbb{R}^{2}} this fractal dimension coincides with the Minkowski dimension. We also obtain an optimal result for the asymptotics as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>-</m:mo> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:math> {s\to 1^{-}} of the fractional perimeter of a set having locally finite (classical) perimeter.

title: Global Dynamics of Generalized Logistic Equations
abstract: Abstract We consider a parameter dependent parabolic logistic population model with diffusion and degenerate logistic term allowing for refuges for the population. The aim of the paper is to remove quite restrictive geometric and smoothness conditions on the refuge used in the existing literature. The key is a new simplified construction of a supersolution that does not make use of any regularity condition of the refuge. At the same time we also simplify other arguments commonly used in the literature.

title: A Liouville-Type Theorem for an Elliptic Equation with Superquadratic Growth in the Gradient
authors: Roberta Filippucci; Patrizia Pucci; Philippe Souplet
abstract: Abstract We consider the elliptic equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>q</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àá</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {-\Delta u=u^{q}|\nabla u|^{p}} in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{n}} for any <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {p>2} and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {q>0} . We prove a Liouville-type theorem, which asserts that any positive bounded solution is constant. The proof technique is based on monotonicity properties for the spherical averages of sub- and super-harmonic functions, combined with a gradient bound obtained by a local Bernstein argument. This solves, in the case of bounded solutions, a problem left open in [2], where the case <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {0<p<2} is considered. Some extensions to elliptic systems are also given.

title: Nonlocal Differential Equations with Convolution Coefficients and Applications to Fractional Calculus
abstract: Abstract The existence of at least one positive solution to a large class of both integer- and fractional-order nonlocal differential equations, of which one model case is <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>A</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>b</m:mi> <m:mo>*</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>q</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Ä≤‚Ä≤</m:mo> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo rspace="12.5pt">,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo rspace="4.2pt">,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> -A((b*u^{q})(1))u^{\prime\prime}(t)=\lambda f(t,u(t)),\quad t\in(0,1),\,q\geq 1, is considered. Due to the coefficient <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>A</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>b</m:mi> <m:mo>*</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>q</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {A((b*u^{q})(1))} appearing in the differential equation, the equation has a coefficient containing a convolution term. By choosing the kernel b in various ways, specific nonlocal coefficients can be recovered such as nonlocal coefficients equivalent to a fractional integral of Riemann‚ÄìLiouville type. The results rely on the use of a nonstandard order cone together with topological fixed point theory. Applications to fractional differential equations are given, including a problem related to the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(n-1,1)} -conjugate problem.

title: The existence of infinitely many boundary blow-up solutions to the p-k-Hessian equation

Here, <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>k</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>{</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Ä¶</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>}</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> k\in \left\{1,2,\ldots ,N\right\} , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mi>œÉ</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>k</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\sigma }_{k}\left(\lambda ) is the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>k</m:mi> </m:math> k -Hessian operator, and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:math> \Omega is a ball in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mspace width="0.33em" /> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {{\mathbb{R}}}^{N}\hspace{0.33em}\left(N\ge 2) . Our methods are mainly based on the sub- and super-solutions method.

title: Infinitely many free or prescribed mass solutions for fractional Hartree equations and Pohozaev identities
authors: Silvia Cingolani; Marco Gallo; Kazunaga Tanaka
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the following nonlinear fractional Hartree (or Choquard-Pekar) equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:math> ${\left(-{\Delta}\right)}^{s}u+\mu u=\left({I}_{\alpha }{\ast}F\left(u\right)\right){F}^{\prime }\left(u\right)\quad \text{in} {\mathbb{R}}^{N},$ (*) where Œº > 0, s ‚àà (0, 1), N ‚â• 2, Œ± ‚àà (0, N ), <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mi>I</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œ±</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚àº</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mi>Œ±</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:math> ${I}_{\alpha }\sim \frac{1}{\vert x{\vert }^{N-\alpha }}$ is the Riesz potential, and F is a general subcritical nonlinearity. The goal is to prove existence of multiple (radially symmetric) solutions <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>H</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> $u\in {H}^{s}\left({\mathbb{R}}^{N}\right)$ , by assuming F odd or even: we consider both the case Œº > 0 fixed and the case <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚à´</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:math> ${\int }_{{\mathbb{R}}^{N}}{u}^{2}=m{ >}0$ prescribed. Here we also simplify some arguments developed for s = 1 (S. Cingolani, M. Gallo, and K. Tanaka, ‚ÄúMultiple solutions for the nonlinear Choquard equation with even or odd nonlinearities,‚Äù Calc. Var. Partial Differ. Equ. , vol. 61, no. 68, p. 34, 2022). A key point in the proof is given by the research of suitable multidimensional odd paths, which was done in the local case by Berestycki and Lions (H. Berestycki and P.-L. Lions, ‚ÄúNonlinear scalar field equations II: existence of infinitely many solutions,‚Äù Arch. Ration. Mech. Anal. , vol. 82, no. 4, pp. 347‚Äì375, 1983); for (*) the nonlocalities play indeed a special role. In particular, some properties of these paths are needed in the asymptotic study (as Œº varies) of the mountain pass values of the unconstrained problem, then exploited to describe the geometry of the constrained problem and detect infinitely many normalized solutions for any m > 0. The found solutions satisfy in addition a Pohozaev identity: in this paper we further investigate the validity of this identity for solutions of doubly nonlocal equations under a C 1 -regularity.

title: Existence of ground states to quasi-linear Schr√∂dinger equations with critical exponential growth involving different potentials
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper is three-fold. First, we establish singular Trudinger‚ÄìMoser inequalities with less restrictive constraint: (0.1) <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block" overflow="scroll"> <m:munder> title: Limiting behavior of quasilinear wave equations with fractional-type dissipation
authors: Barbara Kaltenbacher; Mostafa Meliani; Vanja Nikoliƒá
abstract: Abstract In this work, we investigate a class of quasilinear wave equations of Westervelt type with, in general, nonlocal-in-time dissipation. They arise as models of nonlinear sound propagation through complex media with anomalous diffusion of Gurtin‚ÄìPipkin type. Aiming at minimal assumptions on the involved memory kernels ‚Äì which we allow to be weakly singular ‚Äì we prove the well-posedness of such wave equations in a general theoretical framework. In particular, the Abel fractional kernels, as well as Mittag-Leffler-type kernels, are covered by our results. The analysis is carried out uniformly with respect to the small involved parameter on which the kernels depend and which can be physically interpreted as the sound diffusivity or the thermal relaxation time. We then analyze the behavior of solutions as this parameter vanishes, and in this way relate the equations to their limiting counterparts. To establish the limiting problems, we distinguish among different classes of kernels and analyze and discuss all ensuing cases.

title: Positive Solutions of an Indefinite Prescribed Mean Curvature Problem on a General Domain
abstract: Abstract The existence of positive solutions is proved for the prescribed mean curvature problem where Œ© ‚äÇ‚Ñù N is a bounded smooth domain, not necessarily radially symmetric. We assume that ‚à´ 0 u f(x, s) ds is locally subquadratic at 0, ‚à´ 0 u g(x, s) ds is superquadratic at 0 and Œª > 0 is sufficiently small. A multiplicity result is also obtained, when ‚à´ 0 u f(x, s) ds has an oscillatory behaviour near 0. We allow f and g to change sign in any neighbourhood of 0.

title: Some Existence Results on Nontrivial Solutions of the Prescribed Mean Curvature Equation
abstract: Abstract The paper is concerned with an eigenvalue problem for the prescribed mean curvature equation. We formulate the problem as a variational inequality and show that under some growth conditions on the lower order term, the relaxed problem has at least two nontrivial solutions in a space of functions of bounded variation when the parameter is small.

title: Comparison and Existence Results for Classes of Nonlinear Elliptic Equations with General Growth in the Gradient
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the Dirichlet problem for a class of nonlinear elliptic equations in the form A(u) = H(x, u, Du), where the principal term is a Leray-Lions operator defined on W 0 1,p (Œ©), and H(x, u, Du) grows with respect to Du at most like |Du| q , p-1 ‚â§ q ‚â§ p. Comparison results are obtained between the rearrangement of a solution u of Dirichlet problem quoted above and the rearrangement of the solution of a problem whose data are radially symmetric.

title: Large Solutions For a Class of Nonlinear Elliptic Equations With Gradient Terms
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove the existence, in a suitable sense, of a large solution (a solution that blows-up at the boundary) for a class of nonlinear elliptic equations whose model is -Œî p u + u + u|‚ñΩu| q = f in Œ©, p > 1, p - 1 < q ‚â§ p and f(x) ‚àà L 1 (Œ©). The main tool in order to prove it relies on approximating the problem with a more regular one, prove local (i.e. independent from the behavior on the boundary) a priori estimates and local compactness for truncations in W 1,p (Œ©). Such scheme of the proof is also applied in order to prove the existence of a solution for equations of the type -Œî p u + u + u|‚ñΩu| q = f in ‚Ñù N , where f(x) ‚àà L 1 loc (‚Ñù N ) without any condition at infinity. Moreover, the local summability of the solution depending on the local summability of the datum is studied.

title: Bifurcation and Stability of Travelling Waves in Self-focusing Planar Waveguides
abstract: Abstract A mathematical problem arising in the modelling of travelling waves in self- focusing waveguides is studied. It involves a nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation in ‚Ñù 1+1 . In the paraxial approximation, the travelling waves are interpreted as standing waves of the NLS. Local and global bifurcation results are established for the corresponding \stationary" equation. The combination of variational arguments with an implicit function theorem yields smooth branches of positive solutions parametrized by the \frequency" of the standing wave of NLS. Precise informations on the asymptotic behaviour of various norms of the solutions along the branches are given. In the case of even symmetry, a global bifurcation result is proved, providing a branch of positive even solutions parametrized by frequencies in the whole half-line (0, ‚àû). The stability of the standing waves of the NLS relies on the monotonicity of their L 2 -norm as a function of the frequency. This criterion, precisely going back to formal arguments in the physical literature on self-focusing waveguides, is proved to hold along the whole global branch of solutions in the even case. The mathematical results are applied to the study of a non-homogeneous planar self-focusing waveguide with a Kerr-type nonlinear response, yielding existence of TE travelling waves and their stability among the set of TE modes. The bifurcation analysis gives informations on the power of the beam. In particular, it provides the possibility of low power cut-off.

title: Subharmonic Solutions of Planar Hamiltonian Systems: a Rotation Number Approach
abstract: Abstract We prove the existence of infinitely many subharmonic solutions, with prescribed nodal properties, for a planar Hamiltonian system Jz‚Ä≤ = Œî z H(t, z), with H periodic in the first variable. The goal is achieved by performing estimates of the rotation numbers with respect to deformed polar coordinates and applying Ding‚Äôs version of the Poincar√©-Birkhoff fixed point theorem.

title: Regularity of the Extremal Solutions in a Gelfand System Problem
abstract: Abstract We examine the elliptic system given by where Œª, Œ≥ are positive parameters and where Œ© is a smooth bounded domain in ‚Ñù N . Let U denote the parameter region (Œª, Œ≥) of strictly positive parameters where (P) Œª,Œ≥ has a smooth solution and let Œ• denote the boundary of U. We show that the extremal solution (u‚àó, v‚àó) associated with (Œª‚àó, Œ≥‚àó) ‚àà Œ• is smooth provided that 3 ‚â§ N ‚â§ 9 and

title: Existence of Two Solutions for a Second-Order Discrete Boundary Value Problem
abstract: Abstract The existence of two nontrivial solutions for a class of nonlinear second-order discrete boundary value problems is established. The approach adopted is based on variational methods.

title: On the Convergence of Solutions of Globally Modified Navier-Stokes Equations with Delays to Solutions of Navier-Stokes Equations with Delays
authors: Pedro Mar√≠n-Rubio; Jos√© Real; Antonio M. M√°rquez-Dur√°n
abstract: Abstract We prove that under suitable assumptions, from a sequence of solutions of Globally Modified Navier-Stokes equations with delays we can extract a subsequence which converges in an adequate sense to a weak solution of a three-dimensional Navier-Stokes equation with delays. An additional case with a family of different delays involved in the approximating problems is also discussed.

title: Synchronic and Asynchronic Descriptions of Irrigation Problems
abstract: Abstract In this paper we complete our work started in [31], where the present paper was announced; in order to set a unified theory of the irrigation problem. The main result of the paper is the equivalence of the various formulations introduced so far as well as a new one introduced here. To this aim we introduce several geometric and analytical concepts which are essential for reaching our final goal even if they may deserve an intrinsic interest in themselves.

title: Symbolic Calculus and Boundedness of Multi-parameter and Multi-linear Pseudo-differential Operators
abstract: Abstract Since the work of H√∂rmander on linear pseudo-differential operators, the applications of pseudo-differential operators have played an important role in partial differential equations, harmonic analysis, theory of several complex variables and other branches of modern analysis (e.g., they are used to construct parametrices and establish the regularity of solutions to PDEs such as the ‚àÇÃÖ problem, etc.). The work of Coifman and Meyer on multi-linear Fourier multipliers and pseudo-differential operators has stimulated further such applications. In [2], the authors developed a fairly satisfactory theory of symbolic calculus for multi-linear pseudo-differential operators. Motivated by this work [2] and L p estimates of [34, 35] on multi-parameter and multi-linear Fourier multipliers and of [12] on multi-parameter and multi-linear pseudo-differential operators, we study and carry out the theory of symbolic calculus for multi-parameter and multi-linear pseudo-differential operators. Our results include the symbol estimates of the adjoints, asymptotic behavior, kernel estimates and boundedness properties and extend those in [2] to the multi-parameter and multi-linear setting. The estimates of the distributional kernel of associated multi-parameter and multilinear pseudo-differential operators can be found useful in establishing the boundedness of such multi-parameter and multi-linear pseudo-differential operators.

title: Maslov (P, œâ)-Index Theory for Symplectic Paths
abstract: Abstract In this paper, the Maslov (P, œâ)-index theory for a symplectic path is developed and the Bott-type iteration formula is proved.

The existence of infinitely many solutions of the equation is proved via the truncation method.

title: Addendum: Local Elliptic Regularity for the Dirichlet Fractional Laplacian
authors: Umberto Biccari; Mahamadi Warma; Enrique Zuazua
abstract: Abstract In [1], for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {1<p<\infty} , we proved the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msubsup> <m:mi>W</m:mi> <m:mi>loc</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msubsup> </m:math> {W^{2s,p}_{\mathrm{loc}}} local elliptic regularity of weak solutions to the Dirichlet problem associated with the fractional Laplacian <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {(-\Delta)^{s}} on an arbitrary bounded open set of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} . Here we make a more precise and rigorous statement. In fact, for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {1<p<2} and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â†</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:math> {s\neq\frac{1}{2}} , local regularity does not hold in the Sobolev space <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msubsup> <m:mi>W</m:mi> <m:mi>loc</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msubsup> </m:math> {W^{2s,p}_{\mathrm{loc}}} , but rather in the larger Besov space <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msubsup> <m:mi>B</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msubsup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>loc</m:mi> </m:msub> </m:math> {(B^{2s}_{p,2})_{\mathrm{loc}}} .

title: Uncountably Many Solutions for Nonlinear Helmholtz and Curl-Curl Equations
abstract: Abstract We obtain uncountably many solutions of nonlinear Helmholtz and curl-curl equations on the entire space using a fixed point approach. The constructed solutions are mildly localized as they lie in the essential spectrum of the corresponding linear operator. As a new auxiliary tool a limiting absorption principle for the curl-curl operator is proved.

title: Discrete Hardy-type Inequalities
abstract: Abstract This paper studies the Hardy-type inequalities on the discrete intervals. Firstly, two variational formulas for the optimal constants are introduced. Based on these formulas, an approximating procedure and the known basic estimates of the optimal constants are deduced. Thirdly, as the main innovation of this paper, an improved factor for the upper estimates is presented, which is smaller than the known one and is the best possible. Finally, some comparison results are included for comparing the optimal constants on different intervals.

title: Shadowing for Nonautonomous Dynamics
abstract: We prove that whenever a sequence of invertible and bounded operators $(A_m)_{m\in \mathbb{Z}}$ acting on a Banach space $X$ admits an exponential dichotomy and a sequence of differentiable maps $f_m \colon X\to X$, $m\in \mathbb{Z}$, has bounded and H\"{o}lder derivatives, the nonautonomous dynamics given by $x_{m+1}=A_mx_m+f_m(x_m)$, $m\in \mathbb{Z}$ has various shadowing properties. Hence, we extend recent results of Bernardes Jr. et al. in several directions. As a nontrivial application of our results, we give a new proof of the nonautonomous Grobman-Hartman theorem.

title: Reverse Stein‚ÄìWeiss Inequalities on the Upper Half Space and the Existence of Their Extremals
authors: Lu Chen; Guozhen Lu; Chunxia Tao
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper is four-fold. authors: Claudianor O. Alves; Jo√£o Marcos do √ì; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we deal with the singular perturbed fractional elliptic problem <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>V</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>z</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> $\varepsilon(-\Delta)^{1/2}{u}+V(z)u=f(u)$ in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> </m:math> $\mathbb{R}$ , where <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${(-\Delta)^{1/2}u}$ is the square root of the Laplacian and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>s</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${f(s)}$ has exponential critical growth. Under suitable conditions on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>s</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${f(s)}$ , we construct a localized bound state solution concentrating at an isolated component of the positive local minimum points of the potential of V as Œµ goes to 0.

title: Hardy‚ÄìAdams Inequalities on ‚Ñç2 √ó ‚Ñù n-2
authors: Xing Ma; Xumin Wang; Qiaohua Yang
abstract: Abstract Let <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñç</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{H}^{2}} be the hyperbolic space of dimension 2. Denote by <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñç</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>√ó</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {M^{n}=\mathbb{H}^{2}\times\mathbb{R}^{n-2}} the product manifold of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñç</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{H}^{2}} and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>3</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{n-2}(n\geq 3)} . In this paper we establish some sharp Hardy‚ÄìAdams inequalities on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {M^{n}} , though <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {M^{n}} is not with strictly negative sectional curvature. We also show that the sharp constant in the Poincar√©‚ÄìSobolev inequality on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {M^{n}} coincides with the best Sobolev constant, which is of independent interest.

title: Singular Finsler Double Phase Problems with Nonlinear Boundary Condition
authors: Csaba Farkas; Alessio Fiscella; Patrick Winkert
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study a singular Finsler double phase problem with a nonlinear boundary condition and perturbations that have a type of critical growth, even on the boundary. Based on variational methods in combination with truncation techniques, we prove the existence of at least one weak solution for this problem under very general assumptions. Even in the case when the Finsler manifold reduces to the Euclidean norm, our work is the first one dealing with a singular double phase problem and nonlinear boundary condition.

title: Normalized solutions for a class of scalar field equations involving mixed fractional Laplacians
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this article is to establish sharp conditions for the existence of normalized solutions to a class of scalar field equations involving mixed fractional Laplacians with different orders. This study includes the case when one operator is local and the other one is non-local. This type of equation arises in various fields ranging from biophysics to population dynamics. Due to the importance of these applications, this topic has very recently received an increasing interest. In this article, we provide a complete description of the existence/non-existence of ground state solutions using constrained variational approaches. This study addresses the mass subcritical, critical and supercritical cases. Our model presents some difficulties due to the ‚Äúconflict‚Äù between the different orders and requires a novel analysis, especially in the mass supercritical case. We believe that our results will open the door to other valuable contributions in this important field.

title: Sliding methods for dual fractional nonlinear divergence type parabolic equations and the Gibbons‚Äô conjecture
authors: Yahong Guo; Lingwei Ma; Zhenqiu Zhang
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the general dual fractional parabolic problem <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"><m:msubsup><m:mrow><m:mi>‚àÇ</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>Œ±</m:mi></m:mrow></m:msubsup><m:mi>u</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mo>+</m:mo><m:mi mathvariant="script">L</m:mi><m:mi>u</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mo>=</m:mo><m:mi>f</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>u</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow></m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mspace width="0.3333em"/><m:mspace width="0.3333em"/><m:mtext>in</m:mtext><m:mspace width="0.3333em"/><m:mspace width="0.3333em"/><m:msup><m:mrow><m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>n</m:mi></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mo>√ó</m:mo><m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi><m:mo>.</m:mo></m:math> ${\partial }_{t}^{\alpha }u\left(x,t\right)+\mathcal{L}u\left(x,t\right)=f\left(t,u\left(x,t\right)\right) \text{in} {\mathbb{R}}^{n}{\times}\mathbb{R}.$ We show that the bounded entire solution u satisfying certain one-direction asymptotic assumptions must be monotone increasing and one-dimensional symmetric along that direction under an appropriate decreasing condition on f . Our result here actually solves a well-known problem known as Gibbons‚Äô conjecture in the setting of the dual fractional parabolic equations. To overcome the difficulties caused by the nonlocal divergence type operator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"><m:mi mathvariant="script">L</m:mi></m:math> $\mathcal{L}$ and the Marchaud time derivative <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"><m:msubsup><m:mrow><m:mi>‚àÇ</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>Œ±</m:mi></m:mrow></m:msubsup></m:math> ${\partial }_{t}^{\alpha }$ , we introduce several new ideas. First, we derive a general weighted average inequality corresponding to the nonlocal operator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"><m:mi mathvariant="script">L</m:mi></m:math> $\mathcal{L}$ , which plays a fundamental bridging role in proving maximum principles in unbounded domains. Then we combine these two essential ingredients to carry out the sliding method to establish the Gibbons‚Äô conjecture. It is worth noting that our results are novel even for a special case of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"><m:mi mathvariant="script">L</m:mi></m:math> $\mathcal{L}$ , the fractional Laplacian (‚àíŒî) s , and the approach developed in this paper will be adapted to a broad range of nonlocal parabolic equations involving more general Marchaud time derivatives and more general non-local elliptic operators.

We prove the positive solutions are monotonic increasing in the x 1 -direction assuming u ( x ) grows no faster than | x | Œ≥ with Œ≥ ‚àà (0, 2 s ) for | x | large. To start with, we develop a maximum principle on the narrow region. Then we apply a direct method of the moving planes for the fractional Laplacian to derive the monotonicity. As an application of the monotonicity result, we use it to prove nonexistence of bounded positive solutions in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msubsup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msubsup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}_{+}^{n}$ for f ( u ) = u p , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mfenced close=")" open="("> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:mfenced> </m:mrow> </m:math> $p\in \left(1,\frac{n-1+2s}{n-1-2s}\right)$ .

title: A note on the classification of positive solutions to the critical p-Laplace equation in R n ${\mathbb{R}}^{n}$
abstract: Abstract In this note, we obtain a classification result for positive solutions to the critical p -Laplace equation in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{n}$ with n ‚â• 4 and p > p n for some number <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mfenced close=")" open="("> <m:mrow> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:mfenced> </m:math> ${p}_{n}\in \left(\frac{n}{3},\frac{n+1}{3}\right)$ such that <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚àº</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:math> ${p}_{n}\sim \frac{n}{3}+\frac{1}{n}$ , which improves upon a similar result obtained by Ou (‚ÄúOn the classification of entire solutions to the critical p -Laplace equation,‚Äù 2022, arXiv:2210.05141) under the condition <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:math> $p\ge \frac{n+1}{3}$ .

title: Principal spectral theory and asymptotic behavior of the spectral bound for partially degenerate nonlocal dispersal systems
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper is to investigate the principal spectral theory and asymptotic behavior of the spectral bound for cooperative nonlocal dispersal systems, specifically focusing on the case where partial diffusion coefficients are zero, referred to as the partially degenerate case. We propose two sufficient conditions that ensure the existence of the principal eigenvalue in these partially degenerate systems. Additionally, we study the asymptotic behavior of the spectral bound for nonlocal dispersal operators with small and large diffusion coefficients, considering both non-degenerate and partially degenerate cases. Notably, we find a threshold-type result as the diffusion coefficients tend towards infinity in the partially degenerate case. Finally, we apply these findings to discuss the asymptotic behavior of the basic reproduction ratio in a viral diffusion model.

title: Fujita‚Äôs Exponent for a Semilinear Wave Equation with Linear Damping
abstract: Abstract We discuss the critical exponent problem for the semilinear wave equation with linear damping u tt +(-1) m |x| Œ± Œî m u + u t = f(t,x)|u| p + w(t,x), t > 0, x ‚àà‚Ñù n , and show that it coincides with the Fujita exponent for the heat equation with the same nonlinearity.

title: Symmetry of C<sup>1</sup> Solutions of p-Laplace Equations in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract In this paper we consider positive C 1 solutions of the equation - div(|Du| p-2 Du)= f(u) in ‚Ñù N , vanishing at infinity, in the case 1 < p ‚â§ 2, f locally Lipschitz continuous in (0, ‚àû). We prove that the solutions are radially symmetric under two different sets of assumptions on the behaviour of f near zero. In the first case we assume that f is nonincreasing in (0, s 0 ), s 0 > 0, and improve a previous result of the authors and Pacella [7] where the symmetry was proved under the hypothesis u ‚àà C 1 (‚Ñù N ) ‚ãÇ W 1,p (‚Ñù N ). In the second case, previously studied when p = 2, we assume that f(u) = O(u Œ±+1 ) (u ‚Üí O), and prove the radial symmetry of the solution u, provided at infinity with m(Œ±+2-p) > p. These results extend to pLaplace equations, 1 < p < 2, analogous symmetry results previously known in the case of strictly elliptic equations. The proofs exploit some Poincar√© and Hardy-Sobolev type inequalities

title: Asymptotic Estimates and Qualitative Properties of an Elliptic Problem in Dimension Two
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a semilinear elliptic problem on a bounded domain in ‚Ñù 2 with large exponent in the nonlinear term. We consider positive solutions obtained by minimizing suitable functionals. We prove some asymptotic estimates which enable us to associate a ‚Äúlimit problem‚Äù to the initial one. Using these estimates we prove some qualitative properties of the solutions, namely characterization of the level sets and nondegeneracy.

title: Initial trace of positive solutions to semilinear parabolic inequalities
abstract: Abstract We study the existence and properties of the initial trace, at t = 0, of positive solutions of u t - ‚àÜu + g(x, t, u) ‚â• 0 in Œ© √ó (0, T), where g(x, t, u) > 0 for (x, t ) ‚àà Œ© √ó (0, T) and u > 0. We prove that, under some general conditions on g , this initial trace is a Borel measure (which may blow up on compact sets). In addition we derive pointwise estimates for the blow up of solutions at initial singular points. Finally these results are applied to the cases g(., t, r) = t Œ± |r| q-1 r (Œ± > 0 ) , and g(., t, r ) = e -1/t |r| q-1 r. In this last case we exhibit a new type of full initial blow-up.

title: Existence of Multi-Bump Solutions For a Class of Quasilinear Problems
abstract: Abstract Using variational methods we establish existence of multi-bump solutions for the following class of quasilinear problems -Œî p u + (ŒªV(x) + Z(x))u p-1 = f(u); u > 0 in ‚Ñù N where Œî p u is the p-Laplacian operator, 2 ‚â§ p < N, Œª ‚àà (0, ‚àû), f is a continuous function with subcritical growth and V,Z : ‚Ñù N ‚Üí ‚Ñù are continuous functions verifying some hypothesis.

title: Asymptotic Behaviour of the Gradient of Large Solutions to Some Nonlinear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract If h is a nondecreasing real valued function and 0 ‚â§ q ‚â§ 2, we analyse the boundary behaviour of the gradient of any solution u of ‚àíŒîu + h(u) + |‚àáu| q = f in a smooth N-dimensional domain Œ© with the condition that u tends to infinity when x tends to ‚àÇŒ©. We give precise expressions of the blow-up which, in particular, point out the fact that the phenomenon occurs essentially in the normal direction to ‚àÇŒ©. Motivated by the blow-up argument in our proof, we also give a symmetry result for some related problems in the half space.

title: Solitary Waves in Abelian Gauge Theories
abstract: Abstract Abelian gauge theories consist of a class of field equations which provide a model for the interaction between matter and electromagnetic fields. In this paper we analyze the existence of solitary waves for these theories. We assume that the lower order term W is positive and we prove the existence of solitary waves if the coupling between matter and electromagnetic field is small. We point out that the positiveness assumption on W implies that the energy is positive: this fact makes these theories more suitable to model physical phenomena.

title: Periodic Solutions of Pendulum-Like Hamiltonian Systems in the Plane
abstract: Abstract By the use of a generalized version of the Poincar√©-Birkhoff fixed point theorem, we prove the existence of at least two periodic solutions for a class of Hamiltonian systems in the plane, having in mind the forced pendulum equation as a particular case. Our approach is closely related to the one used by Franks in [15], but the proof remains at a more elementary level.

title: Morse Decomposition of Attractors for Non-autonomous Dynamical Systems
authors: Tom√°s Caraballo; Juan Jara; Jos√© A. Langa; Zhenxin Liu
abstract: Abstract A Morse decomposition of a global attractor describes its internal dynamics, i.e., the dynamics on invariant compact sets in the attractor and the connections between them. When we deal with non-autonomous dynamical systems, the concept of pullback attractor for the associated skew-product flow appears as a powerful tool to analyze the asymptotic behaviour of these systems. In this paper we develop a Morse decomposition theory for pullback attractors of non-autonomous dynamical systems in Banach spaces with compact base space which, in particular, defines a (non-autonomous) Lyapunov functional on the attractor describing a decaying energy level on the evolution of trajectories.

title: Pairs of Nodal Solutions for a Class of Nonlinear Problems with One-sided Growth Conditions
abstract: Abstract Boundary value problems of Sturm-Liouville and periodic type for the second order nonlinear ODE u ∫ + Œªf(t, u) = 0 are considered. Multiplicity results are obtained, for Œª positive and large, under suitable growth restrictions on f(t, u) of superlinear type at u = 0 and of sublinear type at u = ‚àû. Only one-sided growth conditions are required. Applications are given to the equation u ∫ + Œªq(t)f(u) = 0, allowing also a weight function q(t) of nonconstant sign.

title: A Liouville Type Theorem for Poly-harmonic System with Dirichlet Boundary Conditions in a Half Space
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the following poly-harmonic system with Dirichlet boundary conditions in a half space ‚Ñù n + : where for i = 1, 2. First, we show that, under some mild growth conditions, (0.1) is equivalent to the IE system where is the Green‚Äôs function in ‚Ñù n + with the same Dirichlet boundary conditions. Then, inspired by the work [12] of Y. Fang and W. Chen on the Dirichlet problem for (‚àíŒî) m u = up in ‚Ñù n + , we use method of moving planes in integral forms to prove the nonexistence of nontrivial nonnegative solutions for IE system (0.2), and as a consequence, we derive the nonexistence of nontrivial nonnegative classical solutions for problem (0.1).

title: Nonuniform Hyperbolicity and Admissibility
authors: Lu√≠s Barreira; Cl√†ud√¨a Valls; Davor Dragiƒçeviƒá
abstract: Abstract For a nonautonomous dynamics defined by a sequence of linear operators, we consider the notion of an exponential dichotomy with respect to a sequence of norms and we characterize it completely in terms of the admissibility in pairs of spaces (‚Ñì p , ‚Ñì q ), with p and q not necessarily equal. This includes the notion of a nonuniform exponential dichotomy as a very special case. Moreover, we consider a general noninvertible dynamics and a strong nonuniform exponential behavior. The latter is the typical situation from the point of view of smooth ergodic theory.

title: Doubly Critical Problems Involving Fractional Laplacians in ‚Ñù N
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we show the existence of nontrivial solutions for doubly critical nonlocal elliptic problems in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} involving fractional Laplacians. Our approach is elementary without the use of neither the concentration-compactness principle nor the extension argument developed in [4].

title: Entire Solutions to Nonlinear Scalar Field Equations with Indefinite Linear Part
abstract: Abstract We consider the stationary semilinear Schr√∂dinger equation ‚àíŒîu + a(x)u = f (x, u), u ‚àà H 1 (‚Ñù N ), where a and f are continuous functions converging to some limits a ‚àû > 0 and f ‚àû = f ‚àû (u) as |x| ‚Üí ‚àû. In the indefinite setting where the Schr√∂dinger operator ‚àíŒî + a has negative eigenvalues, we combine a reduction method with a topological argument to prove the existence of a solution of our problem under weak one-sided asymptotic estimates. The minimal energy level need not be attained in this case. In a second part of the paper, we prove the existence of ground-state solutions under more restrictive assumptions on a and f . We stress that for some of our results we also allow zero to lie in the spectrum of ‚àíŒî+a.

title: Pseudorelativistic Hartree Equation with General Nonlinearity: Existence, Non-existence and Variational Identities
abstract: Abstract We prove several existence and non existence results of solitary waves for a class of nonlinear pseudo-relativistic Hartree equations with general nonlinearities. We use variational methods and some new variational identities involving the half Laplacian.

title: Prescribing Gaussian and Geodesic Curvature on Disks
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the problem of prescribing the Gaussian and geodesic curvature on a disk and its boundary, respectively, via a conformal change of the metric. This leads us to a Liouville-type equation with a non-linear Neumann boundary condition. We address the question of existence by setting the problem in a variational framework which seems to be completely new in the literature. We are able to find minimizers under symmetry assumptions.

title: Weighted Gagliardo‚ÄìNirenberg Inequalities Involving BMO Norms and Solvability of Strongly Coupled Parabolic Systems
abstract: Abstract New weighted Gagliardo‚ÄìNirenberg inequalities are introduced together with applications to the local/global existence of solutions to nonlinear strongly coupled and uniform parabolic systems. Much weaker sufficient conditions than those existing in literature for solvability of these systems will be established.

title: Analyticity and Existence of the Keller‚ÄìSegel‚ÄìNavier‚ÄìStokes Equations in Critical Besov Spaces
authors: Minghua Yang; Zunwei Fu; Suying Liu
abstract: Abstract This paper deals with the Cauchy problem to the Keller‚ÄìSegel model coupled with the incompressible 3-D Navier‚ÄìStokes equations. Based on so-called Gevrey regularity estimates, which are motivated by the works of Foias and Temam [20], we prove that the solutions are analytic for a small interval of time with values in a Gevrey class of functions. As a consequence of Gevrey estimates, we particularly imply higher-order derivatives of solutions in Besov and Lebesgue spaces. Due to the nonlocality of the fractional Laplacian operator, we need to study the corresponding harmonic extension problem.

title: Liouville Theorem for a Fourth Order H√©non Equation
abstract: Abstract We examine the following fourth order H√©non equation Œî 2 u = |x| Œ± u p in ‚Ñù N , where 0 < Œ±. Define the Hardy-Sobolev exponent . We show that in dimension N = 5 there are no positive bounded classical solutions provided 1 < p < p4(Œ±).

title: Regularity Properties for a Class of Non-uniformly Elliptic Isaacs Operators
abstract: Abstract We consider the elliptic differential operator defined as the sum of the minimum and the maximum eigenvalue of the Hessian matrix, which can be viewed as a degenerate elliptic Isaacs operator, in dimension larger than two. Despite of nonlinearity, degeneracy, non-concavity and non-convexity, such an operator generally enjoys the qualitative properties of the Laplace operator, as for instance maximum and comparison principles, ABP and Harnack inequalities, Liouville theorems for subsolutions or supersolutions. Existence and uniqueness for the Dirichlet problem are also proved as well as local and global H√∂lder estimates for viscosity solutions. All results are discussed for a more general class of weighted partial trace operators.

title: On a Singular Robin Problem with Convection Terms
authors: Umberto Guarnotta; S. Marano; Dumitru Motreanu
abstract: Abstract In this paper, the existence of smooth positive solutions to a Robin boundary-value problem with non-homogeneous differential operator and reaction given by a nonlinear convection term plus a singular one is established. Proofs chiefly exploit sub-super-solution and truncation techniques, set-valued analysis, recursive methods, nonlinear regularity theory, as well as fixed point arguments. A uniqueness result is also presented.

title: Combined Effects of Concave-Convex Nonlinearities in a Fourth-Order Problem with Variable Exponent
abstract: Abstract We study two classes of nonhomogeneous elliptic problems with Dirichlet boundary condition and involving a fourth-order differential operator with variable exponent and power-type nonlinearities. The first result of this paper establishes the existence of a nontrivial weak solution in the case of a small perturbation of the right-hand side. The proof combines variational methods, including the Ekeland variational principle and the mountain pass theorem of Ambrosetti and Rabinowitz. Next we consider a very related eigenvalue problem and we prove the existence of nontrivial weak solutions for large values of the parameter. The direct method of the calculus of variations, estimates of the levels of the associated energy functional and basic properties of the Lebesgue and Sobolev spaces with variable exponent have an important role in our arguments.

title: Some Remarks on Profile Decomposition Theorems
abstract: Abstract In this paper we present, in the case of Sobolev spaces, some concentration-compactness theorems, nowadays known as profile decomposition theorems, which imply the most known results in literature, clarifying the connections between the different versions.

title: Existence of Solutions to Fractional p-Laplacian Systems with Homogeneous Nonlinearities of Critical Sobolev Growth

title: The Œµ - Œµ<sup>Œ≤</sup> Property in the Isoperimetric Problem with Double Density, and the Regularity of Isoperimetric Sets
abstract: We prove the validity of the $\varepsilon-\varepsilon^Œ≤$ property in the isoperimetric problem with double density, generalising the known properties for the case of single density. As a consequence, we derive regularity for isoperimetric sets.

title: Sharp Hardy Identities and Inequalities on Carnot Groups
authors: Joshua Flynn; Nguyen Lam; Guozhen Lu
abstract: Abstract In this paper we establish general weighted Hardy identities for several subelliptic settings including Hardy identities on the Heisenberg group, Carnot groups with respect to a homogeneous gauge and Carnot‚ÄìCarath√©odory metric, general nilpotent groups, and certain families of H√∂rmander vector fields. We also introduce new weighted uncertainty principles in these settings. This is done by continuing the program initiated by [N. Lam, G. Lu and L. Zhang, Factorizations and Hardy‚Äôs-type identities and inequalities on upper half spaces, Calc. Var. Partial Differential Equations 58 2019, 6, Paper No. 183; N. Lam, G. Lu and L. Zhang, Geometric Hardy‚Äôs inequalities with general distance functions, J. Funct. Anal. 279 2020, 8, Article ID 108673] of using the Bessel pairs introduced by [N. Ghoussoub and A. Moradifam, Functional Inequalities: New Perspectives and New Applications, Math. Surveys Monogr. 187, American Mathematical Society, Providence, 2013] to obtain Hardy identities. Using these identities, we are able to improve significantly existing Hardy inequalities in the literature in the aforementioned subelliptic settings. In particular, we establish the Hardy identities and inequalities in the spirit of [H. Brezis and J. L. V√°zquez, Blow-up solutions of some nonlinear elliptic problems, Rev. Mat. Univ. Complut. Madrid 10 1997, 443‚Äì469] and [H. Brezis and M. Marcus, Hardy‚Äôs inequalities revisited. Dedicated to Ennio De Giorgi, Ann. Sc. Norm. Super. Pisa Cl. Sci. (4) 25 1997, 1‚Äì2, 217‚Äì237] in these settings.

title: Periodic Solutions of Singular Nonlinear Perturbations of the Ordinary p-Laplacian
abstract: Abstract Using some recent extensions of upper and lower solutions techniques and continuation theorems to the periodic solutions of quasilinear equations of p-Laplacian type, we prove the existence of positive periodic solutions of equations of the form (|x π| p-2 x π) π + f(x)x π + g(x) = h(t) with p > 1, f arbitrary and g singular at 0. This extends results of Lazer and Solimini for the undamped ordinary differential case.

title: Existence and Uniqueness of Positive Large Solutions to Some Cooperative Elliptic Systems
abstract: Abstract In this work we consider positive solutions to cooperative elliptic systems of the form -Œîu = Œªu - u 2 + buœÖ, -ŒîœÖ = ŒºœÖ - œÖ 2 + cuœÖ a bounded smooth domain Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N (Œª, Œº ‚àà ‚Ñù, b, c > 0) which blow up on the boundary ‚àÇŒ©, that is u(x), v(x) ‚Üí ‚àû as dist(x, ‚àÇŒ©) ‚Üí 0. We show existence and nonexistence of solutions, and give sufficient conditions for uniqueness. We also provide an exact estimate of the behaviour of the solutions near the boundary in terms of dist(x, ‚àÇŒ©).

title: Non-simultaneous Blow-up in a Nonlinear Parabolic System
abstract: Abstract We prove the existence of a nontrivially coupled parabolic system such that one of its components becomes unbounded at a finite time while the other remains bounded, a situation that we denote as non-simultaneous blow-up. Our system consists of two porous medium equations with coupled nonlinear flux boundary conditions. As a preliminary step, we will obtain a necessary and sufficient condition for blow-up. Next we characterize completely, in the case of increasing in time solutions, the set of parameters appearing in the system for which nonsimultaneous blow-up indeed occurs. In the course of our proofs we will obtain a necessary and sufficient condition for the blow-up of solutions to general porous medium type equations on the half-line with a prescribed flux at the boundary blowing up at a finite time, a result of independent interest.

title: Some Elliptic Problems With Degenerate Coercivity
abstract: Abstract In this paper we are interested in existence of solutions for some nonlinear elliptic equations with principal part having degenerate coercivity. The model case is with Œ© bounded open subset of ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 2 and f a datum in some Lebesgue space.

title: Asymptotic Profile for a Fourth Order PDE with Critical Exponential Growth in Dimension Four
abstract: Abstract Let Œ© be a smooth domain of R4. In this paper, we consider a family (u ‚àä ) ‚àä>0 of positive solutions in C 4 (Œ©ÃÖ) to the equation where Œª ‚àà ‚Ñù. Assuming that u ‚àä ‚Üí 0 weakly in H 2 2,0 (Œ©) while sup Œ© u ‚àä ‚Üí‚àû, we describe the asymptotics of u ‚àä as ‚àä ‚Üí 0.

title: Nodal Solutions for a Singularly Perturbed Nonlinear Elliptic Problem on Riemannian Manifolds
abstract: Abstract Let (M, g) be a smooth compact Riemannian N‚àímanifold, N ‚â• 2. We show that if the scalar curvature of g is not constant, the problem ‚àíŒµ 2 ‚àÜ g u + u = u p‚àí1 in M has a positive solution with two positive peaks Œæ 1 Œµ and Œæ 2 Œµ , and a sign changing solution with one positive peak Œ∑ 1 Œµ and one negative peak Œ∑ 2 Œµ , such that as Œµ goes to zero Scal g (Œæ 1 Œµ ), Scal g (Œ∑ 1 Œµ ) ‚Üí Scal g (Œæ) and Scal g (Œæ 2 Œµ ), Scal g (Œ∑ 2 Œµ ) ‚Üí Scal g (Œæ). Here p > 2 if N = 2 and

title: Orbital Stability Property for Coupled Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equations
authors: Liliane A. Maia; Eugenio Montefusco; Benedetta Pellacci
abstract: Abstract Orbital stability property for weakly coupled nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equations is investigated. Different families of orbitally stable standing waves solutions will be found, generated by different classes of solutions of the associated elliptic problem. In particular, orbitally stable standing waves can be generated by least action solutions, but also by solutions with one trivial component whether or not they are ground states. Moreover, standing waves with components propagating with the same frequencies are orbitally stable if generated by vector solutions of a suitable Schr√∂dinger weakly coupled system, even if they are not ground states.

title: Periodic Orbits of Radially Symmetric Systems with a Singularity: the Repulsive Case
abstract: Abstract We study radially symmetric systems with a singularity of repulsive type. In the presence of a radially symmetric periodic forcing, we show the existence of three distinct families of subharmonic solutions: One oscillates radially, one rotates around the origin with small angular momentum, and the third one with both large angular momentum and large amplitude. The proofs are carried out by the use of topological degree theory.

title: Multiple Sign Changing Solutions of Nonlinear Elliptic Problems in Exterior Domains
abstract: Abstract We consider the problem ‚àíŒîu + (V ‚àû + V(x))u = |u| p‚àí2 u, u ‚àà H 0 1 (Œ©), where Œ© is an exterior domain in ‚Ñù N , V ‚àû > 0, V ‚àà C 0 (‚Ñù N ), inf ‚ÑùN V > ‚àíV ‚àû and V(x) ‚Üí 0 as |x| ‚Üí ‚àû. Under symmetry conditions on Œ© and V, and some assumptions on the decay of V at infinity, we show that there is an effect of the topology of the orbit space of certain subsets of the domain on the number of low energy sign changing solutions to this problem.

title: Symmetrization for Neumann Anisotropic Problems and Related Questions
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove some comparison results for Neumann elliptic problems whose model involves the anisotropic Laplacian Œî H u = div (H(Du)H Œæ (Du)), where H is a positively homogenous convex function. Finally, we find a Poincar√© inequality in the anisotropic setting.

title: Multiple Solutions for the p(x)‚àí Laplace Operator with Critical Growth
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is to extend previous results regarding the multiplicity of solutions for quasilinear elliptic problems with critical growth to the variable exponent case. We prove, in the spirit of [4], the existence of at least three nontrivial solutions to the quasilinear elliptic equation ‚àíŒî p(x) u = |u| q(x)‚àí2 u + Œª f (x, u) in a smooth bounded domain Œ© of R N with homogeneous Dirichlet boundary conditions on ‚àÇŒ©. We assume that {q(x) = p‚àó(x)} ‚â† √∏, where p‚àó(x) = Np(x)/(N ‚àí p(x)) is the critical Sobolev exponent for variable exponents and Œî p(x) u = div(|‚àáu| p(x)‚àí2 ‚àáu) is the p(x)‚àílaplacian. The proof is based on variational arguments and the extension of concentration compactness method for variable exponent spaces.

title: On the Orbital Stability of Standing-Wave Solutions to a Coupled Non-Linear Klein-Gordon Equation
abstract: Abstract We show the existence of standing-wave solutions to a coupled non-linear Klein-Gordon equation. Our solutions are obtained as minimizers of the energy under a two-charges constraint. We prove that the ground state is stable and that standing-waves are orbitally stable under a non-degeneracy assumption.

title: Nonlinear Resonance: a Comparison Between Landesman-Lazer and Ahmad-Lazer-Paul Conditions
abstract: Abstract We show that the Ahmad-Lazer-Paul condition for resonant problems is more general than the Landesman-Lazer one, discussing some relations with other existence conditions, as well. As a consequence, such a relation holds, for example, when considering resonant boundary value problems associated with linear elliptic operators, the p-Laplacian and, in the scalar case, with an asymmetric oscillator.

title: Existence of Bound States for Schr√∂dinger-Newton Type Systems
abstract: Abstract In this paper we consider the following elliptic system in ‚Ñù 3 where K(x), Œ±(x) are non-negative real functions defined on ‚Ñù 3 so that . When K(x) ‚â° K ‚àû and Œ±(x) ‚â° Œ± ‚àû we have already proved the existence of a radial ground state of the above system. Here, by using a new version of the moving plane method, we show that all positive solutions of the above system with K(x) ‚â° K ‚àû and a(x) ‚â° Œ± ‚àû are radially symmetric and the linearized operator around a radial ground state is also non-degenerate. Using these results we further prove, under additional assumptions on K(x) and Œ±(x), but not requiring any symmetry property on them, the existence of a positive solution for the system.

title: Variations on Poincar√©-Miranda‚Äôs Theorem
abstract: Abstract We give an elementary proof of Poincar√©-Miranda‚Äôs theorem based upon basic exterior calculus, and apply it to prove its geometric version due to Hurewicz. We state and prove a version of Poincar√©-Miranda‚Äôs theorem on the Hilbert‚Äôs cube in l 2 .

title: Liouvillian First Integrals for Generalized Li√©nard Polynomial Differential Systems
abstract: Abstract We study the Liouvillian first integrals for the generalized Li√©nard polynomial differential systems of the form x π = y, y π = -g(x) - f(x)y, where g(x) and f(x) are arbitrary polynomials such that 2 ‚â§ deg g ‚â§ deg f.

title: Multiplicity Results for an Anisotropic Equation with Subcritical or Critical Growth
authors: Giovany M. Figueiredo; Jo√£o R. Santos J√∫nior; Ant√≥nio Su√°rez
abstract: Abstract In this work we show some multiplicity results for the anisotropic equation where Œ© ‚äÇ‚Ñù N is a bounded smooth domain, 1 < p 1 ‚â§ p 2 ‚â§ . . . ‚â§ p N and Œª is a positive parameter. Using genus theory, we study the subcritical case g Œª (u) = Œª|u| q‚àí2 u with q ‚àà (1, p N ) and the critical case g Œª (u) = Œª|u| q‚àí2 u +|u| p*‚àí2 u with q ‚àà (1, p 1 ) and p* = N| pÃÖ/(N‚àípÃÖ), with pÃÖ the harmonic mean of the p i ‚Äôs.

title: Asymptotic Properties of Ground States of Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Equations With H<sup>1</sup>-Subcritical Exponent
abstract: Abstract We are concerned with the asymptotic behavior of positive radial solutions for a class of quasilinear elliptic equation arising from plasma physics. By the variational argument and dual approach, we show the asymptotic uniqueness and non-degeneracy of the ground state.

title: On a Parametric Nonlinear Dirichlet Problem with Subdiffusive and Equidiffusive Reaction
abstract: Abstract We study a nonlinear parametric elliptic equation (nonlinear eigenvalue problem) driven by a nonhomogeneous differential operator. Our setting incorporates equations driven by the p-Laplacian, the (p, q)-Laplacian, and the generalized p-mean curvature differential operator. Applying variational methods we show that for Œª > 0 (the parameter) sufficiently large the problem has at least three nontrivial smooth solutions whereby one is positive, one is negative and the last one has changing sign (nodal). In the particular case of (p, 2)-equations, using Morse theory, we produce another nodal solution for a total of four nontrivial smooth solutions.

title: Liouville-type Theorems for Polyharmonic H√©non-Lane-Emden System
abstract: Abstract We study Liouville-type theorem for polyharmonic H√©non-Lane-Emden system (‚àíŒî) m u = |x| a v p , (‚àíŒî) m v = |x| b u q when m, p, q ‚â• 1, pq ‚â† 1, and a, b ‚â• 0. It is a natural conjecture that the nonexistence of positive solutions should be true if and only if (N + a)/(p + 1)+ (N + b)/(q + 1) > N ‚àí 2m. It is shown by Fazly[6] that the conjecture holds for radial solutions in all dimensions and for classical solutions in dimension N ‚â§ 2m + 1. We here give some partial results in dimension N ‚â• 2m + 2.

title: Ambrosetti‚ÄìProdi Periodic Problem Under Local Coercivity Conditions

The classical framework of Fabry, Mawhin and Nkashama, related to the Ambrosetti‚ÄìProdi periodic problem, is modified to include conditions without uniformity, in order to achieve the same multiplicity result under local coercivity conditions on g . Analogous results are also obtained for Neumann boundary conditions.

title: Infinitely Many Nodal Solutions for Nonlinear Nonhomogeneous Robin Problems
authors: Nikolaos S. Papageorgiou; Vicen≈£iu D. RƒÉdulescu
abstract: Abstract We consider a nonlinear Robin problem driven by a nonhomogeneous differential operator which incorporates the p -Laplacian as special case. Using variational tools, we show that the problem has a whole sequence of distinct nodal (that is, sign-changing) solutions.

title: Radial Solutions of the Dirichlet Problem for the Prescribed Mean Curvature Equation in a Robertson-Walker Spacetime
authors: Daniel de la Fuente; Alfonso Romero; Pedro J. Torres
abstract: Abstract We consider the prescribed mean curvature problem of spacelike graphs in Robertson- Walker spacetimes of flat fiber with homogeneous Dirichlet conditions on an Euclidean ball. Under reasonable assumptions, it is shown that every possible solution must be radially symmetric. Besides, an existence result for a singular nonlinear equation is proved by making use of the classical Schauder fixed point Theorem. The results are applied to realistic examples of Robertson-Walker spacetimes.
