Considered here are well-posedness issues for the initial-value problem for the regularized equation posed on all of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:math> $\mathbb{R}$ .

title: Frontmatter
A curl-free improvement of the Rellich‚ÄìHardy inequality with weight
abstract: Abstract We consider the sharpness of functional inequality which we call Rellich‚ÄìHardy inequality with power weight for curl-free vector fields on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{N}$ . This inequality can be considered as an intermediate between Hardy‚ÄìLeray and Rellich‚ÄìLeray inequalities and its best constant was originally found by Tertikas-Zographopoulos (‚ÄúBest constants in the Hardy‚ÄìRellich inequalities and related improvements,‚Äù Adv. Math. , vol. 209, no. 2, pp. 407‚Äì459, 2007) for unconstrained fields. Under the curl-free condition, we compute a new best value of the constant in the same inequality and show it is unattainable. This paper is a sequel to (N. Hamamoto and F. Takahashi, ‚ÄúSharp Hardy‚ÄìLeray and Rellich‚ÄìLeray inequalities for curl-free vector fields,‚Äù Math. Ann. , vol. 379, no. 1, pp. 719‚Äì742, 2021, N. Hamamoto and F. Takahashi, ‚ÄúSharp Hardy-Leray inequality for curl-free fields with a remainder term,‚Äù J. Funct. Anal. , vol. 280, no. 1, 2021, Art. no. 108790).

title: Invariance of intrinsic hypercontractivity under perturbation of Schr√∂dinger operators
abstract: Abstract A Schr√∂dinger operator that is bounded below and has a unique positive ground state can be transformed into a Dirichlet form operator by the ground state transformation. If the resulting Dirichlet form operator is hypercontractive, Davies and Simon call the Schr√∂dinger operator ‚Äúintrinsically hypercontractive‚Äù. I will show that if one adds a suitable potential onto an intrinsically hypercontractive Schr√∂dinger operator it remains intrinsically hypercontractive. The proof uses a fortuitous relation between the WKB equation and logarithmic Sobolev inequalities. All bounds are dimension independent. The main theorem will be applied to several examples.

title: Talenti comparison results and rigidity results for anisotropic p-Laplacian operator with Robin boundary conditions
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we first establish the Talenti comparison principle for anisotropic p -Laplacian equation with Robin boundary conditions. This achievement not only extends classical Talenti comparison result for Laplacian equation with Robin boundary conditions in (A. Alvino, C. Nitsch, and C. Trombetti, ‚ÄúA Talenti comparison result for solutions to elliptic problems with Robin boundary conditions,‚Äù Commun. Pure Appl. Math. , vol. 76, no. 3, pp. 585‚Äì603, 2023, doi:10.1002/cpa.22090), but also for the anisotropic Laplacian cases in (R. Sannipoli, ‚ÄúComparison results for solutions to the anisotropic Laplacian with Robin boundary conditions,‚Äù Nonlinear Anal. , vol. 214, no. 112615, 2022, doi:10.1016/j.na.2021.112615). Furthermore, we also obtain the rigidity for this kind of Talenti comparison principle. This naturally covers the rigidity for Talenti comparison principle involving anisotropic Laplacian operator which has not been proved before. As an application of rigidity result for anisotropic Talenti comparison principle, we furthermore establish the rigidity of anisotropic Faber‚ÄìKrahn inequality with Robin boundary conditions and naturally solve the rigidity for classical Faber‚ÄìKrahn inequality with Robin boundary condition established by Alvino-Nitsch-Trombetti in (A. Alvino, C. Nitsch, and C. Trombetti, ‚ÄúA Talenti comparison result for solutions to elliptic problems with Robin boundary conditions,‚Äù Commun. Pure Appl. Math. , vol. 76, no. 3, pp. 585‚Äì603, 2023, doi:10.1002/cpa.22090). Significantly, our results also answer some open problems contained in (A. L. Masiello and G. Paoli, ‚ÄúA rigidity result for the Robin torsion problem,‚Äù J. Geom. Anal. , vol. 33, no. 5, p. 149, 2023, doi:10.1007/s12220-023-01202-3) and (A. L. Masiello and G. Paoli, ‚ÄúRigidity results for the p-Laplacian poisson problem with robin boundary conditions,‚Äù J. Optim. Theor. Appl. , vol. 202, pp. 628‚Äì648, 2024, doi:10.1007/s10957-024-02442-1).

title: Existence and nonexistence results for a class of pseudo-parabolic equations with combined logarithmic nonlinearities
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the existence and nonexistence results for a class of pseudo-parabolic equations with combined logarithmic nonlinearities Œ≥ | u | p- 2 u log | u | + u log | u |, where Œ≥ > 0 and p > 2 satisfy certain conditions. Employing the key ingredients in modified potential well method, we obtain the existence of a global weak solution and the finite time blow-up phenomenon for low initial energy and critical initial energy. We show that the global weak solution has exponential decay. An interesting observation is that the higher power term Œ≥ | u | p- 2 u log | u | ( p > 2) breaks the infinite time blow-up phenomenon of u log | u | with appropriate coefficient Œ≥ . Furthermore, an upper bound and a lower bound for the blow-up time are estimated. We give sufficient conditions for global existence and blow-up result of weak solutions in the case of high initial energy. Then we take account of the case when the initial energy is independent of the well depth. In addition, we show that the solution to the same pseudo-parabolic equation with only logarithmic nonlinearity u log | u | blows up at infinity.

title: Hardy inequalities with Bessel pair for Dunkl operator
authors: Duy T. Q. Nguyen; Phong Van Nguyen; Hien Thi Pham
abstract: Abstract Using the notion of a Bessel pair, we study the Hardy type inequalities in the setting of Dunkl operator. We also establish a general symmetrization principle for weighted Hardy type inequalities with Dunkl operator in the situation that the standard Schwarz symmetrization is not applicable.

title: On Twisted Spacetimes: a new class of Galilean cosmological models
authors: Daniel de la Fuente; Rafael M. Rubio; Jose Torrente-Teruel
abstract: Abstract Within the generalized Newton-Cartan theory, Galilean Twisted spacetimes are introduced as dual models of the well-known relativistic twisted spacetimes. As a natural generalization, torqued vector fields in Galilean spacetimes are defined, showing that the local structure of a Galilean spacetime admitting a timelike torqued vector field is given by a Twisted spacetime. In addition, several results assuring the global splitting as Twisted spacetime are obtained. On the other hand, completeness of free falling observers is studied, as well as geodesic completeness.

title: Preface for the special issue on geometric and functional inequalities and applications
On singularly perturbed (p, N)-Laplace Schr√∂dinger equation with logarithmic nonlinearity
authors: Deepak Kumar Mahanta; Tuhina Mukherjee; Patrick Winkert
abstract: Abstract This article focuses on the study of the existence, multiplicity and concentration behavior of ground states as well as the qualitative aspects of positive solutions for a ( p , N )-Laplace Schr√∂dinger equation with logarithmic nonlinearity and critical exponential nonlinearity in the sense of Trudinger-Moser in the whole Euclidean space <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{N}$ . Through the use of smooth variational methods, penalization techniques, and the application of the Lusternik‚ÄìSchnirelmann category theory, we establish a connection between the number of positive solutions and the topological properties of a set in which the potential function achieves its minimum values.

title: Frontmatter
Fixed Points for Dissipative-Repulsive Systems and Topological Dynamics of Mappings Defined on N-dimensional Cells
abstract: Abstract We prove a fixed point theorem for continuous mappings which satisfy a compression-expansion condition on the boundary of a N-dimensional cell of ‚Ñù N . Our work is motivated by a previous theorem of Andres, Gaudenzi and Zanolin (1990) dealing with the existence of periodic solutions for dissipative-repulsive systems and is also related to some recent results by Zgliczy≈Ñski and Gidea (2004) concerning covering relations for Markov partitions. Applications are given to the study of the iterates of a continuous map of ‚Ñù N . In this case we obtain some theorems on the existence of periodic points and chaotic-like dynamics.

title: Multiplicity of Entire Solutions For a Class of Almost Periodic Allen-Cahn Type Equations
abstract: Abstract We consider a class of semilinear elliptic equations of the form ‚àíŒîu(x,y) + a(Œµx)W π(u(x,y)) = 0, (x,y) ‚àä ‚Ñù 2 (0.1) where Œµ > 0, a : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù is an almost periodic, positive function and W : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù is modeled on the classical two well Ginzburg-Landau potential W(s) = (s 2 - 1) 2 . We show via variational methods that if Œµ is sufficiently small and a is not constant then (0.1) admits infinitely many two dimensional entire solutions verifying the asymptotic conditions u(x, y) ‚Üí ¬±1 as x ‚Üí ¬±‚àû uniformly with respect to y ‚àä ‚Ñù.

title: Normalized Solutions to Strongly Indefinite Semilinear Equations
authors: Boris Buffoni; Maria J. Esteban; √âric S√©r√©
abstract: Abstract In this paper we discuss the existence of normalized solutions of nonlinear elliptic PDEs in gaps of the essential spectrum of the corresponding differential operator. This issue can he of interest, for instance, in nonlinear optics or in crystalline models with impurities.

title: On the Prescribed Paneitz Curvature Problem on the Standard Spheres
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study some fourth order conformal invariants on the standard n-spheres, n ‚â• 5. Using topological arguments, we give a variety of classes of functions that can be realized as Paneitz curvature.

title: Generic Properties of Singularly Perturbed Nonlinear Elliptic Problems on Riemannian Manifold
abstract: Abstract Given (M, g) the set {(Œµ, h) ‚àà (0, 1) √ó S k : any solution u ‚àà A of -Œµ 2 Œî g+h u+u = (u + ) p-1 on M is non degenerate} is an open dense subset of (0, 1) √ó B œÅ where B œÅ is a suitable ball centered at 0 with radius œÅ in the Banach space S k . Here S k is the space of all C k symmetric covariant 2-tensors on M and A is a bounded subset of H g 1 (M) which does not contain the constant function 1.

title: On Uniqueness of Large Solutions of Nonlinear Parabolic Equations in Nonsmooth Domains
abstract: Abstract We study the existence and uniqueness of the positive solutions of the problem (P): ”ò t u - Œîu + u q = 0 (q > 1) in Œ© √ó (0, ‚àû), u = ‚àû on ”òŒ© √ó (0, ‚àû) and u(., 0) ‚àà L 1 (Œ©), when Œ© is a bounded domain in ‚Ñù N . We construct a maximal solution, prove that this maximal solution is a large solution whenever q < N/(N - 2) and it is unique if ”òŒ© = ”òŒ©ÃÖ c . If ”òŒ© has the local graph property, we prove that there exists at most one solution to problem (P).

title: Homogenization and Vanishing Viscosity in Fully Nonlinear Elliptic Equations: Rate of Convergence Estimates
authors: Fabio Camilli; Annalisa Cesaroni; Claudio Marchi
abstract: Abstract This paper is devoted to studying the behavior as Œµ ‚Üí 0 of the equations u Œµ + H(x, x/Œµ, Du Œµ , Œµ Œ≥ D 2 u Œµ ) = 0 with Œ≥ > 0. It is known that, under some periodicity and ellipticity or coercivity assumptions, the solution u Œµ converges to the solution u of an effective equation u + HÃÖ(x, Du) = 0, with an effective Hamiltonian HÃÖ dependent on the value of Œ≥. The main purpose of this paper is to estimate the rate of convergence of u Œµ to u. Moreover we discuss some examples and model problems.

title: Boundary Behavior of Solutions to Singular Boundary Value Problems for Nonlinear Elliptic Equations
authors: Zhijun Zhang; Xiaohong Li; Yuanzhang Zhao
abstract: Abstract Let Œ© be a bounded domain with smooth boundary in ‚Ñù N and h ‚àà C((0,‚àû), (0,‚àû)) with lim s‚Üí0 + h(s) = Œ• ‚àà (0,‚àû). By the perturbation method, which is due to Garc√≠a Meli√°n, and nonlinear transformations and comparison principles, we derive the exact boundary behavior of solutions to a singular Dirichlet problem . Then, applying the result, combining two kinds of nonlinear transformations, we derive the exact boundary behavior of solutions to a boundary blow-up elliptic problem and a singular Dirichlet problem, where the weight b is positive in Œ© and may be (rapidly) vanishing or blow up on the boundary.

title: The Singular Perturbation Problem for a Class of Generalized Logistic Equations Under Non-classical Mixed Boundary Conditions
abstract: Abstract This paper studies a singular perturbation result for a class of generalized diffusive logistic equations, <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>d</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="script">‚Ñí</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>h</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {d\mathcal{L}u=uh(u,x)} , under non-classical mixed boundary conditions, <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="script">‚Ñ¨</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\mathcal{B}u=0} on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\partial\Omega} . Most of the precursors of this result dealt with Dirichlet boundary conditions and self-adjoint second order elliptic operators. To overcome the new technical difficulties originated by the generality of the new setting, we have characterized the regularity of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\partial\Omega} through the regularity of the associated conormal projections and conormal distances . This seems to be a new result of a huge relevance on its own. It actually complements some classical findings of Serrin, [39], Gilbarg and Trudinger, [21], Krantz and Parks, [27], Foote, [18] and Li and Nirenberg [28] concerning the regularity of the inner distance function to the boundary.

title: A Legendre Transform on an Exotic S<sup>3</sup>
abstract: Abstract We consider an exotic contact form Œ± on S 3 and we establish explicitly the existence of a non singular vector field v in ker(Œ±) such that the non-singular one-differential form Œ≤(„Éª) := dŒ±(v, „Éª) is a contact form on S 3 with the same orientation as Œ±. In particular this means that a Legendre transform can be completed.

title: Positive, Negative, and Nodal Solutions to Elliptic Differential Inclusions Depending on a Parameter
authors: Antonio Iannizzotto; S. Marano; Dumitru Motreanu
abstract: Abstract The homogeneous Dirichlet problem for a partial differential inclusion involving the p- Laplace operator and depending on a parameter Œª > 0 is investigated. The existence of three smooth solutions, a smallest positive, a biggest negative, and a nodal one, is obtained for any Œª sufficiently large by combining variational methods with truncation techniques.

title: On the Uniformity of the Constant in the Poincar√© Inequality
abstract: Abstract The classical Poincar√© inequality establishes that for any bounded regular domain Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N there exists a constant C = C(Œ©) > 0 such that In this paper we show that C can be taken independently of Œ© when Œ© is in a certain class of domains. Our result generalizes previous results in this direction.

title: Sign-Changing Solutions for a Class of Zero Mass Nonlocal Schr√∂dinger Equations
authors: Vincenzo Ambrosio; Giovany M. Figueiredo; Teresa Isernia; Giovanni Molica Bisci

(-\Delta)^{\alpha}u+V(x)u=K(x)f(u)\quad\text{in }\mathbb{R}^{N}, where <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œ±</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo </m:mrow> <m:mi>Œ±</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {(-\Delta)^{\alpha}} is the fractional Laplacian, V and K are positive continuous functions which vanish at infinity, and f is a continuous function. By using a minimization argument and a quantitative deformation lemma, we obtain the existence of a sign-changing solution. Furthermore, when f is odd, we prove that the above problem admits infinitely many nontrivial solutions. Our result extends to the fractional framework some well-known theorems proved for elliptic equations in the classical setting. With respect to these cases studied in the literature, the nonlocal one considered here presents some additional difficulties, such as the lack of decompositions involving positive and negative parts, and the non-differentiability of the Nehari Manifold, so that a careful analysis of the fractional spaces involved is necessary.

title: A Counterexample for Singular Equations with Indefinite Weight
abstract: Abstract We construct a second-order equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mover accent="true"> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>¬®</m:mo> </m:mover> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>h</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\ddot{x}=h(t)/x^{p}} , with <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {p>1} and the sign-changing, periodic weight function h having negative mean, which does not have periodic solutions. This contrasts with earlier results which state that, in many cases, such periodic problems are solvable.

title: Interior Estimates for Generalized Forchheimer Flows of Slightly Compressible Fluids
abstract: Abstract The generalized Forchheimer flows are studied for slightly compressible fluids in porous media with time-dependent Dirichlet boundary data for the pressure. No restrictions are imposed on the degree of the Forchheimer polynomial. We derive, for all time, the interior <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>L</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {L^{\infty}} -estimates for the pressure, its gradient and time derivative, and the interior <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>L</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:math> {L^{2}} -estimates for its Hessian. The De Giorgi and Ladyzhenskaya‚ÄìUraltseva iteration techniques are used taking into account the special structures of the equations for both pressure and its gradient. These are combined with the uniform Gronwall-type bounds in establishing the asymptotic estimates when time tends to infinity.

title: Strict Positivity for the Principal Eigenfunction of Elliptic Operators with Various Boundary Conditions
authors: Wolfgang Arendt; A. F. M. ter Elst; Jochen Gl√ºck
abstract: Abstract We consider elliptic operators with measurable coefficients and Robin boundary conditions on a bounded domain <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>‚äÇ</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>d</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\Omega\subset\mathbb{R}^{d}} and show that the first eigenfunction v satisfies <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>v</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mi>Œ¥</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {v(x)\geq\delta>0} for all <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mover accent="true"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>¬Ø</m:mo> </m:mover> </m:mrow> </m:math> {x\in\overline{\Omega}} , even if the boundary <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\partial\Omega} is only Lipschitz continuous. Under such weak regularity assumptions the Hopf‚ÄìOleƒ≠nik boundary lemma is not available; instead we use a new approach based on an abstract positivity improving condition for semigroups that map <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>L</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {L_{p}(\Omega)} into <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>C</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mover accent="true"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>¬Ø</m:mo> </m:mover> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {C(\overline{\Omega})} . The same tool also yields corresponding results for Dirichlet or mixed boundary conditions. Finally, we show that our results can be used to derive strong minimum and maximum principles for parabolic and elliptic equations.

title: Existence and Multiplicity of Solutions for Resonant (p,2)-Equations
authors: ŒùŒπŒ∫œåŒªŒ±ŒøœÇ Œ†Œ±œÄŒ±Œ≥ŒµœâœÅŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ; Vicen≈£iu D. RƒÉdulescu; Du≈°an Repov≈°
abstract: We consider Dirichlet elliptic equations driven by the sum of a $p$-Laplacian $(2<p)$ and a Laplacian. The conditions on the reaction term imply that the problem is resonant at both $\pm\infty$ and at zero. We prove an existence theorem (producing one nontrivial smooth solution) and a multiplicity theorem (producing five nontrivial smooth solutions, four of constant sign and the fifth nodal; the solutions are ordered). Our approach uses variational methods and critical groups.

title: A Singular Limit Problem for the Rosenau‚ÄìKorteweg-de Vries-Regularized Long Wave and Rosenau-regularized Long Wave Equations
authors: Giuseppe Maria Coclite; Lorenzo di Ruvo
abstract: Abstract We consider the Rosenau‚ÄìKorteweg-de Vries-regularized long wave and Rosenau-regularized long wave equations, which contain nonlinear dispersive effects. We prove that by adding small diffusion to the equations, as the diffusion and dispersion parameters tends to zero, the solutions of the duffusive/dispersive equations converge to the unique entropy solution of a scalar conservation law. The proof relies on deriving suitable a priori estimates together with an application of the compensated compactness method in the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>L</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> ${L^{p}}$ setting.

title: On a Generalization of a Global Implicit Function Theorem
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we derive generalized versions of the results on the existence, uniqueness and continuous differentiability of a global implicit function obtained in [5] and we give some examples.

title: Existence of Infinitely Many Solutions for Quasilinear Equations Perturbed from Symmetry
abstract: Abstract We consider the existence of infinitely many solutions of a class of quasilinear problems, for which the corresponding functionals are non-symmetric

title: Semilinear Elliptic Equation with Biharmonic Operator and Multiple Critical Nonlinearities

title: On the Two-phase Fractional Stefan Problem
authors: F√©lix del Teso; J√∏rgen Endal; Juan Lu√≠s V√°zquez
abstract: Abstract The classical Stefan problem is one of the most studied free boundary problems of evolution type. Recently, there has been interest in treating the corresponding free boundary problem with nonlocal diffusion. We start the paper by reviewing the main properties of the classical problem that are of interest to us. Then we introduce the fractional Stefan problem and develop the basic theory. After that we center our attention on selfsimilar solutions, their properties and consequences. We first discuss the results of the one-phase fractional Stefan problem, which have recently been studied by the authors. Finally, we address the theory of the two-phase fractional Stefan problem, which contains the main original contributions of this paper. Rigorous numerical studies support our results and claims.

title: Improved Interpolation Inequalities and Stability
abstract: Abstract For exponents in the subcritical range, we revisit some optimal interpolation inequalities on the sphere with carr√© du champ methods and use the remainder terms to produce improved inequalities. The method provides us with lower estimates of the optimal constants in the symmetry breaking range and stability estimates for the optimal functions. Some of these results can be reformulated in the Euclidean space using the stereographic projection.

It also establishes that <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msubsup><m:mi mathvariant="script">ùíû</m:mi><m:msub><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mn>0</m:mn></m:msub><m:mo>+</m:mo></m:msubsup></m:math> {\mathscr{C}_{\lambda_{0}}^{+}} consists of regular solutions if and only if <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mrow><m:msup><m:mrow><m:mrow><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mn>0</m:mn><m:mi>z</m:mi></m:msubsup><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">(</m:mo></m:mrow><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mi>z</m:mi></m:msubsup><m:mi>a</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>/</m:mo><m:mn>2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mo>=</m:mo><m:mo>+</m:mo><m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi><m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo><m:mtext>or</m:mtext><m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mi>z</m:mi><m:mn>1</m:mn></m:msubsup><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">(</m:mo></m:mrow><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mi>z</m:mi></m:msubsup><m:mi>a</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">)</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi/><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>/</m:mo><m:mn>2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mo>=</m:mo><m:mo>+</m:mo><m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi><m:mo>.</m:mo></m:mrow></m:math> \int_{0}^{z}\Biggr{(}\int_{x}^{z}a(t)\,dt\Bigg{)}^{-{1/2}}dx=+\infty\quad\text% {or}\quad\int_{z}^{1}\Biggr{(}\int_{x}^{z}a(t)\,dt\Bigg{)}^{-{1/2}}dx=+\infty. Equivalently, the small positive regular solutions of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msubsup><m:mi mathvariant="script">ùíû</m:mi><m:msub><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mn>0</m:mn></m:msub><m:mo>+</m:mo></m:msubsup></m:math> {\mathscr{C}_{\lambda_{0}}^{+}} become singular as they are sufficiently large if and only if <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mrow><m:msup><m:mrow><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">(</m:mo><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mi>z</m:mi></m:msubsup><m:mi>a</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>/</m:mo><m:mn>2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mo>‚àà</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi>L</m:mi><m:mn>1</m:mn></m:msup><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mn>0</m:mn><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>z</m:mi><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo><m:mtext>and</m:mtext><m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">(</m:mo></m:mrow><m:msubsup><m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo><m:mi>x</m:mi><m:mi>z</m:mi></m:msubsup><m:mi>a</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mi>d</m:mi><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">)</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi/><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>/</m:mo><m:mn>2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mo>‚àà</m:mo><m:mi>L</m:mi><m:msup><m:mi/><m:mn>1</m:mn></m:msup><m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo><m:mi>z</m:mi><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo><m:mo>.</m:mo></m:mrow></m:math> \Biggr{(}\int_{x}^{z}a(t)\,dt\Bigg{)}^{-{1/2}}\in L^{1}(0,z)\quad\text{and}% \quad\Biggr{(}\int_{x}^{z}a(t)\,dt\Bigg{)}^{-{1/2}}\in L^{1}(z,1). This is achieved by providing a very sharp description of the asymptotic profile, as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo><m:msub><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi></m:msub></m:mrow></m:math> {\lambda\to\lambda_{\infty}} , of the solutions. According to the mutual positions of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msub><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mn>0</m:mn></m:msub></m:math> {\lambda_{0}} and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msub><m:mi>Œª</m:mi><m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi></m:msub></m:math> {\lambda_{\infty}} , as well as the bifurcation direction, the occurrence of multiple solutions can also be detected.

title: A Critical Point Theorem for Perturbed Functionals and Low Perturbations of Differential and Nonlocal Systems
authors: Anouar Bahrouni; Vicen≈£iu D. RƒÉdulescu; Patrick Winkert
abstract: Abstract In this paper we establish a new critical point theorem for a class of perturbed differentiable functionals without satisfying the Palais‚ÄìSmale condition. We prove the existence of at least one critical point to such functionals, provided that the perturbation is sufficiently small. The main abstract result of this paper is applied both to perturbed nonhomogeneous equations in Orlicz‚ÄìSobolev spaces and to nonlocal problems in fractional Sobolev spaces.

title: An Improved Fountain Theorem and Its Application
abstract: Abstract The main aim of the paper is to prove a fountain theorem without assuming the œÑ-upper semi-continuity condition on the variational functional. Using this improved fountain theorem, we may deal with more general strongly indefinite elliptic problems with various sign-changing nonlinear terms. As an application, we obtain infinitely many solutions for a semilinear Schr√∂dinger equation with strongly indefinite structure and sign-changing nonlinearity.

title: Well-Ordered and Non-Well-Ordered Lower and Upper Solutions for Periodic Planar Systems
authors: Alessandro Fonda; Giuliano Klun; Andrea Sfecci
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is to extend the theory of lower and upper solutions to the periodic problem associated with planar systems of differential equations. We generalize previously given definitions and we are able to treat both the well-ordered case and the non-well-ordered case. The proofs involve topological degree arguments, together with a detailed analysis of the solutions in the phase plane.

title: Sharp Blow-Up Profiles of Positive Solutions for a Class of Semilinear Elliptic Problems

title: Total mean curvatures of Riemannian hypersurfaces
abstract: Abstract We obtain a comparison formula for integrals of mean curvatures of Riemannian hypersurfaces via Reilly‚Äôs identities. As applications, we derive several geometric inequalities for a convex hypersurface <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œì</m:mi> </m:math> \Gamma in a Cartan-Hadamard manifold <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:math> M . In particular, we show that the first mean curvature integral of a convex hypersurface <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>Œ≥</m:mi> </m:math> \gamma nested inside <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œì</m:mi> </m:math> \Gamma cannot exceed that of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œì</m:mi> </m:math> \Gamma , which leads to a sharp lower bound for the total first mean curvature of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œì</m:mi> </m:math> \Gamma in terms of the volume it bounds in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:math> M in dimension 3. This monotonicity property is extended to all mean curvature integrals when <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>Œ≥</m:mi> </m:math> \gamma is parallel to <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œì</m:mi> </m:math> \Gamma , or <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:math> M has constant curvature. We also characterize hyperbolic balls as minimizers of the mean curvature integrals among balls with equal radii in Cartan-Hadamard manifolds.

title: A system of equations involving the fractional p-Laplacian and doubly critical nonlinearities
authors: Mousomi Bhakta; Kanishka Perera; Firoj Sk

title: Gagliardo-Nirenberg-type inequalities using fractional Sobolev spaces and Besov spaces
abstract: Abstract Our main purpose is to establish Gagliardo-Nirenberg-type inequalities using fractional homogeneous Sobolev spaces and homogeneous Besov spaces. In particular, we extend some of the results obtained by the authors in previous studies.

Here we focus on these unknown case. We investigate the existence of positive normalized solutions under different assumptions on Œ≤ > 0. Figure 1, Tables 1 and 2 will illustrate our main results and the relationship between our work and some related works in the literature.

title: On Bobkov-Tanaka type spectrum for the double-phase operator
abstract: Abstract Moving from the seminal papers by Bobkov and Tanaka [‚ÄúOn positive solutions for ( p , q )-Laplace equations with two parameters,‚Äù Calc. Var. Partial Differ. Equ. , vol. 54, pp. 3277‚Äì3301, 2015, ‚ÄúRemarks on minimizers for ( p , q )-Laplace equations with two parameters,‚Äù Commun. Pure Appl. Anal. , vol. 17, pp. 1219‚Äì1253, 2018, ‚ÄúMultiplicity of positive solutions for ( p , q )-Laplace equations with two parameters,‚Äù Commun. Contemp. Math. , vol. 24, 2022, Art. no. 2150008] on the spectrum of the ( p , q )-Laplacian, we analyze the case of the double-phase operator. We discuss the region of parameters in which existence and non-existence of positive solutions occur. The proofs are based on normalization procedures, the Nehari manifold, and truncation techniques, exploiting Picone-type inequalities and an ad-hoc strong maximum principle.

title: On the L p -boundedness of Calder√≥n-Zygmund operators
abstract: Abstract The main result in this paper is that, for singular integral operators associated with standard kernels, local L 1 -estimates imply global L p -estimates for every p ‚àà (1, ‚àû ). When combined with the result of Melnikov-Verdera, this yields a complete and self-contained proof of the L p -boundedness of the Cauchy operator on Lipschitz curves and chord-arc curves in the plane.

title: Disc stackings and their Morse index
authors: Alessandro Carlotto; Mario B. Schulz; David Wiygul
abstract: Abstract We construct free boundary minimal disc stackings, with any number of strata, in the three-dimensional Euclidean unit ball, and prove uniform, linear lower and upper bounds on the Morse index of all such surfaces. Among other things, our work implies for any positive integer k the existence of k -tuples of distinct, pairwise non-congruent, embedded free boundary minimal surfaces all having the same topological type. In addition, since we prove that the equivariant Morse index of any such free boundary minimal stacking, with respect to its maximal symmetry group, is bounded from below by (the integer part of) half the number of layers, it follows that any possible realization of such surfaces via an equivariant min-max method would need to employ sweepouts with an arbitrarily large number of parameters. This also shows that it is only for N = 2 and N = 3 layers that free boundary minimal disc stackings can be obtained by means of one-dimensional mountain pass schemes.

\partial B,\hfill \end{cases}$$ where Œî p u = div(|‚àá u | p ‚àí2 ‚àá u ), 1 < p < N , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> Moreover, we also give the result of existence for a general nonlinearity case. Finally, we also give some results for a class of concave-convex nonlinear problem.

title: Frontmatter
An eigenvalue estimate for self-shrinkers in a Ricci shrinker
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the drifted Laplacian Œî f on a hypersurface M in a Ricci shrinker <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mover accent="true"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>ÃÑ</m:mo> </m:mover> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>g</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>f</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> $\left(\bar{M},g,f\right)$ . We prove that the spectrum of Œî f is discrete for immersed hypersurfaces with bounded weighted mean curvature in a Ricci shrinker with a mild condition on the potential function. Next, we give a lower bound for the first nonzero eigenvalue of Œî f when the hypersurface is an embedded f -minimal one. This estimate contains the case of compact minimal hypersurfaces in a positive Einstein manifold, in particular Choi and Wang‚Äôs estimate for minimal hypersurfaces in a round sphere. The estimate also recovers the ones of Ding-Xin and Brendle-Tsiamis on self-shrinkers.

title: On coupled systems of nonlinear Schr√∂dinger and Choquard equations with distinct exponents
authors: Dohoon Choi; Subong Lim; Jinmyoung Seok
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we are interested in the existence of a positive solution of the two coupled system of nonlinear Schr√∂dinger and Choquard equations. Our equations admit the case that the nonlinearity exponents of two components are different. This includes, in particular, the upper and lower critical cases. We first investigate the existence of ground states and provide a criterion for two-component positiveness of ground states. In case where the ground state is semi-trivial, we construct a higher energy positive solution of the mountain-pass type on the Nehari manifold.

title: Effects of anisotropic diffusion in a two-dimensional unstirred chemostat
abstract: Abstract We investigate an unstirred chemostat model in which two species compete in a two-dimensional environment. The populations are assumed to disperse anisotropically, with distinct probabilities assigned to horizontal and vertical movements, which are interpreted as dispersal strategies. First, we analyze the dynamics of the single-species model and identify the conditions for the existence of positive steady states. Then, we classify the dynamical behavior of the two-species model into three scenarios based on the diffusion strategies: (i) extinction; (ii) competitive exclusion; and (iii) coexistence. Next, we provide sufficient conditions for the existence of coexistence steady states. Finally, our numerical simulations provide visual validation of our theoretical results and offer valuable insights for future researches.

title: The Prescribed Scalar Curvature on a 3 - Dimensional CR Manifold
abstract: Abstract We extend to the CR framework an equivalent problem to the well known Kazdan- Warner problem on Riemannian manifolds. Let (M, Œ∏) be a three-dimensional pseudo Hermitian CR compact manifold, locally conformally CR equivalent to the sphere S 3 of C 4 . We give suitable conditions on a C 3 positive function K, defined on M, to be the Webster scalar curvature for a contact form on M conformal to Œ∏.

title: Prescribing the Scalar Curvature Problem on Three and Four Manifolds
abstract: Abstract This paper is devoted to the prescribed scalar curvature problem on 3 and 4- dimensional Riemannian manifolds. We give a new class of functionals which can be realized as scalar curvature. Our proof uses topological arguments and the tools of the theory of the critical points at infinity.

title: Prescribing the Scalar Curvature under Minimal Boundary Conditions on the Half Sphere
authors: Mohamed Ben Ayed; Khalil El Mehdi; Mohameden Ould Ahmedou
abstract: Abstract This paper is devoted to the problem of prescribing the scalar curvature under zero boundary conditions. Using dynamical and topological methods involving the study of critical points at infinity of the associated variational problem, we prove some existence results on the standard half sphere.

title: On Existence and Concentration of Solutions for a Class of Hamiltonian Systems in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
authors: Claudianor O. Alves; S√©rgio H. Monari Soares; Jianfu Yangt
abstract: Abstract In this paper we are concerned with the existence of solutions for the Hamiltonian system where N ‚â• 3, Q, K : ‚Ñù N ‚Üí ‚Ñù are bounded positive continuous functions and the numbers p, q > 1 satisfy Using dual variational methods we show that under certain conditions on Q and K the system (S ‚àä ) has a positive solution which concentrates as ‚àä ‚Üí 0 in a point x o ‚àà ‚Ñù N where related functionals realize its minimum energy.

title: Geodesics in Static Lorentzian Manifolds with Critical Quadratic Behavior
authors: Rossella Bartolo; Anna Mar√≠a Candela; Jos√© Luis Flores; Miguel S√°nchez
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is t o study the geodesic connectedness of a complete static Lorentzian manifold (M.„Äà¬∑, ¬∑„Äâ L ) such that. if K is its irrotational timelike Killing vector field, the growth of Œ≤ = -„ÄàK, K„Äâ L is (at most) quadratic. This is shown to be equivalent to a critical variational problem on a Riemannian manifold, where some geometrical interpretations yield the optimal results. Multiplicity of connecting geodesics is studied, especially in the timelike case, where the restrictions for the number of causal connecting geodesics are stressed. Extensions to the non-complete case, including discussions on pseudoconvexity, are also given.

title: Positive solutions of a fourth-order semilinear problem involving critical growth
authors: Claudianor O. Alves; Jo√£o Marcos do √ì
abstract: Abstract In this work we study the existence of positive solutions of the critical problem (P) ‚àÜ 2 u+ a(x)u = |u| 2**-2 u, ‚Ñù N and u ‚àà D 2,2 (‚Ñù N ), where 2** = 2N/(N - 4), N ‚â• 5, a ‚àà L N/4 (‚Ñù N ) is on a nonnegative continuous function and ‚àÜ 2 is the biharmonic operator. We also prove a global compactness result for the associated energy functional of problem (P), similar to that due to Struwe in [22]. The basic tool employed here is the concentration compactness due to P. L. Lions and a linking theorem on the cone of nonnegative functions.

title: Old and New Results for First Order Periodic ODEs without Uniqueness: a Comprehensive Study by Lower and Upper Solutions
abstract: Abstract An elementary approach, based on a systematic use of lower and upper solutions, is employed to detect the qualitative properties of solutions of first order scalar periodic ordinary differential equations. This study is carried out in the Carath√©odory setting, avoiding any uniqueness assumption, in the future or in the past, for the Cauchy problem. Various classical and recent results are recovered and generalized.

title: Existence of Solutions for Some Classes of Singular Hamiltonian Systems
authors: Claudianor O. Alves; Francisco J√∫lio S. A. Corr√™a; J.V. Gon√ßalves
abstract: Abstract This paper deals with existence of positive solution for the following singular Hamiltonian system where Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 2, is a smooth bounded domain and H, T, S, K are continuous functions. A key role is played by the Galerkin method.

title: A Simple Approach to Brouwer Degree Based on Differential Forms
abstract: Abstract We present Heinz‚Äô approach to Brouwer degree in a simpler, shorter and better motivated way. We link it to Kronecker index, use the language of differential forms at an elementary level, and prove the homotopy invariance using an unpublished result of Tartar.

title: Unbounded Motions of Perturbed Isochronous Hamiltonian Systems at Resonance
abstract: Abstract Large amplitude solutions of asymptotically positively homogeneous perturbations of hamiltonians systems at resonance can be unbounded, either in the past, or in the future. We present conditions for boundedness or unboundedness, generalizing in particular the results obtained by Alonso and Ortega [1] for scalar second order equations with asymmetric nonlinearities.

title: Multiple Solutions of Some Nonlinear Variational Problems
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is to prove some existence and multiplicity results for functionals of type J(u) = ‚à´ Œ© ¬≠ A(x, u)|‚ñΩu| 2 dx - ‚à´ Œ© ¬≠ G(x, u)dx, u 2 D ‚àä H 0 1 (Œ©), with bounded domain Œ© in ‚Ñù N . Since, in general, J is not G√¢teaux differentiable in D, we study its restriction on the Banach space X = H 0 1 (Œ©) ‚à© L ‚àû (Œ©) and apply some abstract existence and multiplicity theorems involving a variant of condition (C) below.

title: Periodic and Bloch Solutions to a Magnetic Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equation
authors: M√≥nica Clapp; Renato Iturriaga; Andrzej Szulkin
abstract: Abstract We study the equation (‚ÑòA) (-i‚ñΩ + A) 2 u + V u = |u| p-2 u, where A ‚ààC 1,Œ± (‚Ñù N , ‚Ñù N ) and V ‚ààC 0,Œ± (‚Ñù N ) are 2œÄ-periodic in each variable, V > 0; and p ‚àà(2; 2*) with 2* := ‚àû if N = 2 and We address two questions: first, the gauge-dependence problem for 2œÄ-periodic solutions u : ‚Ñù N ‚Üí C and second, the multiplicity of Bloch solutions. Unlike the nonperiodic case where problem (‚ÑòA) is basically independent of A (it is gauge invariant), in the periodic case this is far from being true. Under some assumptions on A we show that, if there exists a one-to-one correspondence between the 2œÄ-periodic solutions of (‚ÑòA) and those of (‚ÑòA + z) preserving their absolute value, then z lies in a subset of measure zero of ‚Ñù N . We use this fact to show the existence of an uncountable set of Bloch solutions with real quasimomentum.

title: Multiplicity and Existence Results for a Nonlinear Elliptic Equation With Sobolev Exponent
abstract: Abstract In this paper we consider the following nonlinear elliptic equation with Dirichlet boundary conditions: -Œîu = K(x)u p , u > 0 in Œ©, u = 0 on ‚àÇŒ©, where Œ© is a smooth domain in ‚Ñù n , n ‚â• 4 and is the critical Sobolev exponent. Using dynamical and topological methods involving the study of critical points at infinity we establish, under generic conditions on K, some existence and multiplicity results.

title: On the Existence of Three Nontrivial Solutions for Periodic Problems Driven by the Scalar p-Laplacian
abstract: Abstract We consider a nonlinear periodic problem driven by the scalar p-Laplacian with a nonsmooth potential function. First we establish an alternative minimax expression for the first nonzero eigenvalue for the negative periodic scalar p-Laplacian and then using it we prove the existence of three nontrivial solutions, two of which have constant sign. Our approach is variational, based on the nonsmooth critical point theory.

title: Dual Spaces of Weighted Multi-Parameter Hardy Spaces Associated with the Zygmund Dilation
authors: Xiaolong Han; Guozhen Lu; Yayuan Xiao
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we apply the discrete Littlewood-Paley-Stein analysis to prove the duality theorem of weighted multi-parameter Hardy spaces associated with Zygmund dilations, i.e., (HpZ (œâ))‚àó = CMO Z p (œâ) for 0 < p ‚â§ 1. Our theorems extend the H Z p - CMO Z p duality theorems established in [13] (see also [12]) for non-weighted multi-parameter Hardy spaces associated with the Zygmund dilation.

title: Addendum to the Paper ‚ÄúUnique Strong Solutions and V -Attractors of a Three Dimensional System of Globally Modified Navier-Stokes Equations‚Ä≥, Advanced Nonlinear Studies 6 (2006), 411-436
authors: Tom√°s Caraballo; Jos√© Real; Peter E. Kloeden
abstract: Abstract In this paper we improve Theorem 7 in [1] which deals with the existence and uniqueness of solutions of the three dimensional globally modified Navier-Stokes equations.

title: Nonlinear Elliptic Equations in Strip-Like Domains
abstract: Abstract We study the existence of a positive solution of a nonlinear elliptic equation where k ‚â• 2 and D is a bounded domain domain in R ‚Ñì , ‚Ñì ‚â• 1. We give almost necessary and sufficient condition of f(Œæ) for the existence of a positive solution, which is inspired by the works of Berestycki-Lions [1] and Berestycki-Gallou√´t-Kavian [3].

title: Existence and Multiplicity of Periodic Solutions to Indefinite Singular Equations Having a Non-monotone Term with Two Singularities

The obtained results have a form of relation between multiplicities of zeros of the weight function h and orders of singularities of the nonlinear term. Our results have applications in a physical model, where from the equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Ä≤‚Ä≤</m:mo> </m:msup> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>h</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>sin</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:math> {u^{\prime\prime}=\frac{h(t)}{\sin^{2}u}} one can study the existence and multiplicity of periodic motions of a charged particle in an oscillating magnetic field on the sphere. The approach is based on the classical properties of the Leray‚ÄìSchauder degree.

title: Existence and Asymptotic Behavior for the Ground State of Quasilinear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we are concerned with the existence and asymptotic behavior of minimizers of a minimization problem related to some quasilinear elliptic equations. Firstly, we prove that there exist minimizers when the exponent q is the critical one <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mo>*</m:mo> </m:msup> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mn>4</m:mn> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {q^{*}=2+\frac{4}{N}} . title: Symmetry Results for Nonvariational Quasi-Linear Elliptic Systems
authors: Luigi Montoro; Berardino Sciunzi; Marco Squassina
abstract: Abstract By virtue of a weak comparison principle in small domains we prove axial symmetry in convex and symmetric smooth bounded domains as well as radial symmetry in balls for regular solutions of a class of quasi-linear elliptic systems in non-variational form. Moreover, in the two dimensional case, we study the system when set in a half-space.

title: Classification of Global and Blow-up Sign-changing Solutions of a Semilinear Heat Equation in the Subcritical Fujita Range : Second-order Diffusion
authors: Victor A. Galaktionov; Enzo Mitidieri; Stanislav I. Poho≈æaev
abstract: Abstract It is well known from the seminal paper by Fujita [22] for 1 < p < p 0 , and Hayakawa [36] for the critical case p = p 0 , that all the solutions u ‚â• 0 of the semilinear heat equation u t = Œîu + |u| p‚àí1 u in ‚Ñù N √ó ‚Ñù + , in the range , (0.1) with arbitrary initial data u 0 (x) ‚â• 0, ‚â¢ 0, blow-up in finite time, while for p > p 0 there exists a class of sufficiently ‚Äúsmall‚Äù global in time solutions. This fundamental result from the 1960-70s (see also [39] for related contributions), was a cornerstone of further active blow-up research. Nowadays, similar Fujita-type critical exponents p 0 , as important characteristics of stability, unstability, and blow-up of solutions, have been calculated for various nonlinear PDEs. The above blow-up conclusion does not include solutions of changing sign, so some of them may remain global even for p ‚â§ p 0 . Our goal is a thorough description of blow-up and global in time oscillatory solutions in the subcritical range in (0.1) on the basis of various analytic methods including nonlinear capacity, variational, category, fibering, and invariant manifold techniques. Two countable sets of global solutions of changing sign are shown to exist. Most of them are not radially symmetric in any dimension N ‚â• 2 (previously, only radial such solutions in ‚Ñù N or in the unit ball B 1 ‚äÇ‚Ñù N were mostly studied). A countable sequence of critical exponents, at which the whole set of global solutions changes its structure, is detected: , l = 0, 1, 2, ... .. See [47, 48] for earlier interesting contributions on sign changing solutions.

title: Liouville-type Theorems for Fully Nonlinear Elliptic Equations and Systems in Half Spaces
abstract: Abstract The main purpose of this paper is to establish Liouville-type theorems and decay estimates for viscosity solutions to a class of fully nonlinear elliptic equations or systems in half spaces without the boundedness assumptions on the solutions. Using the blow-up method and doubling lemma of [18], we remove the boundedness assumption on solutions which was often required in the proof of Liouville-type theorems in the literature. We also prove the Liouville-type theorems for supersolutions of a system of fully nonlinear equations with Pucci extremal operators in half spaces. Liouville theorems and decay estimates for high order elliptic equations and systems have also been established by the authors in an earlier work [15] when no boundedness assumption was given on the solutions.

title: A Variational Approach to a Nonlocal Elliptic Problem with Sign-Changing Nonlinearity
authors: Francisco J√∫lio S. A. Corr√™a; Manuel Delgado; Ant√≥nio Su√°rez
abstract: Abstract In this paper we are concerned with the nonlocal elliptic problem where Œ© ‚äÇ‚Ñù N is a bounded smooth domain, f, g : ‚Ñù ‚Üí‚Ñù are given functions and p is a fixed real number. We use variational methods to prove multiplicity results.

title: Quasilinear Equations via Elliptic Regularization Method
authors: Jiaquan Liu; Xiangqing Liu; Zhi-Qiang Wang
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a class of quasilinear problems, in particular we deal with multiple sign-changing solutions of quasilinear elliptic equations. We further develop an approach used in our earlier work by exploring elliptic regularization. The method works well in studying multiplicity and nodal property of solutions.

title: Spinorial Yamabe Type Equations on S<sup>3</sup> via Conley Index
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the existence of solutions to spinorial Yamabe type equations on S 3 with a prescribed function H. We give a new condition about H under which at least one non-trivial solution exists. It is proved by a method based on Conley index theory applied to a reduced functional defined on a certain finite dimensional non-compact manifold. Our proof is also applicable to similar equations on S m for all m ‚â• 2.

title: Global Attractors for p-Laplacian Equations with Dynamic Flux Boundary Conditions
abstract: Abstract This paper studies the long-time behavior of solutions for p-Laplacian equations with a polynomial growth nonlinearity of arbitrary order and dynamic flux boundary conditions in d-dimensional bounded smooth domains. We first prove the existence of global attractors in L 2 (Œ©)√óL 2 (Œì) and L q (Œ©)√óLq(Œì) for the p-Laplacian evolution equations subject to dynamic nonlinear boundary conditions by using the Sobolev compactness embedding theory, and then the existence of (L 2 (Œ©) √ó L 2 (Œì), L 2(q‚àí1) (Œ©) √ó L 2(q‚àí1) (Œì))-global attractor is obtained by asymptotical regularity method. Finally, we prove the existence of global attractor in W 1,p (Œ©) ‚à© L q (Œ©)) √ó L q (Œì) by asymptotic a priori estimate.

title: Two-Phase Free Boundary Problems: From Existence to Smoothness
authors: Daniela De Silva; Fausto Ferrari; Sandro Salsa
abstract: Abstract We describe the theory we developed in recent times concerning two-phasefree boundary problems governed by elliptic operators with forcing terms.Our results range from existence of viscosity solutions to smoothness ofboth solutions and free boundaries. We also discuss some open questions,possible object of future investigation.

We are concerned with a multiplicity property, and our arguments combine the variational principle for locally Lipschitz functions with the properties of the generalized Lebesgue‚ÄìSobolev space. Applying the nonsmooth symmetric mountain pass lemma and the fountain theorem, we establish conditions such that the associated energy functional possesses infinitely many critical points, and then we obtain infinitely many solutions.

title: Existence and Stability of Solutions of General Semilinear Elliptic Equations with Measure Data
abstract: We study existence and stability for solutions of $Lu+g(x; u) = \omega$ in the closure of open set $\Omega$ where L is a second order elliptic operator, $g$ a Caratheodory function and $\omega$ a measure in $\bar\Omega$. We present a uni ed theory of the Dirichlet problem and the Poisson equation. We prove the stability of the problem with respect to weak convergence of the data.

title: Qualitative Properties and Existence of Sign Changing Solutions with Compact Support for an Equation with a p-Laplace Operator
authors: Jean Dolbeault; Marta Garc√≠a‚ÄêHuidobro; Ra√∫l Man√°sevich
abstract: Abstract We consider radial solutions of an elliptic equation involving the p-Laplace operator and prove by a shooting method the existence of compactly supported solutions with any prescribed number of nodes. The method is based on a change of variables in the phase plane corresponding to an asymptotic Hamiltonian system and provides qualitative properties of the solutions.

title: A new Singular Trudinger‚ÄìMoser Type Inequality with Logarithmic Weights and Applications
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we establish a new singular Trudinger‚ÄìMoser type inequality for radial Sobolev spaces with logarithmic weights. The existence of nontrivial solutions is proved for an elliptic equation defined in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{n}} , relying on variational methods and involving a nonlinearity with doubly exponential growth at infinity.

We are concerned with the existence, regularity and asymptotic behavior of time-periodic solutions to the linearly coupled problem as ùúÄ goes to 0. Firstly, under some superlinear growth and monotonicity assumptions on ùëì and ùëî, we obtain the solutions <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>v</m:mi> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> (u_{\varepsilon},v_{\varepsilon}) with time period <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>œÄ</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> 2\pi for the problem as the linear coupling constant ùúÄ is sufficiently small, by constructing critical points of an indefinite functional via variational methods. Secondly, we give a precise characterization for the asymptotic behavior of these solutions, and show that, as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> \varepsilon\to 0 , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>v</m:mi> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> (u_{\varepsilon},v_{\varepsilon}) converge to the solutions of the wave equations without the coupling terms. Finally, by careful analysis which is quite different from the elliptic regularity theory, we obtain some interesting results concerning the higher regularity of the periodic solutions.

title: Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Equations with Asymptotically Linear Nonlinearities
authors: Marcelo F. Furtado; Edcarlos D. Silva; Maxwell L. Silva
abstract: Abstract We deal with the existence of nonzero solution for the quasilinear Schr√∂dinger equation ‚àíŒîu + V(x)u ‚àí Œî(u 2 )u = g(x, u), x ‚àà ‚Ñù N , u ‚àà H 1 (‚Ñù N ), where V is a positive potential and the nonlinearity g(x, s) behaves like K 0 (x)s at the origin and like K ‚àû (x)|s| p , 1 ‚â§ p ‚â§ 3, at infinity. In the proofs we apply minimization methods.

title: Multi-Valued Parabolic Variational Inequalities and Related Variational-Hemivariational Inequalities
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study multi-valued parabolic variational inequalities involving quasilinear parabolic operators, and multi-valued integral terms over the underlying parabolic cylinder as well as over parts of the lateral parabolic boundary, where the multi-valued functions involved are assumed to be upper semicontinuous only. Note, since lower semicontinuous multi-valued functions allow always for a Carath√©odory selection, this case can be considered as the trivial case, and therefore will be omitted. Our main goal is threefold: First, we provide an analytical frame work and an existence theory for the problems under consideration. Unlike in recent publications on multi-valued parabolic variational inequalities, the closed convex set K representing the constraints is not required to possess a nonempty interior. Second, we prove enclosure and comparison results based on a recently developed sub-supersolution method due to the authors. Third, we consider classes of relevant generalized parabolic variational-hemivariational inequalities that will be shown to be special cases of the multi-valued parabolic variational inequalities under consideration.

title: On the convexity theory of generating functions
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we extend our convexity theory for C 2 cost functions in optimal transportation to more general generating functions, which were originally introduced by the second author to extend the framework of optimal transportation to embrace near field geometric optics. In particular we provide an alternative geometric treatment to the previous analytic approach using differential inequalities, which also gives a different derivation of the invariance of the fundamental regularity conditions under duality. We also extend our local theory to cover the strict version of these conditions for C 2 cost and generating functions.

title: Rigidity properties of Colding‚ÄìMinicozzi entropies
abstract: Abstract We show certain rigidity for minimizers of generalized Colding‚ÄìMinicozzi entropies. The proofs are elementary and work even in situations where the generalized entropies are not monotone along mean curvature flow.

title: Perturbation compactness and uniqueness for a class of conformally compact Einstein manifolds
authors: Sun‚ÄêYung A. Chang; Yuxin Ge; Xiaoshang Jin; Jie Qing
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we establish compactness results for some classes of conformally compact Einstein metrics defined on manifolds of dimension d ‚â• 4. In the special case when the manifold is the Euclidean ball with the unit sphere as the conformal infinity, the existence of such class of metrics has been established in the earlier work of C. R. Graham and J. Lee (‚ÄúEinstein metrics with prescribed conformal infinity on the ball,‚Äù Adv. Math. , vol. 87, no. 2, pp. 186‚Äì225, 1991). As an application of our compactness result, we derive the uniqueness of the Graham‚ÄìLee metrics. As a second application, we also derive some gap theorem, or equivalently, some results of non-existence CCE fill-ins.

title: Eigenvalue lower bounds and splitting for modified Ricci flow
abstract: Abstract We prove sharp lower bounds for eigenvalues of the drift Laplacian for a modified Ricci flow. The modified Ricci flow is a system of coupled equations for a metric and weighted volume that plays an important role in Ricci flow. We will also show that there is a splitting theorem in the case of equality.

title: Liouville type theorems involving fractional order systems

<m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>.</m:mo> <m:mspace width="1em" /> </m:mtd> </m:mtr> </m:mtable> </m:mrow> </m:mfenced> </m:math> $\begin{cases}{\left(-{\Delta}\right)}^{\alpha
