title: Boundary Singularities of Solutions to Semilinear Fractional Equations
abstract: Abstract We prove the existence of a solution of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(-\Delta)^{s}u+f(u)=0} in a smooth bounded domain Œ© with a prescribed boundary value Œº in the class of Radon measures for a large class of continuous functions f satisfying a weak singularity condition expressed under an integral form. title: Multiplicity of Solutions to a Concave‚ÄìConvex Problem
authors: Jos√© C. Sabina de Lis; Sergio Segura de Le√≥n
abstract: Abstract This paper studies two related problems. A first one, where Œî p u = div(|‚àáu| p‚àí2 ‚àáu) stands for the p-Laplacian operator, Œ© is a ball in ‚Ñù N , ŒΩ stands for the outer unit normal and Œª > 0 is a parameter. Exponents are supposed to satisfy 1 < q < p < r ‚â§ p*, p* = N p/(N ‚àí p) if 1 < p < N, p* = ‚àû otherwise. The existence of Œõ > 0 is shown so that (P) does not admit positive solutions if Œª > Œõ, a minimal positive solution exists when 0 < Œª ‚â§ Œõ and most importantly, a further second positive solution arises if 0 < Œª < Œõ. Hence, extensions of results in [2], [3], [12] and [13] in the framework of (P) are provided. The second problem considered is the variant of (P): where Œ© is a ball and 1 < q < p < r. Features described above are shown to be also exhibited by (Q) and more importantly, it is proved that minimal solutions to (Q) develop flat patterns in the degenerate regime p > 2. Finally, it should be stressed that some of the properties satisfied by (P) and (Q) hold true when Œ© is a general smooth domain.

title: A Note on Symmetry of Solutions for a Class of Singular Semilinear Elliptic Problems
abstract: Abstract We prove symmetry and monotonicity properties for positive solutions of the singular semilinear elliptic equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>g</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>Œ≥</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>h</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> $-\Delta u=\frac{g(x)}{u^{\gamma}}+h(x)f(u)$ in bounded smooth domains with zero Dirichlet boundary conditions. The well-known moving plane method is applied.

title: On the Blow-Up of Solutions to Liouville-Type Equations
abstract: Abstract We estimate some complex structures related to perturbed Liouville equations defined on a compact Riemannian 2-manifold. As a byproduct, we obtain a quick proof of the mass quantization and we locate the blow-up points.

title: Resonant-Superlinear Elliptic Problems Using Variational Methods
authors: Edcarlos Domingos da Silva; Bruno Ribeiro
abstract: Abstract In this work we establish existence and multiplicity of solutions for resonant-superlinear elliptic problems using appropriate variational methods. The nonlinearity is resonant at ‚àí‚àû and superlinear at +‚àû and the resonance phenomena occurs precisely in the first eigenvalue of the corresponding linear problem. Our main theorems are stated without the well known Ambrosetti-Rabinowitz condition.

title: Pointwise Lower Bounds for Solutions of Semilinear Elliptic Equations and Applications
authors: A. Aghajani; Alireza Tehrani; Nassif Ghoussoub
abstract: Abstract We consider the semilinear elliptic problem ‚àíŒîu = f (x, u), posed in a smooth bounded domain Œ© of ‚Ñù N with Dirichiel data u|‚àÇŒ© = 0, where f : Œ© √ó [0, Œ± f ) ‚Üí ‚Ñù + (0 < Œ± f ‚â§ +‚àû) is a function of appropriate regularity which blows up at Œ± f . We give pointwise lower bounds for the supersolutions under some appropriate conditions on f , and apply them to eigenvalue problem ‚àíŒîu = Œª f (x, u), by giving upper and lower bounds for the extremal parameter Œª‚àó and the extremal solution u‚àó. To demonstrate the sharpness of our results, we consider the eigenvalue problem ‚àíŒîu = Œª f (u p ) (p ‚â• 1) with Dirichlet boundary condition, and show that for every increasing, convex and superlinear C 2 function f: ‚Ñù + ‚Üí‚Ñù + with , where œàŒ© is the maximum of the torsion function of Œ©. Also, we consider the eigenvalue problem ‚àíŒîu = ŒªœÅ(x) f (u), where f is either a regular singularity such as f (u) = e u , or a singular one such as and give explicit estimates on Œª‚àó and u‚àó, that improve and extend several results in the literature, by Payne[17], Sperb [21], Brezis-Vasquez [3], Guo-Pan-Ward [11], Ghoussoub-Guo [10], Cowan-Ghoussoub [6], and others.

title: Blow-up techniques and regularity near the boundary for free discontinuity problems
abstract: Abstract In this paper we exploit some compactness properties of the set of quasiminimizers of a functional with free discontinuities with the aim of obtaining blow-up techniques. These techniques are finally applied to show regularity near the boundary of the minimizers of the Mumford-Shah functional.

title: Propagation and interaction of shock waves of quasilinear equation
abstract: We propose a new regularization method for constructing a shock wave type solution with nonsmooth front (interaction of shock waves) for quasilinear equations in the one-dimensional case.

title: Uniform Bounds for the Best Sobolev Trace Constant
authors: Juli√°n Fern√°ndez Bonder; Julio D. Rossi; Ra√∫l Ferreira
abstract: Abstract We study the Sobolev trace embedding W 1,p (Œ©) ‚Ü™ L q (‚àÇŒ©), looking at the dependence of the best constant and the extremals on p and q. We prove that there exists a uniform bound (independent of (p, q)) for the best constant if and only if (p, q) lies far from (N, ‚àû). Also we study some limit cases, q = ‚àû with p > N or p = ‚àû with 1 ‚â§ q ‚â§ ‚àû.

title: A Linking Type Method to Solve a Class of Semilinear Elliptic Variational Inequalities
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is to study the existence of a nontrivial solution of the following semilinear elliptic variational inequality where Œ© is an open bounded subset of ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 1), Œª is a real parameter, with Œª ‚â• Œª 1 , the first eigenvalue of the operator - Œî in H 0 1 (Œ©), œà belongs to H 1 (Œ©), œà |‚àÇŒ© ‚â• 0 and p is a Carath√©odory function on Œ© √ó ‚Ñù, which satisfies some general superlinearity growth conditions at zero and at infinity.

title: Admissible Shapes of 4-Body Non-collinear Relative Equilibria
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study possible shapes of 4-body non-collinear relative equilibria for any positive masses, and give estimates on their geometric quantities.

title: Perturbation of Global Solution Curves for Semilinear Problems
authors: Philip Korman; Yi Li; Tiancheng Ouyang
abstract: Abstract We revisit the question of exact multiplicity of positive solutions for a class of Dirichlet problems for cubic-like nonlinearities, which we studied in [6]. Instead of computing the direction of bifurcation as we did in [6], we use an indirect approach, and study the evolution of turning points. We give conditions under which the critical (turning) points continue on smooth curves, which allows us to reduce the problem to the easier case of f (0) = 0. We show that the smallest root of f (u) does not have to be restricted.

title: Bifurcation and Concentration of Radial Solutions of a Nonlinear Degenerate Elliptic Eigenvalue Problem
abstract: Abstract We consider the nonlinear boundary-value problem in ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 3), where C ‚àä C 1 ([0, 1]) with C(r) > 0 for all r ‚àä [0, 1]; C(0) = 0 and and, for some T > 0; f ‚àä C 1 ([-T, T]) is an odd function that is strictly concave on [0, T] with f(0) = f(T) = 0 and f‚Ä≤(0) = 1. We prove that there is vertical bifurcation of radial solutions at every in the sense that there exists a sequence {(Œª, w n )} of solutions such that These solutions concentrate at 0 in the sense that w n (0) = T for all n but w n converges uniformly to zero on all compact subsets that do not contain zero.

title: Maximum Principles for Inhomogeneous Elliptic Inequalities on Complete Riemannian Manifolds
abstract: Abstract We prove some maximum principle results for weak solutions of elliptic inequalities, possibly inhomogeneous, on complete Riemannian manifolds.

title: Brunn-Minkowski-Type Inequalities Related to the Monge-Amp√®re Equation
abstract: Abstract We prove Brunn-Minkowski-type inequalities for functionals related to nontrivial weak solutions of Dirichlet boundary value problems for Monge-Amp√®re equations of the form det D 2 u = |u| P , where 0 ‚â§ p < n, in bounded strictly convex domains in ‚Ñù n . The expected equality conditions are also established. These results generalize inequalities known for analogous problems for the p-Laplacian. The existence of solutions to these problems is an extension of known results for more regular domains, and is proved by approximation. The principal technique used in the proof of the main theorem is the same as that used to establish a similar inequality for the eigenvalue of the Monge-Amp√®re operator.

title: Saturated Fronts in Crowds Dynamics
authors: Juan Campos; Andrea Corli; Luisa Malaguti
abstract: Abstract We consider a degenerate scalar parabolic equation, in one spatial dimension, of flux-saturated type. The equation also contains a convective term. We study the existence and regularity of traveling-wave solutions; in particular we show that they can be discontinuous. Uniqueness is recovered by requiring an entropy condition, and entropic solutions turn out to be the vanishing-diffusion limits of traveling-wave solutions to the equation with an additional non-degenerate diffusion. Applications to crowds dynamics, which motivated the present research, are also provided.

title: A Continuation Result for Forced Oscillations of Constrained Motion Problems with Infinite Delay
authors: Pierluigi Benevieri; Massimo Furi; Maria Patrizia Pera; Alessandro Calamai
abstract: Abstract We prove a global continuation result for T-periodic solutions of a T-periodic parametrized second order retarded functional differential equation on a boundaryless compact manifold with nonzero Euler-Poincar√© characteristic. The approach is based on the fixed point index theory for locally compact maps on ANRs. As an application, we prove the existence of forced oscillations of retarded functional motion equations defined on topologically nontrivial compact constraints. This existence result is obtained under the assumption that the frictional coefficient is nonzero, and we conjecture that it is still true in the frictionless case.

title: Global Existence for Nonlinear Parabolic Problems With Measure Data‚Äì Applications to Non-uniqueness for Parabolic Problems With Critical Gradient terms
authors: Boumediene Abdellaoui; Andrea Dall‚ÄôAglio; Ireneo Peral; Sergio Segura de Le√≥n
abstract: Abstract In the present article we study global existence for a nonlinear parabolic equation having a reaction term and a Radon measure datum: where 1 < p < N, Œ© is a bounded open subset of ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 2), Œî p u = div(|‚àáu| p‚àí2 ‚àáu) is the so called p-Laplacian operator, sign s ., œï(ŒΩ 0 ) ‚àà L 1 (Œ©), Œº is a finite Radon measure and f ‚àà L ‚àû (Œ©√ó(0, T)) for every T > 0. Then we apply this existence result to show wild nonuniqueness for a connected nonlinear parabolic problem having a gradient term with natural growth.

title: Periodic Solutions of Systems with Singularities of Repulsive Type
abstract: Abstract Motivated by the classical Coulomb central motion model, we study the existence of T-periodic solutions for the nonlinear second order system of singular ordinary differential equations u‚Ä≤‚Ä≤ + g(u) = p(t). Using topological degree methods, we prove that when the nonlinearity g : ‚Ñù N \{0} ‚Üí‚Ñù N is continuous, repulsive at the origin and bounded at infinity, if an appropriate Nirenberg type condition holds then either the problem has a classical solution, or else there exists a family of solutions of perturbed problems that converge uniformly and weakly in H 1 to some limit function u. Furthermore, under appropriate conditions we prove that u is a classical solution.

title: Infinitely Many Solutions for Quasilinear Elliptic Problems with Broken Symmetry
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is investigating the existence of solutions of the quasilinear elliptic Problem where Œ© is an open bounded domain of R N with C 2 boundary ‚àÇŒ©, Œî p u = div(|‚àáu| p‚àí2 ‚àáu), 1 < p < q < p‚àó, f ‚àà C(Œ©ÃÖ) and œï ‚àà C 2 (Œ©ÃÖ). By means of the so-called Bolle‚Äôs method in [3, 4], we extend a result in [10] where the authors consider Œ© =]0, 1[ N and u = 0 on ‚àÇŒ©.

title: Concentration Phenomena for the Paneitz Curvature Equation in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the Paneitz curvature problem Œî 2 u = (1 + ŒµK(x))u p , x ‚àà ‚Ñù N , where . If K(x) has two critical points satisfying certain conditions, we prove the existence of two peak solutions for the above problem, provided Œµ is small enough.

title: Existence and Uniqueness of Solutions for a Class of p-Laplace Equations on a Ball
abstract: Abstract For a class of equations generalizing the model case Œî p u ‚àí a(r)u p‚àí1 + b(r)u q = 0 in B, u = 0 on‚àÇB, where B is the unit ball in R n , n ‚â• 1, r = |x|, p, q > 1, and Œî p denotes the p-Laplace operator, we give conditions for the existence and uniqueness of positive solution. In case n = 1, we give a more general result.

title: Nonexistence Results of Sign-changing solutions for a Supercritical Problem of the Scalar Curvature Type
abstract: Abstract This paper is devoted to the study of the nonlinear elliptic problem with supercritical critical exponent (P Œµ ) : ‚àíŒîu = K|u| 4/(n‚àí2)+Œµ u in Œ©, u = 0 on ‚àÇŒ©, where Œ© is a smooth bounded domain in ‚Ñù n , n ‚â• 3, K is a C 3 positive function and Œµ is a positive real parameter. We show first that in dimension 3, for Œµ small, (P Œµ ) has no sign-changing solutions with low energy which blow up at two points. For n ‚â• 4, we prove that there are no sign-changing solutions which blow up at two nearby points. We also show that (P Œµ ) has no bubble-tower sign-changing solutions.

title: Beyond the Mountain Pass: Some Applications
abstract: Abstract We will survey three applications of the famous Mountain Pass Lemma by Antonio Ambrosetti and Paul H. Rabinowitz, [6]. Precisely, we will present some results on the following problems: A model of growth and roughening of surfaces, usually called Kardar-Parisi-Zhang model. A supercritical problem involving Hardy-Leray potential with the pole at the boundary. A fourth order nonlinear problem related to epitaxial growth. The common characteristic of all these problems is that we have some extra difficulties in order to apply the Mountain Pass Lemma.

title: Multiple Nontrivial Solutions for Neumann Problems Involving the p-Laplacian: a Morse Theoretical Approach
abstract: Abstract We consider nonlinear elliptic Neumann problems driven by the p-Laplacian. Using variational techniques together with Morse theory (in particular, critical groups and the Poincar√©-Hopf formula), we prove some multiplicity results: either three or four distinct nontrivial solutions are guaranteed, depending on the geometry and smoothness of the nonlinear term.

title: Multiple Periodic Orbits Connecting a Collinear Configuration and a Double Isosceles Configuration in the Planar Equal-Mass Four-Body Problem
authors: Bixiao Shi; Rongchang Liu; Duokui Yan; Tiancheng Ouyang
abstract: Abstract By applying our variational method, we show that there exist 24 local action minimizers connecting two prescribed configurations: a collinear configuration and a double isosceles configuration in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>H</m:mi> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">[</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">]</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>œá</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {H^{1}([0,1],\chi)} in the planar equal-mass four-body problem. Among the 24 local action minimizers, we prove that the one with the smallest action has no collision singularity and it can be extended to a periodic or quasi-periodic orbit. Furthermore, if all the 24 local action minimizers are free of collision, we show that they can generate sixteen different periodic orbits.

title: On Explosive Solutions for a Class of Quasi-linear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract We study existence, uniqueness, multiplicity and symmetry of large solutions for a class of quasi-linear elliptic equations. Furthermore, we characterize the boundary blow-up rate of solutions, including the case where the contribution of boundary curvature appears.

title: Refined Regularity of the Blow-Up Set Linked to Refined Asymptotic Behavior for the Semilinear Heat Equation
authors: Tej‚ÄêEddine Ghoul; Van Tien Nguyen; Hatem Zaag
abstract: We consider u‚Å¢(x,t) , a solution of ‚àÇt‚Å°u=Œî‚Å¢u+|u|p-1‚Å¢u which blows up at some time T>0 , where u:‚ÑùN√ó[0,T)‚Üí‚Ñù , p>1 and (N-2)‚Å¢p<N+2 . Define S‚äÇ‚ÑùN to be the blow-up set of u, that is, the set of all blow-up points. Under suitable non-degeneracy conditions, we show that if S contains an (N-‚Ñì) -dimensional continuum for some ‚Ñì‚àà{1,‚Ä¶,N-1} , then S is in fact a Ìíû2 manifold. The crucial step is to make a refined study of the asymptotic behavior of u near blow-up. In order to make such a refined study, we have to abandon the explicit profile function as a first-order approximation and take a non-explicit function as a first-order description of the singular behavior. This way we escape logarithmic scales of the variable (T-t) and reach significant small terms in the polynomial order (T-t)Œº for some Œº>0 . Knowing the refined asymptotic behavior yields geometric constraints of the blow-up set, leading to more regularity on S.

title: Global Sign-changing Solutions of a Higher Order Semilinear Heat Equation in the Subcritical Fujita Range
authors: Victor A. Galaktionov; Enzo Mitidieri; Stanislav I. Poho≈æaev
abstract: Abstract A detailed study of two classes of oscillatory global (and blow-up) solutions was began in [20] for the semilinear heat equation in the subcritical Fujita range with bounded integrable initial data u(x, 0) = u 0 (x). This study is continued and extended here for the 2mth-order heat equation, for m ‚â• 2, with non-monotone nonlinearity with the same initial data u 0 . The fourth order biharmonic case m = 2 is studied in greater detail. The blow-up Fujita-type result for (0.2) now reads as follows: blow-up occurs for any initial data u0 with positive first Fourier coefficient: ‚à´ u 0 (x) dx > 0, i.e., as for (0.1), any such arbitrarily small initial function u 0 (x) leads to blow-up. The construction of two countable families of global sign changing solutions is performed on the basis of bifurcation/branching analysis and a further analytic-numerical study. In particular, a countable sequence of bifurcation points of similarity solutions is obtained:

title: Nonlinear Parametric Robin Problems with Combined Nonlinearities
authors: Nikolaos S. Papageorgiou; Vicen≈£iu D. RƒÉdulescu
abstract: Abstract We consider a nonlinear parametric Robin problem driven by the p-Laplacian. We assume that the reaction exhibits a concave term near the origin. First we prove a multiplicity theorem producing three solutions with sign information (positive, negative and nodal) without imposing any growth condition near ¬±‚àû on the reaction. Then, for problems with subcritical reaction, we produce two more solutions of constant sign, for a total of five solutions. For the semilinear problem (that is, for p = 2), we generate a sixth solution but without any sign information. Our approach is variational, coupled with truncation, perturbation and comparison techniques and with Morse theory.

title: Adams Type Inequality and Application for a Class of Polyharmonic Equations with Critical Growth
authors: Jo√£o Marcos do √ì; Abiel Costa Macedo
abstract: Abstract In this paper we give a new Adams type inequality for the Sobolev space W m,2 (‚Ñù 2m ). By using this inequality in combination with mini-max method we establish the existence of nontrivial solutions to the following class of polyharmonic equations (‚àíŒî) m u(x) + u(x) = f (|x|, u), in ‚Ñù 2m , where the nonlinearity is ‚Äúsuperlinear‚Äù and has critical exponential growth at infinite.

title: Solitary Waves for a Class of Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Equations Involving Vanishing Potentials
authors: Jo√£o Marcos do √ì; Elisandra Gloss; C√©sar Costapinto Santana
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the existence of weak positive solutions for the following class of quasilinear Schr√∂dinger equations ‚àíŒîu + V(x)u ‚àí [Œî(u 2 )]u = h(u) in ‚Ñù N , where h satisfies some ‚Äúmountain-pass‚Äù type assumptions and V is a nonnegative continuous function. We are interested specially in the case where the potential V is neither bounded away from zero, nor bounded from above. We give a special attention to the case when V may eventually vanish at infinity. Our arguments are based on penalization techniques, variational methods and Moser iteration scheme.

title: Dynamics of a Class of Advective-diffusive Equations in Ecology
abstract: Abstract In this paper we characterize the dynamics of a generalized version of the model of Belgacem and Cosner [5] within the range of values of the parameters where the trivial steady state is unstable and the problem cannot admit a positive steady state. In such regimes, the dynamics is governed by the metasolutions.

title: Qualitative Properties of Anisotropic Elliptic Schr√∂dinger Equations
authors: G. A. Afrouzi; M. Mirzapour; Vicen≈£iu D. Rdulescu
abstract: Abstract We consider a class of nonlinear stationary Schr√∂dinger-type equations and we are concerned with sufficient properties that guarantee the existence of multiple solutions in a suitable Sobolev space with variable exponents. We first establish that in the case of small perturbations, the problem admits at least two weak solutions. Next, in the case of convexconcave nonlinearities, we obtain conditions for the existence of infinitely many solutions with high (resp., small) energies. The arguments combine variational techniques with a careful analysis of the energy levels.

title: Infinitely Many Solutions for Mixed Elliptic Problems Involving the p‚àíLaplacian
authors: Gabriele Bonanno; Giuseppina D‚ÄôAgu√¨; ŒùŒπŒ∫œåŒªŒ±ŒøœÇ Œ†Œ±œÄŒ±Œ≥ŒµœâœÅŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ
abstract: Abstract In this paper the existence of infinitely many solutions for nonlinear elliptic problems involving the p-Laplacian operator with mixed Dirichlet-Neumann boundary conditions is established. The key assumption is a suitable oscillating behavior, either at infinity or at zero, of the nonlinearity. The approach is based on the critical point theory.

We prove that there exists <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œ¥</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\delta>0} such that the above problem has at least two positive solutions for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:msub> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:msub> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mi>Œ¥</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\lambda_{1}<\lambda<\lambda_{1}+\delta} . Furthermore, we obtain the existence of ground state solutions. Our tools are the Nehari manifold and the concentration compactness principle. This paper can be regarded as an extension of Naimen‚Äôs work [21].

title: Liouvillian First Integrals for Generalized Riccati Polynomial Differential Systems
abstract: Abstract We study the existence and non-existence of Liouvillian first integrals for the generalized Riccati polynomial differential systems of the form x π = y, y π = a(x)y 2 +b(x)y+c(x), where a(x), b(x) and c(x) are polynomials.

title: Existence of two solutions for singular Œ¶-Laplacian problems
authors: Pasquale Candito; Umberto Guarnotta; Roberto Livrea
abstract: Abstract Existence of two solutions to a parametric singular quasi-linear elliptic problem is proved. The equation is driven by the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ¶</m:mi></m:math> \Phi -Laplacian operator, and the reaction term can be nonmonotone. The main tools employed are the local minimum theorem and the Mountain pass theorem, together with the truncation technique. Global <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msup><m:mrow><m:mi>C</m:mi></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>,</m:mo><m:mi>œÑ</m:mi></m:mrow></m:msup></m:math> {C}^{1,\tau } regularity of solutions is also investigated, chiefly via a priori estimates and perturbation techniques.

title: Existence and multiplicity results for first-order Stieltjes differential equations
authors: Lamiae Maia; Noha El Khattabi; Marl√®ne Frigon
abstract: Abstract In this article, we establish existence and multiplicity results for first-order Stieltjes differential equations satisfying a periodic boundary condition or an initial value condition. No monotonicity condition involving the right-hand side <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>f</m:mi> </m:math> f is imposed at the discontinuity points of the derivator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>g</m:mi> </m:math> g . Our results rely on the fixed point index theory and new notions of strict lower and upper solutions. An application to a population model with an extreme event is presented to study the persistence of a species.

title: A general method to study the convergence of nonlinear operators in Orlicz spaces
abstract: Abstract We continue the work started in a previous article and introduce a general setting in which we define nets of nonlinear operators whose domains are some set of functions defined in a locally compact topological group. We analyze the behavior of such nets and detect the fairest assumption, which are needed for the nets to converge with respect to the uniform convergence and in the setting of Orlicz spaces. As a consequence, we give results of convergence in this frame, study some important special cases, and provide graphical representations.

title: The exterior Dirichlet problem for the homogeneous complex k-Hessian equation
authors: Zhenghuan Gao; Xi‚ÄêNan Ma; Dekai Zhang
abstract: Abstract In this article, we consider the homogeneous complex <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>k</m:mi> </m:math> k -Hessian equation in an exterior domain <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">C</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚ßπ</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:math> {{\mathbb{C}}}^{n}\setminus \Omega . We prove the existence and uniqueness of the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>C</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {C}^{1,1} solution by constructing approximating solutions. The key point for us is to establish the uniform gradient estimate and the second-order estimate.

title: Widths of balls and free boundary minimal submanifolds
abstract: Abstract We observe that the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>k</m:mi> </m:math> k -dimensional width of an <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:math> n -ball in a space form is given by the area of an equatorial <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>k</m:mi> </m:math> k -ball. We also discuss the relationship between widths and lower bounds for the area of a free boundary minimal submanifold in a space form ball.

title: Examples of non-Dini domains with large singular sets
abstract: Abstract Let <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:math> u be a nontrivial harmonic function in a domain <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>D</m:mi> <m:mo>‚äÇ</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>d</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> D\subset {{\mathbb{R}}}^{d} , which vanishes on an open set of the boundary. In a recent article, we showed that if <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>D</m:mi> </m:math> D is a <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>C</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {C}^{1} -Dini domain, then, within the open set, the singular set of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:math> u , defined as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>{</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>X</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mover accent="true"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>D</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="true">¬Ø</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mover> <m:mo>:</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>X</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mo>‚à£</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àá</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>X</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚à£</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>}</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> \left\{X\in \overline{D}:u\left(X)=0=| \nabla u\left(X)| \right\} , has finite <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>d</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> \left(d-2) -dimensional Hausdorff measure. In this article, we show that the assumption of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>C</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {C}^{1} -Dini domains is sharp, by constructing a large class of non-Dini (but almost Dini) domains whose singular sets have infinite <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi class="MJX-tex-caligraphic" mathvariant="script">‚Ñã</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>d</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {{\mathcal{ {\mathcal H} }}}^{d-2} -measures.

title: Multiplicity results for systems of asymptotically linear second order equations
abstract: Abstract We prove the existence and multiplicity of solutions, with prescribed nodal properties, for a BVP associated with a system of asymptotically linear second order equations. The applicability of an abstract continuation theorem is ensured by upper and lower bounds on the number of zeros of each component of a solution.

title: Generalized Attractor-Repeller Pairs, Diagonalizability and Integral Separation
abstract: Abstract We introduce the notion of a generalized attractor-repeller pair for ·∫ã = A(t)x which in fact is an attractor-repeller pair for the induced (nonlinear) flow on the projective space, and use it to characterize diagonalizability. We show that integral separation implies the existence of generalized attractor-repeller pairs, and use topological dynamics, more precisely the hull of A(t), to prove a converse theorem. The relation to exponential separation is also discussed.

title: Topological Tools in Prescribing the Scalar Curvature on the Half Sphere
abstract: Abstract Using a topological invariant, due to Bahri [4], and dynamical methods, we prove some existence results for the problem prescribing the scalar curvature under zero boundary conditions on the standard half sphere.

title: Multiplicity of Solutions For a Convex-concave Problem With a Nonlinear Boundary Condition
authors: Emerson Abreu; Paulo C√©sar Carri√£o; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki
abstract: Abstract We study the existence of multiple positive solutions for a convex-concave problem, denoted by (P ŒªŒº ), with a nonlinear boundary condition involving two critical exponents and two positive parameters Œª and Œº. We obtain a continuous strictly decreasing function f such that K 1 ‚â° {(f(Œº), Œº) : Œº ‚àà [0, ‚àû)} divides [0, ‚àû) √ó [0, ‚àû) \ {(0, 0)} in two connected sets K 0 and K 2 such that problem (P ŒªŒº ) has at least two solutions for (Œª, Œº) ‚àà K 2 , at least one solution for (Œª, Œº) ‚àà K 1 and no solution for (Œª, Œº) ‚àà K 0 .

title: Existence and Regularity Results For Some Singular Elliptic Problems
abstract: Abstract We are interested in the study of existence, uniqueness and regularity of solutions for nonlinear elliptic problems whose model is the linear boundary value problem where 0 ‚àä Œ©. We will prove that such results strongly depend on the size of the lower order term, that is on the constant B.

title: Symmetry-Breaking for Immersed Constant Mean Curvature Hypersurfaces
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove the existence of constant mean curvature hypersurfaces which are cylindrically bounded and which bifurcate from the family of immersed constant mean curvature hypersurface of revolution. Based on the study of the spectrum of the Jacobi operator (the linearized mean curvature) about this family, the existence of new branches follows from a bifurcation result of Crandall and Rabinowitz.

title: Comparison Principle For Quasilinear Parabolic Inclusions with Clarke‚Äôs Gradient
abstract: Abstract We prove existence and comparison results for quasilinear parabolic inclusions with Clarke‚Äôs generalized gradient via appropriately defined sub-supersolution only assuming a local L q -boundedness condition on Clarke‚Äôs gradient. The developed comparison principle allows us to show the equivalence of the considered parabolic inclusion with an associated evolutionary hemivariational inequality.

title: Ground State Solutions for Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Equations with Critical Growth and Lower Power Subcritical Perturbation

function including critical growth and lower power subcritical perturbation, and the potential <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>V</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> Roy. Soc. Edinburgh Sect. A 129 1999, 4, 787‚Äì809], we obtain the existence of positive ground state solutions for the given problem.

title: Some Remarks on the Fractal Structure of Irrigation Balls
abstract: Abstract The paper is related to a conjecture by Pegon, Santambrogio and Xia concerning the dimension of the boundary of some sets which we are calling ‚Äúirrigation balls‚Äù. We propose a notion of sub-balls and sub-spheres of prescribed radius and we prove that, generically, the only possible Minkowski dimension of sub-spheres is the one expected in the conjecture. At the same time, beside the scale transition properties and the dimension estimates on some significant sets, we propose a third approach to study the fractal regularity which relies on lower oscillation estimates on the landscape function, which turns out to behave as a Weierstrass-type function.

title: Rabinowitz Alternative for Non-cooperative Elliptic Systems on Geodesic Balls
authors: S≈Çawomir Rybicki; Naoki Shioji; Piotr Stefaniak
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper is to study properties of continua (closed connected sets) of nontrivial solutions of non-cooperative elliptic systems considered on geodesic balls in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>S</m:mi> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {S^{n}} . In particular, we show that if the geodesic ball is a hemisphere, then all these continua are unbounded. It is also shown that the phenomenon of global symmetry-breaking bifurcation of such solutions occurs. Since the problem is variational and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>SO</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\operatorname{SO}(n)} -symmetric, we apply the techniques of equivariant bifurcation theory to prove the main results of this article. As the topological tool, we use the degree theory for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>SO</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\operatorname{SO}(n)} -invariant strongly indefinite functionals defined in [A. Go≈Ç»©biewska and S. A. Rybicki, Global bifurcations of critical orbits of G -invariant strongly indefinite functionals, Nonlinear Anal. 74 2011, 5, 1823‚Äì1834].

title: Existence of Multiple Periodic Solutions for a Semilinear Wave Equation in an n-Dimensional Ball
abstract: Abstract This paper is devoted to the study of periodic solutions for a radially symmetric semilinear wave equation in an n -dimensional ball. By combining the variational methods and saddle point reduction technique, we obtain the existence of at least three periodic solutions for arbitrary space dimension n . The structure of the spectrum of the linearized problem plays an essential role in the proof, and the construction of a suitable working space is devised to overcome the restriction of space dimension.

title: Existence of Solutions for Choquard Type Elliptic Problems with Doubly Critical Nonlinearities
abstract: Abstract In this article, we first study the existence of nontrivial solutions to the nonlocal elliptic problems in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} involving fractional Laplacians and the Hardy‚ÄìSobolev‚ÄìMaz‚Äôya potential. Using variational methods, we investigate the attainability of the corresponding minimization problem, and then obtain the existence of solutions. We also consider another Choquard type equation involving the p -Laplacian and critical nonlinearities in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} .

title: Bounding Surfaces and Second Order Quasilinear Equations with Compatible Nonlinear Functional Boundary Conditions
abstract: Abstract We establish existence results for solutions to functional boundary value problems for œÜ- Laplacian ordinary differential equations assuming there are lower and upper solutions and Lipschitz bounding surfaces for the derivative which we adapt to our problem. Our results apply to some problems which do not satisfy Nagumo growth bounds. Moreover they contain as special cases many results for the p- and …∏-Laplacians as well as many results where the boundary conditions depend on n-points or even functionals. Our boundary conditions generalize those of Fabry and Habets, Cabada and Pouso, Cabada, O‚ÄôRegan and Pouso, and many others.

title: A Resonant-Superlinear Elliptic Problem Revisited
abstract: Abstract We consider the resonant-superlinear elliptic problem -Œîu = Œª 1 u + (u + ) q + f (x), with Dirichlet boundary conditions on a bounded regular domain of ‚Ñù N . We assume that with s > N satisfies ‚à´ Œ© fœÜ 1 < 0 and (Œª 1 , œÜ 1 ) is the first eigenpair of ‚àíŒî on H 1 0 (Œ©). We apply a non-well ordered lower and upper solution result on a family of modified problems and obtain a sequence of localized solutions of these modified problems. Thanks to this localization and a precise bootstrap argument we are abble to prove that for large modification, these solutions are, in fact, solutions of our initial problem. The problem was already considered in [2] by a totally different approach.

title: Estimates of the Green‚Äôs Function and its Regular Part on Heisenberg Group Domains
abstract: Abstract This paper is a preliminary work on Heisenberg group domains, devoted to the study of the Green‚Äôs function for the Kohn Laplacian on domains far away from the set of characteristic points. We give some estimates of the Green‚Äôs function, its regular part and their derivatives analogous to those proved by A. Bahri, Y.Y. Li, O. Rey in [1], and O. Rey in [16] for Euclidean domains. While the study of such functions on the set of characteristic points of the given domain will be discussed in a forthcoming paper.

title: Bifurcation Results of Positive Solutions for an Indefinite Nonlinear Elliptic System II
abstract: Abstract We study local and global bifurcations of the following elliptic system where the constant a is greater than the principal eigenvalue of (-Œî,Œ©), and Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N is a bounded smooth domain (N ‚â§ 3). The parameters Œº 1 ,Œº 2 are real numbers. We identify some intervals of Œ≤ in which there exist finitely many bifurcation points with respect to a trivial solution branch. In particular, when N = 1 or Œ© is radial, every bifurcation branch exists globally and is characterized by a nodal property for the difference of the two components of the solutions.

title: Non-constant Periodic Solutions for Second Order Hamiltonian System Involving the p-Laplacian
abstract: Abstract In this paper, some existence theorems are obtained for non-constant periodic solutions of second order Hamiltonian system involving the p-Laplacian by using the linking method. Our results generalize and improve several known results in the literature.

title: Counterexamples to C<sup>2</sup> Boundary Estimates for a Fully Nonlinear Yamabe Problem on Manifolds with Boundary
abstract: Abstract On closed manifolds, gradient and Hessian a priori estimates for fully nonlinear Yamabe problems are known to hold. On manifolds with boundary, gradient estimates are known to hold, while Hessian estimates hold if the prescribed mean curvature is positive. Examples are given here which show that Hessian estimates can fail when the mean curvature is negative.

title: Sublinear Elliptic Equations With Singular Potentials
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove existence and summability results for solutions of equations whose model is with a > 0 and f in some Marcinkiewicz space, thus extending the results of [4]. We the use these results to prove similar theorems for equations whose model is with 0 < Œ∏ < 1 and p in some Marcinkiewicz space, thus extending the results of [3].

title: Global Bifurcations of Critical Orbits via Equivariant Conley Index
abstract: Abstract Let V be a finite-dimensional representation of a compact connected Lie group G and let œï : V √ó [Œª 1 , Œª 2 ] ‚Üí ‚Ñù be a family of G-invariant potentials of the class C 2 such that ‚àá v œï(0, Œª) = 0 for every Œª ‚àà [Œª 1 , Œª 2 ], where ‚àá v œï is the gradient of œï with respect to the first coordinate. Denote by V‚Ä≤ i a direct sum of eigenspaces of the isomorphism ‚àá v 2 œï(0, Œª i ) corresponding to positive eigenvalues, i = 1, 2. We have proved that if dimV‚Ä≤ 1 ‚âß dimV‚Ä≤ 2 and the representation V‚Ä≤ 1 is not equivalent (as a linear representation of G) to the representation V‚Ä≤ 2 ‚äï ‚Ñù[2k], k ‚àà {0} ‚à™ ‚Ñï (where ‚Ñù[2k] is a 2k-dimensional trivial representation of G), then there is a global bifurcation of G-orbits of non-zero solutions of problem ‚àá v œï(v, Œª) = 0 from the interval {0} √ó [Œª 1 , Œª 2 ]. We have proved that a global bifurcation and symmetrybreaking of solutions phenomenon occurs simultaneously for elliptic differential equations considered by Smoller and Wasserman in [25], which improves results of [25].

title: Existence and Asymptotic Behavior of Solutions for H√©non Type Systems
abstract: Abstract This paper is concerned with the following H‚Äôenon type problem where B 1 (0) is the unit ball in ‚Ñù N centered at the origin, 1 < p, q and if N ‚â• 3. We show that there exists Œ±‚àó > 0 such that the ground state solution of the problem is non-radial if Œ± > Œ±‚àó. We also consider the limiting behavior of the ground state solution (u, v) as p + q ‚Üí 2‚àó. We prove that the maximum points of two components u and v concentrate at the same point on the boundary ‚àÇB 1 (0).

title: Coupled Versus Uncoupled Blow-Up Rates in Cooperative n-Species Logistic Systems
abstract: Abstract This paper ascertains the exact boundary blow-up rates of the large positive solutions of a class of cooperative logistic systems involving n species in a general domain of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} of class <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi mathvariant="script">ùíû</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mi>ŒΩ</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathcal{C}^{2+\nu}} , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>ŒΩ</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {0<\nu<1} . The problem models a population divided in groups whose individuals compete with those of the same group, while simultaneously they cooperate with the members of the remaining groups. Our main result provides with the exact blow-up rates along the edges of Œ© from the values of the blow-up rates of the underlying uncoupled system. Rather astonishingly, these blow-up rates are independent of the strength of the cooperative effects, which play a secondary role in the analysis carried out in this paper. No previous result of this nature is available in the specialized literature for more than <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {n=2} species.

title: Structure Results for Semilinear Elliptic Equations with Hardy Potentials
abstract: Abstract We prove structure results for the radial solutions of the semilinear problem <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> \Delta u+\frac{\lambda(|x|)}{|x|^{2}}u+f(u(x),|x|)=0, where Œª is a function and f is superlinear in the u -variable. As particular cases, we are able to deal with Matukuma potentials and with nonlinearities f having different polynomial behaviors at zero and at infinity. We give the complete picture for the subcritical, critical and supercritical cases. The technique relies on the Fowler transformation, allowing to deal with a dynamical system in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:math> {{\mathbb{R}}^{3}} , for which elementary invariant manifold theory allows to draw the conclusions involving regular/singular and fast/slow-decay solutions.

Under suitable assumptions, we establish the existence and nonexistence of a positive least energy solution of this system. We also consider the existence and multiplicity of the nontrivial nonnegative solutions.

title: Invariant Foliations Near Normally Hyperbolic Equilibria for Quasilinear Parabolic Problems
authors: Jan Pr√º√ü; Mathias Wilke; Gieri Simonett
abstract: Abstract We consider quasilinear parabolic evolution equations in the situation where the set of equilibria forms a finite-dimensional C 1 -manifold which is normally hyperbolic. The existence of foliations of the stable and unstable manifolds is shown assuming merely C 1 -regularity of the underlying equation.

title: The Brezis‚ÄìNirenberg Problem for the H√©non Equation: Ground State Solutions
abstract: Abstract This work is devoted to the Dirichlet problem for the equation ‚àíŒîu = Œªu + |x|Œ±|u| 2*‚àí2 u in the unit ball of ‚Ñù N . We assume that Œª is bigger than the first eigenvalues of the laplacian, and we prove that there exists a solution provided Œ± is small enough. This solution has a variational characterization as a ground state.

title: Periodic Impact Motions at Resonance of a Particle Bouncing on Spheres and Cylinders
abstract: Abstract We investigate the existence of periodic trajectories of a particle, subject to a central force, which can hit a sphere or a cylinder. We will also provide a Landesman‚ÄìLazer-type condition in the case of a nonlinearity satisfying a double resonance condition. Afterwards, we will show how such a result can be adapted to obtain a new result for the impact oscillator at double resonance.

title: An Example of Chaos for a Cubic Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equation with Periodic Inhomogeneous Nonlinearity
abstract: Abstract Using a topological approach we prove the existence of infinitely many periodic solutions, as well as the presence of symbolic dynamics for second order nonlinear differential equations of the form ‚àí√º ‚àí Œºu + g(t)h(u) = 0 where Œº > 0 is a given constant and g : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù is a periodic positive weight function. Our main application concerns the study of the case in which h(u) is a cubic nonlinearity. Such a choice is motivated by previous investigations dealing with the nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation

title: On a Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Problem at Resonance
authors: Jo√£o Marcos do √ì; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki; Sandra I. Moreira
abstract: Abstract In this paper we establish the existence of standing wave solutions for quasilinear Schr√∂dinger equations involving subcritical growth at resonance. By using a change of variables, the quasilinear equation is reduced to a semilinear one, whose associated functional is well defined in the usual Sobolev space. The ‚Äúfirst‚Äù eigenvalue type of a nonhomogeneous operator has been studied. Using this fact and a variant of the monotone operator theorem, we show that the problem at resonance has at least one nontrivial solution.

title: Chaotic Dynamics of the Kepler Problem with Oscillating Singularity
abstract: Abstract We prove the presence of chaotic dynamics for the classical two-body Kepler problem with a time-periodic gravitational coefficient oscillating between two fixed values. The set of chaotic solutions we detect is coded by the number of revolutions in each period. The chaotic dynamics is obtained for large period T as well as for small angular momentum Œº. In particular, we provide an explicit lower bound on T and explicit upper bound on Œº which guarantee the existence of complex dynamics. We get our results by applying a simple and well-known topological method, the stretching along the path technique. Our results are robust with respect to small perturbations of the gravitational coefficient and to the addition of a small friction term.

title: Remarks on a Class of Semilinear Elliptic Equations on ‚Ñù<sup>n</sup>, via Perturbat ion Met hods
authors: Antonio Ambrosetti; Jes√∫s Garc√≠a Azorero; Ireneo Peral

title: Existence of Radial Solutions for Quasilinear Elliptic Equations with Singular Nonlinearities
abstract: Abstract We prove the existence of radial solutions of the quasilinear elliptic equation div(A(|Du|)Du) + f(u) = 0 in ‚Ñù n , n > 1, where f is either negative or positive for small u > 0, possibly singular at u = 0, and grows subcritically for large u. Our proofs use only elementary arguments based on a variational identity. No differentiability assumptions are made on f.

title: Averaging of Attractors and Inertial Manifolds for Parabolic PDE With Random Coefficients
abstract: Abstract The averaging method has been used to study random or non-autonomous systems on a fast time scale. We apply this method to a random abstract evolution equation on a fast time scale whose long time behavior can be characterized by a random attractor or a random inertial manifold. The main purpose is to show that the long-time behavior of such a system can be described by a deterministic evolution equation with averaged coefficients. Our first result provides an averaging result on finite time intervals which we use to show that under a dissipativity assumption the attractors of the fast time scale systems are upper semicontinuous when the scaling parameter goes to zero. Our main result deals with a global averaging procedure. Under some spectral gap condition we show that inertial manifolds of the fast time scale system tend to an inertial manifold of the averaged system when the scaling parameter goes to zero. These general results can be applied to semilinear parabolic differential equations containing a scaled ergodic noise on a fast time scale which includes scaled almost periodic motions.

title: Periodic Problem Involving Quasilinear Differential Operator and Weak Singularity
authors: Alberto Cabada; Alexander Lomtatidze; Milan Tvrd√Ω
abstract: Abstract We study the singular periodic boundary value problem of the form (|u‚Ä≤| p‚àí2 u‚Ä≤)‚Ä≤ = f(t, u), u(0) = u(T), u‚Ä≤(0) = u‚Ä≤(T), where 1 < p < ‚àû and f ‚àà Car([0, T] √ó (0,‚àû)) can have a repulsive space singularity at x = 0. Contrary to previous results by Mawhin and Jebelean, Liu Bing and Rach≈Ønkov√° and Tvrd√Ω, we need not assume any strong force conditions. Our main existence results rely on a new antimaximum principle for periodic quasilinear periodic problem, which has an independent meaning.

title: Global Continuation for Quasilinear Elliptic Systems on ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup> and the Equations of Elastostatics
abstract: Abstract We consider quasilinear systems of second order elliptic equations on ‚Ñù N . Using a continuation theorem based on the topological degree for C 1 - Fredholm maps, we derive global properties of a maximal connected set of solutions which decay exponentially to zero at in¬Ønity. These results are used to treat a problem concerning the equilibrium of an elastic body occupying the whole space and subjected to a one parameter family of localized external forces.

title: On the Multiplicity of Orthogonal Geodesics in Riemannian Manifold With Concave Boundary. Applications to Brake Orbits and Homoclinics
authors: Roberto Giamb√≤; Fabio Giannoni; Paolo Piccione
abstract: Abstract Let (M, g) be a complete Riemannian manifold, Œ© ‚äÇ M an open subset whose closure is diffeomorphic to an annulus. If ‚àÇŒ© is smooth and it satisfies a strong concavity assumption, then it is possible to prove that there are at least two geometrically distinct geodesics in Œ©ÃÖ = Œ© ‚à™ ‚àÇŒ© starting orthogonally to one connected component of ‚àÇŒ© and arriving orthogonally onto the other one. The results given in [6] allow to obtain a proof of the existence of two distinct homoclinic orbits for an autonomous Lagrangian system emanating from a nondegenerate maximum point of the potential energy, and a proof of the existence of two distinct brake orbits for a class of Hamiltonian systems. Under a further symmetry assumption, it is possible to show the existence of at least dim(M) pairs of geometrically distinct geodesics as above, brake orbits and homoclinics.

title: Solutions of the Generalized Rotation-Modified Kadomtsev-Petviashvili Equation
abstract: Abstract The rotation-modified Kadomtsev-Petviashvili equation is a modification of the Kadomtsev-Petviashvili (KP) equation widely used to describe the effects of rotation on small-amplitude, long waves propagating in one primary direction. In this paper we investigate conditions for the finite-time blow-up solutions and the uniform bounds of the solution of the generalized rotation-modified Kadomtsev-Petviashvili equation. The conditions are expressed in terms of the energy and the best constant of the anisotropic Sobolev inequality.

title: Moduli Space Theory of Constant Mean Curvature Hypersurfaces
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the set of complete noncompact hypersurfaces in ‚Ñù n+1 which have constant mean curvature equal to 1 and a finite number of ends. By means of the application of the implicit function theorem, we will prove that this set has a smooth structure near any nondegenerate element. We start by a review of the functional properties of elliptic operators acting on functions defined on a manifold with cylindrical ends. This will explain the central role played by the indicial roots about an n-Delaunay hypersurface. Then, we will explain how to apply the implicit function theorem in our setting. We partially generalize, in any dimension, the results of R. Kusner, R. Mazzeo and D. Pollack.

title: Existence of Solutions to Quasilinear Elliptic Equations With Singular Weights
authors: Leonelo Iturriaga; Sebasti√°n Lorca; Marcelo Montenegro
abstract: Abstract In this paper we show the existence of multiple solutions to a class of quasilinear elliptic equations with singular weights when the continuous nonlinearity satisfies a superlinear condition only at zero. In particular, our approach allows us to consider superlinear, critical and supercritical nonlinearities.

title: Complete Blow-up and Avalanche Formation for a Parabolic System with Non-Simultaneous Blow-up
authors: Cristina Br√§ndle; Fernando Quir√≥s; Julio D. Rossi
abstract: Abstract We study the possibility of defining a nontrivial continuation after the blow-up time for a system of two heat equations with a nonlinear coupling at the boundary. It turns out that any possible continuation that verifies a maximum principle is identically infinity everywhere after the blow-up time; that is, both components blow up completely. We also analyze the propagation of the singularity to the whole space, the avalanche, when blow-up is non-simultaneous.

title: A Note on a Class of Reversible Hamiltonian Systems
abstract: Abstract Earlier papers have studied the existence of solutions of reversible Hamiltonian systems that are heteroclinic between a pair of minimizing periodic solutions. This note extends some of that work by allowing more degenerate behavior for the class of periodic minimizers.

title: Pseudo Focal Points Along Lorentzian Geodesics and Morse Index
authors: Miguel √Ångel Javaloyes; Antonio Masiello; Paolo Piccione
abstract: Abstract Given a Lorentzian manifold (M, g), a geodesic Œ≥ in M and a timelike Jacobi field Œ≥ along Œ≥, we introduce a special class of instants along Œ≥ that we call Œ≥- pseudo conjugate (or focal relatively to some initial orthogonal submanifold). We prove that the Œ≥-pseudo conjugate instants form a finite set, and their number equals the Morse index of (a suitable restriction of) the index form. This gives a Riemannian-like Morse index theorem. As special cases of the theory, we will consider geodesics in stationary and static Lorentzian manifolds, where the Jacobi field Œ≥ is obtained as the restriction of a globally defined timelike Killing vector field.

authors: Huyuan Chen; Xia Huang; Feng Zhou
abstract: Abstract Our purpose in this paper is to study positive solutions of the Lane‚ÄìEmden equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>V</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mtext>in </m:mtext> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚àñ</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">{</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">}</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> -\Delta u=Vu^{p}\quad\text{in }\mathbb{R}^{N}\setminus\{0\}, perturbed by a nonhomogeneous potential V , with <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mi>c</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> p\in(\frac{N}{N-2},p_{c}) , where <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msub> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mi>c</m:mi> </m:msub> </m:math> {p_{c}} is the Joseph‚ÄìLudgren exponent. We construct a sequence of fast and slow decaying solutions with appropriated restrictions for V .

title: Deforming a Convex Hypersurface by Anisotropic Curvature Flows
authors: Hongjie Ju; BoYa Li; Yan‚ÄêNan Liu
abstract: In this paper, we consider a fully nonlinear curvature flow of a convex hypersurface in the Euclidean n-space. This flow involves k-th elementary symmetric function for principal curvature radii and a function of support function. Under some appropriate assumptions, we prove the long-time existence and convergence of this flow. As an application, we give the existence of smooth solutions to the Orlicz-Christoffel-Minkowski problem.

title: The Mean Curvature Equation with Oscillating Nonlinearity
authors: Anderson L. A. de Ara√∫jo; Marcelo Montenegro
abstract: Abstract We find a solution of the Dirichlet problem for the prescribed mean curvature equation in Œ© with u = 0 on ‚àÇŒ©, where Œ© is a smooth bounded domain in ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 1 and f : Œ© √ó [0,‚àû) ‚Üí ‚Ñù is an unbounded continuous function with oscillatory behavior near the origin.

title: Limit Cycles Bifurcating from a 2-Dimensional Isochronous Torus in ‚Ñù<sup>3</sup>
authors: Jaume Llibre; Salom√≥n Rebollo-Perdomo; Joan Torregrosa
abstract: Abstract In this paper we illustrate the explicit implementation of a method for computing limit cycles which bifurcate from a 2-dimensional isochronous set contained in ‚Ñù 3 , when we perturb it inside a class of differential systems. This method is based in the averaging theory. As far as we know all applications of this method have been made perturbing noncompact surfaces, as for instance a plane or a cylinder in ‚Ñù 3 . Here we consider polynomial perturbations of degree d of an isochronous torus. We prove that, up to first order in the perturbation, at most 2(d+1) limit cycles can bifurcate from a such torus and that there exist polynomial perturbations of degree d of the torus such that exactly ŒΩ limit cycles bifurcate from such a torus for every ŒΩ ‚àà {2, 4,...,2(d + 1)}.

title: Topological Methods for Boundary Mean Curvature Problem on B<sup>n</sup>
authors: Mohammed Alghamdi; Hichem Chtioui; Khadijah Sharaf
abstract: Abstract Using an algebraic topological method and the tools of the theory of the critical points at infinity, we provide a variety of classes of functions that can be realized as the mean curvature on the boundary of the the n-dimensional balls.

title: A Multiplicity Theorem for p-Superlinear Neumann Problems with a Nonhomogeneous Differential Operator
abstract: Abstract We consider a nonlinear Neumann problem driven by a nonhomogeneous differential operator (special case is the p-Laplacian) with a (p ‚àí 1)-superlinear Carath√©odory reaction term, which need not satisfy the usual in such cases Ambrosetti-Rabinowitz condition. Using variational methods based on the critical point theory coupled with suitable truncation techniques, we show that the problem has at least five nontrivial smooth solutions.

title: Existence and Concentration of Positive Ground State Solutions for Schr√∂dinger-Poisson Systems
authors: Jun Wang; Lixin Tian; Junxiang Xu; Fubao Zhang
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the existence and concentration of positive ground state solutions for the semilinear Schr√∂dinger-Poisson system where Œµ > 0 is a small parameter and Œª ‚â† 0 is a real parameter, f is a continuous superlinear and subcritical nonlinearity. Suppose that b(x) has a maximum. We prove that the system has a positive ground state solution for all Œª ‚â† 0 and sufficiently small Œµ > 0. Moreover, for each Œª ‚â† 0 we show that u Œµ converges to the positive ground state solution of the associated limit problem and concentrates to a maximum point of b(x) in certain sense as Œµ ‚Üí 0. Furthermore, we obtain some sufficient conditions for the nonexistence of positive ground state solutions.

title: Asymptotically Linear Problems and Antimaximum Principle for the Square Root of the Laplacian
authors: David Arcoya; Eduardo Colorado; Tommaso Leonori
abstract: Abstract This work deals with bifurcation of positive solutions for some asymptotically linear problems, involving the square root of the Laplacian (‚àíŒî) 1/2 . A simplified model problem is the following: with Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N a smooth bounded domain, N ‚â• 2, Œª > 0, m ‚àà L ‚àû (Œ©), m + ‚â¢ 0 and g is a continuous function which is super-linear at 0 and sub-linear at infinity. As a consequence of our bifurcation theory approach we prove some existence and multiplicity results. Finally, we also show an anti-maximum principle in the corresponding functional setting.

title: Existence for Second Order Differential Inclusions on ‚Ñù<sub>+</sub> Governed by Monotone Operators
abstract: Abstract Consider in a real Hilbert space H the differential equation (inclusion) (E): p(t)u‚Ä≥(t) + q(t)u‚Ä≤(t) ‚àà Au(t) + f (t) for a.a. t ‚àà ‚Ñù + = [0,‚àû), subject to the condition , where A: D(A) ‚äÇ H ‚Üí H is a (possibly set-valued) maximal monotone operator whose range contains 0; p, q ‚àà L ‚àû (‚Ñù + ), with ess inf p > 0 and either ess inf q > 0 or ess sup q < 0. Eq. (E) has been investigated under various assumptions by Barbu [1]-[2], Brezis [4], V√©ron [9]-[10] and others. Recently (see Moro≈üanu [8]), we proved existence and uniqueness of a strong solution to Eq. (E) subject to u(0) = x ‚àà D(A) in the weighted space X = L b 2 (‚Ñù + ; H), where b(t) = a(t)/p(t), a(t) = exp(‚à´ 0 t q(s)/p(s) ds), under our weak conditions on p and q (see above). Here we extend this result to the general case , while keeping the other assumptions unchanged, thus solving a long standing problem. In addition, the proof of our recent result, which is the starting point of the present paper, is considerably simplified. Furthermore, some qualitative properties of solutions are pointed out, an application to a minimization problem is given, and some open problems are formulated.

title: Maxwell‚Äôs Equations in Anisotropic Media and Carnot Groups as Variational Limits
abstract: Abstract Let G be a free Carnot group (i.e. a connected simply connected nilpotent stratified free Lie group) of step 2. In this paper, we prove that the variational functional generated by ‚Äúintrinsic‚Äù Maxwell‚Äôs equations in G is the Œì-limit of a sequence of classical (i.e. Euclidean) variational functionals associated with strongly anisotropic dielectric permittivity and magnetic permeability in the Euclidean space.

title: Entire Large Solutions to Elliptic Equations of Power Non-linearities with Variable Exponents
abstract: Abstract We give conditions on the variable exponent q that ensure the existence and nonexistence of a positive solution to the elliptic equation Œîu = u q(x) on ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 3) which satisfies lim |x|‚Üí‚àû u(x) = ‚àû. The nonnegative function q is required to be locally H√∂lder continuous on ‚Ñù N . We prove existence for q > 1 provided q(x) decays to unity rapidly as |x| ‚Üí ‚àû. We treat the case q ‚â§ 1 as a special case of q ‚àí 1 changing signs and show that a solution exists provided q is asymptotically radial. In addition, we give an example to show that our results are nearly optimal.

title: Multiple Non Semi-Trivial Solutions for Elliptic Systems
abstract: Abstract This is a continuation of our previous paper Chang, Wang, Zhang [6]. We investigate the multiple non semi-trivial solutions for nonlinear elliptic systems by two kinds of index theory. In particular the pseudo index theory for the Z 2 √ó Z 2 index theory is developed

title: Heteroclinic Solutions to Asymptotically Autonomous Equations via Continuation Methods
abstract: Abstract By means of a continuation argument, we prove the existence of at least one increasing heteroclinic solution to a scalar equation of the kind ·∫ç = a(t)V‚Ä≤(x), where V is a non-negative double well potential, and a(t) is a positive, measurable coefficient, which is definitively monotone with respect to |t|, converges to l as |t| diverges and fulfils one of the two following assumptions: a(t) ‚â• l everywhere, or a(t) ‚àí l converges to 0, as |t| ‚Üí +‚àû, more slowly than a suitable exponential term.

title: Bound States with Clustered Peaks for Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equations with Compactly Supported Potentials
authors: Yinbin Deng; Shuangjie Peng; Huirong Pi
abstract: Abstract We consider the existence of positive bound states for the nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation ‚àíŒµ 2 Œîu + V(x)u = u p , u > 0, u ‚àà H 1 (‚Ñù N ), where N ‚â• 3, 1 < p < (N + 2)/(N ‚àí 2), and V is a nonnegative potential with compact support. For arbitrary positive integer k ‚àà Z+, we construct higher energy solutions with exactly k peaks which interact with each other and cluster around a local maximum point of V when Œµ is sufficiently small. The main part of the solutions decays exponentially but the perturbation part decays algebraically at infinity.

title: Superposition Operators Between Higher-order Sobolev Spaces and a Multivariate Fa√† di Bruno Formula: Supercritical Case
abstract: Abstract This paper is a continuation of the work begun in [6] on superposition operators, (N g u) (x) = g(u(x)), between two arbitrary Sobolev spaces. Sufficient conditions which ensure the well-definedness, the continuity and the validity of the higher-order chain rule for such operators are given in the supercritical case (see Remark 1.1). As a consequence of these properties, it is proved that N g (W m,p (Œ©) ‚à© W 0 k,p (Œ©)) ‚äÇ W 0 l,q (Œ©).

title: Homogenization of Maximal Monotone Vector Fields via Selfdual Variational Calculus
authors: Nassif Ghoussoub; Abbas Moameni; Ram√≥n Z√°rate S√°iz
abstract: Abstract We use the theory of selfdual Lagrangians to give a variational approach to the homogenization of equations in divergence form, that are driven by a periodic family of maximal monotone vector fields. The approach has the advantage of using Œì-convergence methods for corresponding functionals just as in the classical case of convex potentials, as opposed to the graph convergence methods used in the absence of potentials. A new variational formulation for the homogenized equation is also given.

title: Asymptotic mean-value formulas for solutions of general second-order elliptic equations
authors: Pablo Blanc; Fernando Charro; Juan J. Manfredi; Julio D. Rossi
abstract: Abstract We obtain asymptotic mean-value formulas for solutions of second-order elliptic equations. Our approach is very flexible and allows us to consider several families of operators obtained as an infimum, a supremum, or a combination of both infimum and supremum, of linear operators. The families of equations that we consider include well-known operators such as Pucci, Issacs, and k -Hessian operators.

title: On subsolutions and concavity for fully nonlinear elliptic equations
abstract: Abstract Subsolutions and concavity play critical roles in classical solvability, especially a priori estimates, of fully nonlinear elliptic equations. Our first primary goal in this paper is to explore the possibility to weaken the concavity condition. The second is to clarify relations between weak notions of subsolution introduced by Sz√©kelyhidi and the author, respectively, in attempt to treat equations on closed manifolds. More precisely, we show that these weak notions of subsolutions are equivalent for equations defined on convex cones of type 1 in the sense defined by Caffarelli, Nirenberg and Spruck.

title: A Liouville theorem for superlinear parabolic equations on the Heisenberg group
abstract: Abstract We consider a parabolic nonlinear equation on the Heisenberg group. Applying the Gidas‚ÄìSpruck type estimates, we prove that under suitable conditions, the equation does not have positive solutions. As an application of the nonexistence result, we provide optimal universal estimates for positive solutions.

title: Nonlinear problems inspired by the Born‚ÄìInfeld theory of electrodynamics
abstract: Abstract It is shown that nonlinear electrodynamics of the Born‚ÄìInfeld theory type may be exploited to shed insight into a few fundamental problems in theoretical physics, including rendering electromagnetic asymmetry to energetically exclude magnetic monopoles, achieving finite electromagnetic energy to relegate curvature singularities of charged black holes, and providing theoretical interpretation of equations of state of cosmic fluids via k-essence cosmology. Also discussed are some nonlinear differential equation problems.

title: Annuloids and Œî-wings
authors: David Hoffman; Francisco Mart√≠n; Brian White
abstract: Abstract We describe new annular examples of complete translating solitons for the mean curvature flow and how they are related to a family of translating graphs, the Œî-wings. In addition, we will prove several related results that answer questions that arise naturally in this investigation. These results apply to translators in general, not just to graphs or annuli.

title: Infinite energy harmonic maps from quasi-compact K√§hler surfaces
abstract: Abstract We construct infinite energy harmonic maps from a quasi-compact K√§hler surface with a Poincar√©-type metric into an NPC space. This is the first step in the construction of pluriharmonic maps from quasiprojective varieties into symmetric spaces of non-compact type, Euclidean and hyperbolic buildings and Teichm√ºller space.

title: On constant higher order mean curvature hypersurfaces in H n √ó R ${\mathbb{H}}^{n}{\times}\mathbb{R}$
authors: Barbara Nelli; Giuseppe Pipoli; Giovanni Russo
abstract: Abstract We classify hypersurfaces with rotational symmetry and positive constant r -th mean curvature in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">H</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>√ó</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:math> ${\mathbb{H}}^{n}{\times}\mathbb{R}$ . Specific constant higher order mean curvature hypersurfaces invariant under hyperbolic translation are also treated. title: On the large solutions to a class of k-Hessian problems
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the k -Hessian problem S k ( D 2 u ) = b ( x ) f ( u ) in Œ©, u = +‚àû on ‚àÇ Œ©, where Œ© is a C ‚àû -smooth bounded strictly ( k ‚àí 1)-convex domain in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{N}$ with N ‚â• 2, b ‚àà C ‚àû (Œ©) is positive in Œ© and may be singular or vanish on ‚àÇ Œ©, f ‚àà C [0, ‚àû) ‚à© C 1 (0, ‚àû) (or <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>C</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> $f\in {C}^{1}\left(\mathbb{R}\right)$ ) is a positive and increasing function. We establish the first expansions (equalities) of k -convex solutions to the above problem when f is borderline regularly varying and Œì-varying at infinity respectively. For the former, we reveal the exact influences of some indexes of f and principal curvatures of ‚àÇ Œ© on the first expansion of solutions. For the latter, we find the principal curvatures of ‚àÇ Œ© have no influences on the expansions. Our results and methods are quite different from the existing ones (including k = N ). Moreover, we know the existence of k -convex solutions to the above problem (including k = N ) is still an open problem when b possesses high singularity on ‚àÇ Œ© and f satisfies Keller‚ÄìOsserman type condition. For the radially symmetric case in the ball, we give a positive answer to this open problem, and then we further show the global estimates for all radial large solutions.
