abstract: Abstract In this paper, we prove the existence of a bounded linear extension operator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>T</m:mi> <m:mo>:</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>L</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>E</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>L</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> $T:{L}^{2,p}\left(E\right)\to {L}^{2,p}\left({\mathbb{R}}^{2}\right)$ when 1 < p < 2, where <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>E</m:mi> <m:mo>‚äÇ</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> $E\subset {\mathbb{R}}^{2}$ is a certain discrete set with fractal structure. Our proof makes use of a theorem of Fefferman‚ÄìKlartag (‚ÄúLinear extension operators for Sobolev spaces on radially symmetric binary trees,‚Äù Adv. Nonlinear Stud. , vol. 23, no. 1, p. 20220075, 2023) on the existence of linear extension operators for radially symmetric binary trees.

title: The classical solvability for a one-dimensional nonlinear thermoelasticity system with the far field degeneracy
abstract: Abstract We study the local classical solvability of the Cauchy problem to the equations of one-dimensional nonlinear thermoelasticity. The governing model is a coupled system of a nonlinear hyperbolic equation for the displacement and a parabolic equation for the temperature of the elastic material. We allow the hyperbolic equation to degenerate at spacial infinity, which results that the coefficients of the coupled system are not uniformly bounded and then the previous methods for the strictly hyperbolic-parabolic coupled systems are invalid. We introduce a suitable weighted norm to establish the local existence and uniqueness of classical solutions by the contraction mapping principle. The existence time T of the solution is independent of the spatial variable.

title: Homogenization of Smoluchowski-type equations with transmission boundary conditions
abstract: Abstract In this work, we prove a two-scale homogenization result for a set of diffusion-coagulation Smoluchowski-type equations with transmission boundary conditions. This system is meant to describe the aggregation and diffusion of pathological tau proteins in the cerebral tissue, a process associated with the onset and evolution of a large variety of tauopathies (such as Alzheimer‚Äôs disease). We prove the existence, uniqueness, positivity and boundedness of solutions to the model equations derived at the microscale (that is the scale of single neurons). Then, we study the convergence of the homogenization process to the solution of a macro-model asymptotically consistent with the microscopic one.

title: Remarks on analytical solutions to compressible Navier‚ÄìStokes equations with free boundaries

title: Bifurcation From Infinity Induced by a Degeneracy in Semilinear Equations
abstract: Abstract We show that for a class of semilinear elliptic eigenvalue problems, including the model case -Œîu = Œªu - h(x) - h(x)|u| p-1 u, u| ‚àÇŒ© = 0, where p > 1 and the nonnegative function h(x) vanishes on a proper subset of Œ©, global bifurcation branches from higher eigenvalues are unbounded and blow up at parameter values determined by the vanishing set Œ© 0 of h(x). In particular, we prove that bifurcation from infinity is possible only at Œª ‚àà {Œª k (Œ© 0 ) : k ‚â• 1}. Moreover, when Œ© is an interval, for each k ‚â• 1, there is a pair of continuous solution curves that bifurcate out of (Œª k (Œ© 0 ), ‚àû). For various cases, we demonstrate that there is a global bifurcation branch connecting (Œª k (Œ©), 0) and (Œª k (Œ© 0 ), ‚àû). Most of our results do not require the nonlinear term to be odd.

title: Construction of dipole type singular solutions for a biharmonic equation with critical Sobolev exponent
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we construct positive weak solutions of a fourth order conformally invariant equation on S N . These solutions give rise to complete metrics on the complement of finitely many points of S N whose Q-curvature is constant.

title: On the Existence of Positive Solutions of Slightly Supercritical Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract In this paper we deal with existence and multiplicity of solutions for problem P(Œµ, Œ©) below, in bounded domains Œ© which do not satisfy some symmetry prop erties that play an important role in the proof of previous results on this subject. For Œµ > 0 small and k large enough, we construct solutions blowing up, as Œµ ‚Üí 0, at exactly k points which approach the boundary of Œ© as k tends to infinity. We also present some examples showing that solutions of this type also exist in some contractible domains which may be even very close to starshaped domains.

title: Convergence of Approximated Solutions to a Nonstrictly Hyperbolic System
authors: Yun‚Äêguang Lu; Ignacio Mantilla; Leonardo Rend√≥n
abstract: Abstract In this paper, four classes of special entropy-entropy flux pairs of Lax type for the nonstrictly hyperbolic system of type (1.1) (Le Roux system) are constructed based on the solutions of the standard Fuchsion equation. The second derivatives of these entropies are all singular at the point (0,O). A careful computation for these entropies at the singular point shows the compactness of Œ∑(u 1 , v 1 ) t + q(u 1 , v 1 ) x in H -1 loc :(R x R + ) with respect to the approximated solutions constructed by using viscosity method or Friedrichs-Lax scheme method. These entropies provide a convergence theorem in the strong topology for the artifical viscosity method or Friedrichs-Lax scheme method when applied to the Cauchy problem (1.1),(1.4) and used together with the theory of compensated compactness.

title: Boundary Behavior of Solutions of some Weakly Superlinear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract We study the behavior near a boundary point O of an open subset Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N of any solution u ‚àà C(Œ©ÃÖ \ {0}) of the problem with the boundary condition g ‚àà C(‚àÇŒ©). We prove a boundary trace result for solutions of the associated equation and point out the existence of various types of singular behavior. We deduce a classification of isolated boundary singularities for solutions of (0.1) depending on the value of Œ± with respect to 2.

title: Rotation Numbers and Global Bifurcation in Systems of Ordinary Differential Equations
abstract: Abstract Global bifurcation in boundary value problems for systems of ordinary differential equations is studied. Rotation numbers are associated with solutions and are shown to be invariant along bifurcating continua. This invariance is then used to analyze the global structure of the bifurcating continua, and to demonstrate the existence of infinitely many solutions to some boundary value problems.

title: The Global Existence and Semiclassical Limit of Weak Solutions to Multidimensional Quantum Drift-diffusion Model
abstract: Abstract We establish the global weak solutions to quantum drift-diffusion model, a fourth order parabolic system, in two or there space dimensions with large initial value and periodic boundary conditions and furthermore obtain the semiclassical limit by entropy estimate and compactness argument.

title: Existence and Multiplicity Results for a Class of Coupled Quasilinear Elliptic Systems of Gradient Type
authors: Anna Mar√≠a Candela; Addolorata Salvatore; Caterina Sportelli
abstract:
The aim of this paper is investigating the existence of one or more weak solutions of the coupled quasilinear elliptic system of gradient type \[ (P)\qquad \left\{  egin{array}{ll} - {m div} (A(x, u)\vert

We prove that, even if the coefficients make the variational approach more difficult, under suitable hypotheses functional $\cal{J}$, related to problem $(P)$, admits at least one critical point in the ''right'' Banach space $X$. Moreover, if $\cal{J}$ is even, then $(P)$ has infinitely many weak bounded solutions. The proof, which exploits the interaction between two different norms, is based on a weak version of the Cerami-Palais-Smale condition, a ''good'' decomposition of the Banach space $X$ and suitable generalizations of the Ambrosetti-Rabinowitz Mountain Pass Theorems.

authors: Juli√°n L√≥pez-G√≥mez; Eduardo Mu√±oz-Hern√°ndez; Fabio Zanolin

It is known that, in this case, for some choices of ùõº and ùõΩ, no nontrivial ùëá-periodic solution exists. On the opposite, we show that, depending of some geometric configurations of ùõº and ùõΩ, the existence of a large number of ùëá-periodic solutions (as well as subharmonic solutions) is guaranteed (for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> \lambda>0 and large). Our proof is based on the Poincar√©‚ÄìBirkhoff twist theorem. Applications are given to Volterra‚Äôs predator-prey model with seasonal effects.

title: Retarded Functional Differential Equations on Manifolds and Applications to Motion Problems for Forced Constrained Systems
authors: Pierluigi Benevieri; Alessandro Calamai; Massimo Furi; Maria Patrizia Pera
abstract: Abstract We prove an existence result for T-periodic retarded functional differential equations of the type x π(t) = f(t, x t ), where f is a T-periodic functional tangent vector field on a smooth manifold. As an application we show that any constrained system acted on by a periodic force, possibly with delay, admits a forced oscillation provided that the constraint is a topologically nontrivial compact manifold and the frictional coefficient is nonzero. We conjecture that the same assertion holds true even in the frictionless case.

title: Quasilinear Equations With Boundary Blow-up and Exponential Reaction
abstract: Abstract We consider the quasilinear elliptic problem Œî p u = a(x)e u in a smooth bounded domain Œ© of ‚Ñù N , with u = +‚àû on ”òŒ©. Here Œî p u = div(|‚ñΩu| p-2 ‚ñΩu) is the p-Laplacian operator with p > 1, and a(x) is a continuous positive weight function which can be singular on ”òŒ©. Our results include existence, uniqueness and exact boundary behavior of solutions.

title: On Ground State Solutions to Mixed Type Singular Semi-Linear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract The purpose of the paper is to establish the existence of ground state solutions to -Œîu = Œ∑a(x)f(u)+Œ≥b(x)g(u), where the locally H√∂lder continuous non-negative functions a and b and the non-linearities f and g satisfy some general conditions.

title: Remarks on Existence of Large Solutions for p-Laplacian Equations with Strongly Nonlinear Terms Satisfying the Keller-Osserman Condition
abstract: Abstract We deal with existence of large solutions of ‚àÜ p u = a(x)f(u)+b(x)g(u) in ‚Ñù N . It is shown that if a, b, f, g are non-negative real valued functions with a, b ‚àà C(‚Ñù N ), f, g ‚àà C([0,‚àû)) and f + g ‚â• h where h is a continuous, non-negative, non- decreasing function satisfying the Keller-Osserman condition then the equation above admits a large solution if the equation -‚àÜ p v = a(x) + b(x) in ‚Ñù N has a positive upper solution decaying to zero at infinity. No monotonicity condition is required from either f or g. Our proof is based on the method of lower and upper-solutions. We extend recent results by A. V. Lair and A. Mohammed.

title: A Multiplicity Theorem for Double Resonant Periodic Problems
abstract: Abstract We consider semilinear periodic ordinary differential equations with the nonlinearity exhibiting double resonance at infinity in the spectral interval [Œª k , Œª k+1 ], k ‚â• 1. Using minimax methods based on the critical point theory together with Morse theory, we show that the problem has at least four nontrivial solutions.

title: Multiplicity of Positive Solutions for Critical Singular Elliptic Systems With Concave-Convex Nonlinearities
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider a singular elliptic system with both concave-convex nonlinearities and critical growth terms in bounded domains. The existence and multiplicity results of positive solutions are obtained by variational methods.

title: Connected Branches of Initial Points for Asymptotic BVPs, With Application to Heteroclinic and Homoclinic Solutions
authors: Alessandro Margheri; Carlota Rebelo; Fabio Zanoliny
abstract: Abstract We consider the second order nonlinear ODE u ∫ ‚Äì f(t, u) = 0 and assume that f(¬∑, œÖ 0 ) ‚â° 0; for some œÖ 0 ‚àà ‚Ñù. We prove the existence of closed connected sets Œì ‚äÜ ‚Ñù 2 of initial points such that for each (Œ±, Œ≤) ‚àà Œì there exists a solution u(¬∑) of the given differential equation, with (u(t 0 ), u π(t 0 )) = (Œ±, Œ≤) and (u(t), u π(t)) ‚Üí (œÖ 0 , 0) as t ‚Üí ‚Äì‚àû (or as t ‚Üí +‚àû). These results are then applied to the search of heteroclinic and homoclinic solutions.

title: On Best Constants for Limiting Embeddings of Fractional Sobolev Spaces
authors: David G. Costa; Djairo G. de Figueiredo; Jianfu Yang
abstract: Abstract We consider embeddings of a class of fractional Sobolev spaces E s (Œ©) (s ‚â• 0) into their limiting L p (Œ©) spaces, for a bounded smooth domain Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N , and study the relationship between the best constants for these embeddings and other best constants corresponding to the case Œ© = ‚Ñù N .

title: The Porous Medium Equation With Blowing Up Boundary Data
abstract: Abstract We study the blow-up set of a solution u(x, t) to the porous medium equation, u t = Œî(u m ), in Œ© √ó (0, T) for two different boundary conditions, u(x, t) = f(x)/(T - t) or (x, t) = g(x)/(T - t) on ”òŒ© √ó (0, T). Here m > 1 and Œ© is a bounded smooth domain in ‚Ñù N . We establish point-wise and integral conditions on f and g respectively in order to obtain regional or global blow-up.

title: New Trends in Free Boundary Problems
authors: Serena Dipierro; Aram Karakhanyan; Enrico Valdinoci
abstract: Abstract We present a series of recent results on some new classes of free boundary problems.Differently from the classical literature, the problems considered have either a ‚Äúnonlocal‚Äù feature (e.g., the interaction or/and the interfacial energy may depend on global quantities) or a ‚Äúnonlinear‚Äù flavor (namely, the total energy is the nonlinear superposition of energy components, thus losing the standard additivity and scale invariances of the problem). The complete proofs and the full details of the results presented here are given in [17, 31, 35, 26, 28, 39].

title: The H√©non‚ÄìLane‚ÄìEmden System: A Sharp Nonexistence Result
abstract: Abstract We deal with very weak positive supersolutions to the H√©non‚ÄìLane‚ÄìEmden system on neighborhoods of the origin. In our main theorem we prove a sharp nonexistence result.

title: Stability of Closed Characteristics on Compact Hypersurfaces in R<sup>2n</sup> Under a Pinching Condition
abstract: Abstract In this article, let ‚àë ‚äÇR 2n be a compact convex hypersurface which is (r,R)-pinched with . Then ‚àë carries at least two strictly elliptic closed characteristics; moreover, ‚àë carries at least non-hyperbolic closed characteristics.

title: Multi-Peak Positive Solutions for Nonlinear Fractional Schr\"{o}dinger Systems in ‚Ñù N
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the nonlinear fractional Schr√∂dinger system in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}^{N}}$ . Applying the finite reduction method, we prove that the nonlinear fractional Schr√∂dinger system has multi-peak positive solutions under some suitable conditions.

title: Biharmonic Equations Under Dirichlet Boundary Conditions with Supercritical Growth
authors: Hanen Ben Omrane; Mouna Ghedamsi; Sa√Øma Khenissy
abstract: Abstract We prove nonexistence and uniqueness results of solutions for biharmonic equations under the Dirichlet boundary conditions on a smooth bounded domain. We carry on the work in [10] where the Navier boundary conditions were considered, we define the h -starlikeness of Œ© with respect to the Dirichlet boundary conditions and a classifying number <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mo>*</m:mo> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${M^{*}(\Omega)}$ . This allows us to give a generalized critical exponent for these domains which play the role of the classical critical exponent <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>4</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>4</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:math> ${\frac{N+4}{N-4}}$ . Our approach is based on the Rellich‚ÄìPohozaev type identity [20, 23]. We study some examples of Dirichlet h -starlike domains with either rich topology or rich geometry where our results can apply.

title: On the Existence of Infinite Sequences of Ordered Positive Solutions of Nonlinear Elliptic Eigenvalue Problems
authors: Francisco J√∫lio S. A. Corr√™a; Marcos L. M. Carvalho; J.V. Gon√ßalves; Kaye Silva
abstract: Abstract In this work, we employ minimization arguments and topological degree theory for mappings of type <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msub> <m:mi>S</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> </m:msub> </m:math> ${S_{+}}$ to prove the existence of infinite sequences of ordered solutions for a class of nonlinear equations in which the semilinear term vanishes an infinite number of times. Our results extend earlier ones by Hess [10] and by Loc and Schmitt [15].

title: Convergence of Extremals of Variational Problems on Large Intervals
abstract: Abstract We study the structure of approximate solutions of autonomous variational problems on large finite intervals. In our previous research we showed that approximate solutions are determined mainly by the integrand, and are essentially independent of the choice of time interval and data, except in regions close to the endpoints of the time interval. In the present paper we study the convergence of approximate solutions to solutions of the corresponding infinite horizon problems, in regions close to the endpoints of the time intervals.

title: Existence of a Ground State Solution for a Quasilinear Schr√∂dinger Equation
abstract: Abstract In this paper we are concerned with the quasilinear Schr√∂dinger equation ‚àíŒîu + V(x)u ‚àí Œî(u 2 )u = q(x)|u| p‚àí2 u, x ‚àà ‚Ñù N , where N ‚â• 3, 4 < p < 4N/(N ‚àí 2), and V(x) and q(x) go to some positive limits V ‚àû and q ‚àû respectively as |x| ‚Üí ‚àû. Under a weak one-sided asymptotic estimate for V(x) and q(x) at infinity, we obtain the existence of a ground state solution.

title: Non-hyperbolic Closed Characteristics on Symmetric Compact Convex Hypersurfaces in R<sup>2n</sup>
authors: Hui Liu; Yiming Long; Wei Wang
abstract: Abstract In this paper, let Œ£ ‚äÇ R 2n be a symmetric compact convex hypersurface. We prove that either there are infinitely many closed characteristics or there exist at least 2[n/2] nonhyperbolic closed characteristics on Œ£. Due to the example of weakly non-resonant ellipsoids, this estimate is sharp when n is even. Moreover, we prove that if Œ£ carries exactly n closed characteristics, then at least n ‚àí 2 of them possess irrational mean indices.

title: An Elliptic Equation Involving Exponential Critical Growth in ‚Ñù<sup>2</sup>
authors: Francisco S. B. Albuquerque; Everaldo S. Medeiros
abstract: Abstract We study the following class of nonhomogeneous Schr√∂dinger equations ‚àíŒîu + V(|x|)u = Q(|x|) f(u) + h(x) in ‚Ñù 2 , where V and Q are unbounded or decaying radial potentials, the nonlinearity f (s) has exponential critical growth and the nonhomogeneous term h belongs to the dual of an appropriate functional space. By combining minimax methods and a version of the Trudinger-Moser inequality, we establish the existence and multiplicity of weak solutions for this class of equations.

title: Multi-peak Solutions of a Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equation with Magnetic Fields
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study a nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation with magnetic fields involving subcritical growth. Applying the finite reduction method, we prove that the equation has multi-peak solutions under some suitable conditions which are given in section 1.

title: A Generalized Approach for the Modeling of Goodwin-Type Cycles
authors: Matteo Madotto; Marcellino Gaudenzi; Fabio Zanolin
abstract: Abstract Goodwin‚Äôs celebrated growth cycle model has been widely studied since its introduction in 1967. In recent years several contributions have appeared with the aim of amending the original model so as to improve its economic coherence and enrich its structure. In this article we propose a new and generalized approach, within the theory of planar Hamiltonian systems, for the modeling of Goodwin-type cycles. This new approach, which includes and improves various attempts by the recent literature, is very general and fulfills the essential requirement that the orbits lie entirely in the economically feasible interval. We provide a necessary and sufficient condition for all solutions to be cycles lying entirely in the unit box. In addition, we study the period length of the cycles near the equilibrium and close to the boundary of the domain. Finally, we discuss an example of how small perturbations of the model may affect the qualitative behavior of the solutions.

title: Minimizers of the Rudin-Osher-Fatemi Functionals in Bounded Domains
abstract: Abstract We give some explicit formulas for the minimizers of the Rudin-Osher-Fatemi functionals and on BV(Œ©), where Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù 2 is a bounded domain containing the ball B R (0) and f = œá R (x) is the characteristic function of B R (0).

title: Spacelike Graphs of Prescribed Mean Curvature in the Steady State Space
abstract: Abstract We study the Dirichlet problem of the constant mean curvature equation in the steady state space over a bounded domain of a slice. Under suitable conditions on the convexity of the domain, we prove the existence of a spacelike graph with constant mean curvature H , with <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚â§</m:mo> <m:mi>H</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${-1\leq H<0}$ , and constant boundary values.

title: Estimates for Eigenvalues of Poly-Harmonic Operators
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the eigenvalues of the poly-Laplacian with arbitrary order on a bounded domain in an n -dimensional Euclidean space and we obtain a lower bound which generalizes the results due to Cheng and Wei [5] and gives an improvement of the results due to Cheng, Qi and Wei [3].

title: Fat Handles and Phase Portraits of Non Singular Morse-Smale Flows on S<sup>3</sup> with Unknotted Saddle Orbits
abstract: Abstract In this paper we build Non-singular Morse-Smale flows on S 3 with unknotted and unlinked saddle orbits by identifying fat round handles along their boundaries. This way of building the flows enables to get their phase portraits. We also show that the presence of heteroclinic trajectories imposes an order in the round handle decomposition of these flows; this order is total for NMS flows composed of one repulsive, one attractive and n unknotted saddle orbits, for n ‚â• 1.

title: Initial Trace of Solutions of Hamilton-Jacobi Parabolic Equation with Absorption
abstract: Abstract In this article we study the initial trace problem for the nonnegative solutions of equation u t ‚àí Œîu + |‚àáu| q = 0 in Q Œ©,T = Œ© √ó(0, T) , where q > 0, and Œ© = ‚Ñù N , or Œ© is a bounded domain of ‚Ñù N and u = 0 on ‚àÇŒ© √ó (0, T) . We define the trace at t = 0 as a Borel measure (S, u 0 ), infinite on a closed set S, where u 0 is a Radon measure on Œ©\S. We prove that the trace is a Radon measure when q ‚â¶1. We study the existence for q ‚àà (1, (N +2)/(N +1) and any given (S, u 0 ). When S = œâÃÖ ·Ç∂ Œ©(œâ ‚äÇ Œ©Œ©, œâ open) existence is valid for q ‚â¶ 2 when u 0 ‚àà L loc 1 loc (Œ©) , for q > 1 when u 0 = 0. In particular there exists a self-similar nonradial solution with trace (‚Ñù N+ , 0), with a growth rate of order |x| q/(q‚àí1) as |x| ‚Üí ‚àû for fixed t. Moreover the solutions with trace (œâÃÖ, 0) in , may present a growth rate of order t ‚àí1/(q‚àí1) in œâ and of order t ‚àí(2‚àíq)/(q‚àí1) on ‚àÇœâ.

title: Convex hypersurfaces with prescribed Musielak-Orlicz-Gauss image measure
abstract: Abstract In this article, we study the Musielak-Orlicz-Gauss image problem based on the Gauss curvature flow in Li et al. We deal with some cases in which there is no uniform estimate for the Gauss curvature flow. By the use of the topological method in Guang et al., a special initial condition is chosen such that the Gauss curvature flow converges to a solution of the Musielak-Orlicz-Gauss image problem.

title: A curvature flow to the L p Minkowski-type problem of q-capacity
abstract: Abstract This article concerns the <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mi>L</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> </m:math> {L}_{p} Minkowski problem for q -capacity. We consider the case <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:math> p\ge 1 and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:math> 1\lt q\lt n in the smooth category by a kind of curvature flow, which converges smoothly to the solution of a Monge-Amp√©re type equation. We show the existence of smooth solution to the problem for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mi>n</m:mi> </m:math> p\ge n . We also provide a proof for the weak solution to the problem when <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:math> p\ge 1 , which has been obtained by Zou and Xiong.

title: A note on second derivative estimates for Monge-Amp√®re-type equations
abstract: Abstract In this article, we revisit previous Pogorelov-type interior and global second derivative estimates of N. S. Trudinger, F. Jiang, and J. Liu for solutions of Monge-Amp√®re-type partial differential equations. Taking account of recent strict convexity regularity results of Guillen-Kitagawa and Rankin and following our earlier work in the optimal transportation case, we remove the monotonicity assumptions in the more general case of generated Jacobian equations and consequently in the subsequent application to classical solvability and global regularity for second boundary value problems.

title: Regularity properties of monotone measure-preserving maps
abstract: Abstract In this note, we extend the regularity theory for monotone measure-preserving maps, also known as optimal transports for the quadratic cost optimal transport problem, to the case when the support of the target measure is an arbitrary convex domain and, on the low-regularity end, between domains carrying certain invariant measures.

title: The spinorial energy for asymptotically Euclidean Ricci flow
abstract: Abstract This article introduces a functional generalizing Perelman‚Äôs weighted Hilbert-Einstein action and the Dirichlet energy for spinors. It is well defined on a wide class of noncompact manifolds; on asymptotically Euclidean manifolds, the functional is shown to admit a unique critical point, which is necessarily of min-max type, and the Ricci flow is its gradient flow. The proof is based on variational formulas for weighted spinorial functionals, valid on all spin manifolds with boundary.

title: Propagation of symmetries for Ricci shrinkers
abstract: Abstract We will show that if a gradient shrinking Ricci soliton has an approximate symmetry on one scale, this symmetry propagates to larger scales. This is an example of the shrinker principle which roughly states that information radiates outwards for shrinking solitons.

title: Capillary Schwarz symmetrization in the half-space
authors: Lu Zheng; Chao Xia; Xuwen Zhang
abstract: Abstract In this article, we introduce a notion of capillary Schwarz symmetrization in the half-space. It can be viewed as the counterpart of the classical Schwarz symmetrization in the framework of capillary problem in the half-space. A key ingredient is a special anisotropic gauge, which enables us to transform the capillary symmetrization to the convex symmetrization introduced in Alvino et al. https:/doi.org/10.1016/S0294-1449(97)80147-3 .

title: Linear extension operators for Sobolev spaces on radially symmetric binary trees
abstract: Abstract Let <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>‚àû</m:mi> </m:math> 1\lt p\lt \infty and suppose that we are given a function <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>f</m:mi> </m:math> f defined on the leaves of a weighted tree. We would like to extend <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>f</m:mi> </m:math> f to a function <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>F</m:mi> </m:math> F defined on the entire tree, so as to minimize the weighted <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi>W</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> {W}^{1,p} -Sobolev norm of the extension. An easy situation is when <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:math> p=2 , where the harmonic extension operator provides such a function <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>F</m:mi> </m:math> F . In this note, we record our analysis of the particular case of a radially symmetric binary tree, which is a complete, finite, binary tree with weights that depend only on the distance from the root. Neither the averaging operator nor the harmonic extension operator work here in general. Nevertheless, we prove the existence of a linear extension operator whose norm is bounded by a constant depending solely on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:math> p . This operator is a variant of the standard harmonic extension operator, and in fact, it is harmonic extension with respect to a certain Markov kernel determined by <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:math> p and by the weights.

Moreover, by using blow-up analysis and local Pohozaev identities, we prove that the multi-peak solution we construct is non-degenerate. To our knowledge, it seems be the first non-degeneracy result on the Sch√∂dinger-Poisson system.

title: On a version of hybrid existence result for a system of nonlinear equations
authors: Micha≈Ç Be≈Çdzi≈Ñski; Marek Galewski; Igor Kossowski
abstract: Abstract By combining monotonicity theory related to the parametric version of the Browder-Minty theorem with fixed point arguments, hybrid existence results for a system of two operator equations are obtained. Applications are given to a system of boundary value problems with mixed nonlocal and Dirichlet conditions.

title: On the Number of Solutions to Semilinear Boundary Value Problems
abstract: Abstract We consider semilinear elliptic problems of the form Œîu + g(u) = f(x) with Neumann boundary conditions or Œîu+Œª1u+g(u) = f(x) with Dirichlet boundary conditions, and we derive conditions on g and f under which an upper bound on the number of solutions can be obtained.

title: Combining Linear and Nonlinear Diffusion
authors: Manuel Delgado; Juli√°n L√≥pez-G√≥mez; Ant√≥nio Su√°rez
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a generalized porous medium equation where the diffusion rate, say m(x) -spatially heterogeneous- is assumed to be linear, m = 1, on a piece of the support domain, Œ© 1 and slow nonlinear, m(x) > 1, in its complement, Œ© m := Œ© \ Œ©ÃÑ 1 . More precisely, we characterize the existence of positive solutions and construct the corresponding global bifurcation diagram as one of the parameters of the model changes, showing that a continuous transition occurs between the diagrams of the completely linear case (Œ© = Œ© 1 ) and of the completely nonlinear case (¬≠Œ© m = Œ©¬≠). As a result, the effect of a localized slow diffusion rate with varying support is completely characterized. Our analysis is imperative in order to design porous media multi-components systems with changing diffusion rates.

title: Homoclinic Orbits For First Order Hamiltonian Systems With Convex Potentials
abstract: Abstract In this paper new estimates on the C 0 -norm of homoclinic orbit are shown for first order convex Hamiltonian systems possessing super-quadratic potentials. Applying these estimates, some new results on the existence of infinitely many geometrically distinct homoclinic orbits are proved, which generalize the main results in [2] and [10].

title: Asymptotic Behavior of the Steklov Eigenvalues For the p‚àíLaplace Operator
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the asymptotic behavior of the Steklov eigenvalues of the p- Laplacian. We show the existence of lower and upper bounds of a Weyl-type expansion of the function N(Œª) which counts the number of eigenvalues less than or equal to Œª, and we derive from them asymptotic bounds for the eigenvalues.

title: Asymptotic Nondegeneracy of Least Energy Solutions to an Elliptic Problem with Critical Sobolev Exponent
abstract: Abstract Consider the problem -‚àÜu = N(N - 2)u p + Œµk(x)u in Œ©, u > 0 in Œ©, u|‚àÇŒ© = 0 where Œ©¬≠ is a smooth bounded domain in ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 6), p = (N +2)/(N - 2), Œµ > 0 and k ‚àà C 2 (Œ©ÃÖ). Under certain assumptions, we prove the nondegeneracy of least energy solutions to the above problem as ∆ê ‚Üí0. This is an extension of the recent work of Grossi [9].

title: Homology for Contact Forms Via Legendrian Curves of General Dual 1-Forms
abstract: Abstract We extend in this paper the definition of the homology for contact forms defined in [1] to the case when the ‚Äùdual‚Äù form Œ≤ is not a contact form anymore.

title: Nonexistence of Positive Solutions for Polyharmonic Systems in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
authors: Yuxia Guo; Jiaquan Liu; Yajing Zhang
abstract: Abstract This work is devoted to the nonexistence of positive solutions for polyharmonic systems (‚àíŒî) m u = f(u, v), (‚àíŒî) m v = g(u, v). Byusing the method of moving plane combined with integral inequalities and Hardy‚Äôs inequality, we prove some new Liouville type theorems for the above semilinear polyharmonic systems in ‚Ñù N .

title: On a Minimization Problem Involving the Critical Sobolev Exponent
abstract: Abstract Following [3] we study the following minimization problem: in any dimension n ‚â• 4 and under suitable assumptions on a(x). Mainly we assume that a(x) belongs to the Lorentz space L n/2 ,d(Œ©) and the set N ‚â° {x ‚àà Œ©|a(x) < 0} has positive Lebesgue measure. Notice that this last condition is satisfied when the set N has a nontrivial interior part (in fact this is the typical assumption imposed in the literature on the set N).

title: A Multiplicity Result Including Sign-Changing Solutions For a Nonlinear Elliptic Problem in R<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract We show that the problem has multiple solutions including sign-changing ones, where Œº > 0, N ‚â• 3, 1 < p < (N + 2)/(N ‚àí 2) and Q : ‚Ñù N ‚Üí ‚Ñù is some continuous function. We obtain signchanging solutions which are not only local minimum types in N * but also mountain pass types in N * , where N * = {u = u + +u ‚àí ‚àà H 1 (‚Ñù N ) : u + ‚â† 0, u ‚àí ‚â† 0, ‚à´ ‚ÑùN (|‚àáu ¬± | 2 + Œº|u ¬± | 2 ) dx = ‚à´ ‚ÑùN Q(x)|u ¬± | p+1 dx}.

title: Existence and Multiplicity Results for Systems of First-Order Differential Equations via the Method of Solution-Regions
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we establish existence and multiplicity results for systems of first-order differential equations. To this end, we introduce the method of solution-regions. It generalizes the method of upper and lower solutions and the method of solution-tubes. Our results can also be seen as viability results since we obtain solutions remaining in suitable regions. We give conditions insuring the existence of at least three viable solutions of a system of first-order differential equations. Many examples are presented to show that a large variety of sets can be solution-regions.

<m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {s\in(0,1)} , is the fractional Laplacian. Using variational technique, we construct a family of positive solutions <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>H</m:mi> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {{u_{\varepsilon}}\in{H^{s}}({\mathbb{R}^{N}})} which concentrates around the local minima of V as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\varepsilon\to 0} under general conditions on f which we believe to be almost optimal.

title: Parabolic Biased Infinity Laplacian Equation Related to the Biased Tug-of-War
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the parabolic inhomogeneous Œ≤-biased infinity Laplacian equation arising from the Œ≤-biased tug-of-war <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>t</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msubsup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> <m:mi>Œ≤</m:mi> </m:msubsup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {u_{t}}-\Delta_{\infty}^{\beta}u=f(x,t), where Œ≤ is a fixed constant and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msubsup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> <m:mi>Œ≤</m:mi> </m:msubsup> </m:math> {\Delta_{\infty}^{\beta}} is the Œ≤-biased infinity Laplacian operator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msubsup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> <m:mi>Œ≤</m:mi> </m:msubsup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msubsup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msubsup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œ≤</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo fence="true" stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>D</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo fence="true" stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> \Delta_{\infty}^{\beta}u=\Delta_{\infty}^{N}u+\beta\lvert Du\rvert related to the game theory named Œ≤-biased tug-of-war. We first establish a comparison principle of viscosity solutions when the inhomogeneous term f does not change its sign. Based on the comparison principle, the uniqueness of viscosity solutions of the Cauchy‚ÄìDirichlet boundary problem and some stability results are obtained. Then the existence of viscosity solutions of the corresponding Cauchy‚ÄìDirichlet problem is established by a regularized approximation method when the inhomogeneous term is constant. We also obtain an interior gradient estimate of the viscosity solutions by Bernstein‚Äôs method. This means that when f is Lipschitz continuous, a viscosity solution u is also Lipschitz in both the time variable t and the space variable x . Finally, when <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {f=0} , we show some explicit solutions.

title: Branches of Forced Oscillations Induced by a Delayed Periodic Force
authors: Alessandro Calamai; Maria Patrizia Pera; Marco Spadini
abstract: Abstract We study global continuation properties of the set of T -periodic solutions of parameterized second order delay differential equations with constant time lag on smooth manifolds. We apply our results to get multiplicity of T -periodic solutions. Our topological approach is mainly based on the notion of degree of a tangent vector field.

title: Blow-Up Results for Higher-Order Evolution Differential Inequalities in Exterior Domains
authors: Mohamed Jleli; Mokhtar Kirane; Bessem Samet
abstract: Abstract We consider a higher-order evolution differential inequality in an exterior domain of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {N\geq 3} , with Dirichlet and Neumann boundary conditions. Using a unified approach, we obtain the critical exponents in the sense of Fujita for the considered problems. Moreover, the behavior of the solutions with respect to the initial data is discussed.

title: An Abstract Linking Theorem Applied to Indefinite Problems Via Spectral Properties
abstract: Abstract An abstract linking result for Cerami sequences is proved without the Cerami condition. It is applied directly in order to prove the existence of critical points for a class of indefinite problems in infinite-dimensional Hilbert Spaces. The applications are given to Schr√∂dinger equations. Here spectral properties inherited by the potential features are exploited in order to establish a linking structure, and hence hypotheses of monotonicity on the nonlinearities are discarded.

title: The E-Cohomological Conley Index, Cup-Lengths and the Arnold Conjecture on T 2n
abstract: Abstract We show that the E -cohomological Conley index, that was introduced by the first author recently, has a natural module structure. This yields a new cup-length and a lower bound for the number of critical points of functionals on Hilbert spaces. When applied to the setting of the Arnold conjecture, this paves the way to a short proof on tori, where it was first shown by C. Conley and E. Zehnder in 1983.

title: Loop Type Subcontinua of Positive Solutions for Indefinite Concave-Convex Problems
authors: Uriel Kaufmann; Humberto Ramos Quoirin; Kenichiro Umezu
abstract: Abstract We establish the existence of loop type subcontinua of nonnegative solutions for a class of concave-convex type elliptic equations with indefinite weights, under Dirichlet and Neumann boundary conditions. Our approach depends on local and global bifurcation analysis from the zero solution in a nonregular setting, since the nonlinearities considered are not differentiable at zero, so that the standard bifurcation theory does not apply. To overcome this difficulty, we combine a regularization scheme with a priori bounds, and Whyburn‚Äôs topological method. Furthermore, via a continuity argument we prove a positivity property for subcontinua of nonnegative solutions. These results are based on a positivity theorem for the associated concave problem proved by us, and extend previous results established in the powerlike case.

title: Multiple Closed Geodesics on Positively Curved Finsler Manifolds
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we prove that on every Finsler manifold <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>F</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(M,F)} with reversibility Œª and flag curvature K satisfying <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>K</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â§</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(\frac{\lambda}{\lambda+1})^{2}<K\leq 1} , there exist <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">[</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>dim</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mfrac> <m:mo stretchy="false">]</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {[\frac{\dim M+1}{2}]} closed geodesics. If the number of closed geodesics is finite, then there exist <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">[</m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mo>dim</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mfrac> <m:mo stretchy="false">]</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {[\frac{\dim M}{2}]} non-hyperbolic closed geodesics. Moreover, there are three closed geodesics on <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>M</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>F</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(M,F)} satisfying the above pinching condition when <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>dim</m:mo> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>M</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\dim M=3} .

title: Existence of a Heteroclinic Solution for a~Double Well Potential Equation in an Infinite Cylinder of ‚Ñù N
abstract: Abstract This paper is concerned with the existence of a heteroclinic solution for the following class of elliptic equations: <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>A</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>œµ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>y</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>V</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Ä≤</m:mo> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mtext>in </m:mtext> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> -\Delta{u}+A(\epsilon x,y)V^{\prime}(u)=0\quad\mbox{in }\Omega, where <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>œµ</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\epsilon>0} , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mo>√ó</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="script">ùíü</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\Omega=\mathbb{R}\times\mathcal{D}} is an infinite cylinder of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} with <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {N\geq 2} . title: Periodic Solutions of Non-autonomous Allen‚ÄìCahn Equations Involving Fractional Laplacian
abstract: Abstract We consider periodic solutions of the following problem associated with the fractional Laplacian: <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mi>s</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>‚Å°</m:mo> <m:mi>F</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {(-\partial_{xx})^{s}u(x)+\partial_{u}F(x,u(x))=0} in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}} . The smooth function <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>F</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {F(x,u)} is periodic about x and is a double-well potential with respect to u with wells at <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {+1} and -1 for any <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {x\in\mathbb{R}} . We prove the existence of periodic solutions whose periods are large integer multiples of the period of F about the variable x by using variational methods. An estimate of the energy functional, Hamiltonian identity and Modica-type inequality for periodic solutions are also established.

title: Asymmetric Robin Problems with Indefinite Potential and Concave Terms
authors: Nikolaos S. Papageorgiou; Vicen≈£iu D. RƒÉdulescu; Du≈°an Repov≈°
abstract: We consider a parametric semilinear Robin problem driven by the Laplacian plus an indefinite and unbounded potential. In the reaction, we have the competing effects of a concave term appearing with a negative sign and of an asymmetric asymptotically linear term which is resonant in the negative direction. Using variational methods together with truncation and perturbation techniques and Morse theory (critical groups) we prove two multiplicity theorems producing four and five respectively nontrivial smooth solutions when the parameter $\lambda>0$ is small.

title: Critical Concave Convex Ambrosetti‚ÄìProdi Type Problems for Fractional ùëù-Laplacian
authors: Hamilton Bueno; Eduardo Huerto Caqui; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki; F√°bio R. Pereira
abstract: In this paper we consider a class of critical concave convex Ambrosetti-Prodi type problems for the fractional $p$-Laplacian operator. By applying the Linking Theorem and the Mountain Pass Theorem as well, the interaction of the nonlinearities with the first eigenvalue of fractional $p$-Laplacian will be used to prove existence and multiplicity of solutions.

title: Existence Results for the Conformal Dirac‚ÄìEinstein System
authors: Chiara Guidi; Ali Maalaoui; Vittorio Martino
abstract: Abstract We consider the coupled system given by the first variation of the conformal Dirac‚ÄìEinstein functional. We will show existence of solutions by means of perturbation methods.

By means of a variational approach, we analyze the topological difference between two levels of an indefinite functional in a neighborhood of expected solutions. Since the nonlocality comes in the decomposition of the space directly, we introduce a new fractional center of mass, via a suitable seminorm. Some other delicate aspects arise strictly related to the presence of the nonlocal operator. By using regularity results based on fractional De Giorgi classes, we show that the found solutions decay polynomially and concentrate around some point of K for Œµ small.

title: Homology Computation
abstract: Abstract We identify using the rational S 1 -cohomology of the space C Œ≤ the odd generators of the homology for contact forms defined in [3].

title: Critical Hyperbolas and Multiple Symmetric Solutions to Some Strongly Coupled Elliptic Systems
authors: Djairo G. de Figueiredo; Ederson Moreira dos Santos; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki
abstract: Abstract We are interested in the existence of multiple symmetric solutions to the Lane-Emden system with H√©non type weights Here B stands for the open unit ball in ‚Ñù N centered at zero, N ‚â• 3, Œ±, Œ≤ ‚â• 0, p, q > 0. In this paper we present a complete picture of the quantitative study of solutions to the system above.

title: Smoothness of Asymptotic Phase Revisited
abstract: Abstract It is well-known that solutions on the stable manifold of a hyperbolic periodic solution of an autonomous system of ordinary differential equations have an asymptotic phase which has the same order of smoothness as the vector field. In this paper we show if the system depends on a parameter that, in general, the asymptotic phase loses one order of smoothness in the parameter.

title: Radial Solutions of a Supercritical Elliptic Equation with Hardy Potential
abstract: Abstract Various properties of radial solutions of the supercritical elliptic equation with Hardy Potential are studied, where Œ© = int{x ‚àà ‚Ñù N | Œ± ‚â§ |x| < b}, which is a ball if 0 = Œ± < b < +‚àû, an annulus if 0 < Œ± < b < +‚àû, an exterior domain if 0 < Œ± < b = +‚àû, and the whole space ‚Ñù N if Œ± = 0, b = +‚àû. We assume p is supercritical, that is, p > 2‚àó with 2‚àó = being the critical Sobolev exponent, and N ‚â• 3.

title: On Fixed Point Index Formula and its Applications in Dynamics
abstract: Abstract The aim of this note is to present a generalization of the topological method for detecting chaotic dynamics in a periodic local processes generated by non-autonomous ordinary differential equations, based on the notion of periodic segments.

title: The Sturm-Liouville Hierarchy of Evolution Equations
abstract: Abstract We introduce a hierarchy of evolution equations based on the Sturm-Liouville equation ‚àí(pœÜ‚Ä≤)‚Ä≤ + qœÜ = ŒªyœÜ. Our hierarchy includes the Korteweg-de Vries (K-dV) and the Camassa-Holm (CH) hierarchy. We determine a class of solutions of the hierarchy which are of algebro-geometric type. The initial condition of such a solution is drawn from a finite-gap isospectral class of the Sturm-Liouville equation.

title: On a Class of Reversible Elliptic Systems
abstract: Abstract For a semilinear elliptic system of PDE‚Äôs which is spatially reversible, we establish the existence of solutions in C 2 (‚Ñù 2 √ó T n‚àí2 , ‚Ñù m ) that are heteroclinic in x 2 between a pair of solutions in C 2 (‚Ñù √ó T n‚àí1 , ‚Ñù m ) that are each heteroclinic in x 1 . The proof uses minimization arguments.

title: Local Inversion of Planar Maps with Nice Nondifferentiability Structure
abstract: Abstract When the plane is pie-sliced in n ‚â§ 4 parts (with nonempty interior and common vertex at the origin) our main result provides sufficient conditions for any map L, that is continuous and piecewise linear relatively to this slicing, to be invertible. This result cannot be plainly extended to a greater number of slices. Also, some examples show that the assumptions cannot be relaxed too much. Our result is proved by a combination of linear algebra and topological arguments.

title: A Note on the Complete Rotational Invariance of Biradial Solutions to Semilinear Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract We investigate symmetry properties of solutions to equations of the form -Œîu = + f(|x|, u) in ‚Ñù N for N ‚â• 4, with at most critical nonlinearities. By using geometric arguments, we prove that solutions with low Morse index (namely 0 or 1) and which are biradial (i.e. are invariant under the action of a toric group of rotations), are in fact completely radial. A similar result holds for the semilinear Laplace-Beltrami equations on the sphere. Furthermore, we show that the condition on the Morse index is sharp. Finally we apply the result in order to estimate best constants of Sobolev type inequalities with different symmetry constraints.

title: Supercritical Elliptic Equations
abstract: Abstract For an elliptic model equation with supercritical power non-linearity we give a complete description of radial solutions and discuss self-similar blow-up solutions.

title: A Unifying Maximum Principle For Conjugate Boundary Value Problems

title: On a semilinear Robin problem involving critical Sobolev exponent
authors: Daomin Cao; Ezzat S. Noussair; Shusen Yan
abstract: Abstract We establish the existence of solutions of the problem under various assumptions on the level sets of Q(x), where Œ© is a smooth bounded domain in ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 3, Q(x) 0, and a(x) are smooth functions. We also show that if a(x) ‚â• a 0 > 0 and a 0 is suiliciently large, our solutions are not ground states.

title: Nonexistence Theorems for Systems of Quasilinear Parabolic Inequalities
On the Quadratic Endomorphisms of the Plane
authors: F. Bofill; Jim√©nez Garrido; F. Vilamaj√≥; Neptal√≠ Romero; A. Rovella
abstract: Abstract In this article we establish the following result: if a nondegenerate quadratic endomorphism of the plane has no fixed points, then every point has empty omega-limit set and alpha-limit set. It is also shown that there exists a six parameter family open and dense in the space of all quadratic mappings of the plane (even those having fixed points). The degenerate case (when the quadratic forms of both components are linearly dependent), for which the theorem fails, is considered in the last section.

title: Uniqueness and Characterization of the Maximizers of Integral Functionals With Constraints
abstract: Abstract In this paper we maximize a class of functionals under certain constraints. We find necessary and sufficient conditions for these maximizers to exist and be unique. Moreover, we characterize them and discuss the optimality of our results by constructing counterexamples when one of the hypotheses does not hold.

title: A Note on Asymptotically Linear Schr√∂dinger Equation on ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract This paper is concerned with the following nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation: where f(x, t)t -1 < Œº* := inf œÉ(-Œî + V) < f(x, t)t -1 < V(‚àû) = V(x). The existence of a positive solution and a least energy solution for problem (P) are discussed. Here, we assume neither that f(x, t) ‚â° f(t), nor that f(x, t)t -1 is non-decreasing on t ‚â• 0. Furthermore, we do not require that f(x, t) have a limit as |x| ‚Üí +‚àû.

title: Topological Remarks‚ÄìCritical Points at Infinity and String Theory
abstract: Abstract We take the example of the standard geodesics problem on S 2 to show how the point to circle Morse relations in the periodic orbits variational problem for contact vector-fields lead directly to the existence of critical points at infinity. This is sharply in contrast with the phenomena encountered in symplectic geometry where the variational problems are not necessarily S 1 -invariant and where the Hamiltonians are usually bounded. The related tools defined in this area do not exhibit therefore all the phenomena encountered in S 1 -invariant settings. We then recall our definition of Contact Form Homology which includes these essential Morse relations and we define related tools for its computation.

title: Existence of Solution for a Class of Quasilinear Systems
authors: Claudianor O. Alves; S√©rgio H. Monari Soares
abstract: Abstract This paper proves the existence of nontrivial solution for a class of quasilinear systems on bounded domains in ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 2, whose nonlinearity has a double criticality. The proof is based on a linking theorem without the Palais-Smale condition.

title: New Results for Finite Morse Index Solutions on ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup> and applications
abstract: Abstract We prove new results for linearized stable and finite Morse index solutions on ‚Ñù N and give applications to half space and bounded domain problems.

title: Stable and Finite Morse Index Solutions for Dirichlet Problems with Small Diffusion in a Degenerate Case and Problems with Infinite Boundary Values
abstract: Abstract We consider weakly nonlinear elliptic equations with small diffusion in the case where the nonlinearity has a non-nodal zero. We show that there is an unexpected connection with problems with infinite boundary values.

title: L<sup>‚àû</sup>-Bounds for Solutions of Supercritical Elliptic Problems with Finite Morse Index
abstract: Abstract We study here finite Morse index solutions of -‚àÜu = f(u) on the entire space or half space and their application to smooth bounded domain problems when the growth of the non-linearity is faster than the usual Sobolev critical exponent.

title: On a Generalized Sturm Theorem
abstract: Abstract Sturm oscillation theorem for second order differential equations was generalized to systems and higher order equations with positive leading coefficient by several authors. What we propose here is a Sturm type oscillation theorem for indefinite systems with Dirichlet boundary conditions of the form where p i is a smooth path of matrices on the complex n-dimensional vector space ‚ÑÇ n , p 2m is the symmetry represented by the diagonal block matrix diag (I n-v, -I v ), and where v is an integer between 0 and n and I is the identity matrix.

title: Normal Geodesics Connecting two Non-necessarily Spacelike Submanifolds in a Stationary Spacetime
authors: Rossella Bartolo; Anna Mar√≠a Candela; Erasmo Caponio
abstract: Abstract In this paper we obtain an existence theorem for normal geodesics joining two given submanifolds in a globally hyperbolic stationary spacetime ‚Ñ≥. The proof is based on both variational and geometric arguments involving the causal structure of ‚Ñ≥, the completeness of suitable Finsler metrics associated to it and some basic properties of a submersion. By this interaction, unlike previous results on the topic, also non-spacelike submanifolds can be handled.

title: Sobolev-Gaffney type inequalities for differential forms on sub-Riemannian contact manifolds with bounded geometry
authors: Annalisa Baldi; Maria Carla Tesi; Francesca Tripaldi
abstract: In this paper we establish a Gaffney type inequality, in $W^{\ell,p}$-Sobolev spaces, for differential forms on sub-Riemannian contact manifolds without boundary, having bounded geometry (hence, in particular, we have in mind non-compact manifolds). Here $p\in]1,\infty[$ and $\ell=1,2$ depending on the order of the differential form we are considering. The proof relies on the structure of the Rumin's complex of differential forms in contact manifolds, on a Sobolev-Gaffney inequality proved by Baldi-Franchi in the setting of the Heisenberg groups and on some geometric properties that can be proved for sub-Riemannian contact manifolds with bounded geometry.

title: Concentrations for nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equations with magnetic potentials and constant electric potentials
abstract: Abstract This article studies point concentration phenomena of nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equations with magnetic potentials and constant electric potentials. The existing results show that a common magnetic field has no effect on the locations of point concentrations, as long as the electric potential is not a constant. This article finds out the role of the magnetic fields in the locations of point concentrations when the electric potential is a constant.

title: On a Noncompact Minimization Problem of Hardy-Sobolev Type
abstract: Abstract In this paper we discuss the existence and nonexistence of minimizer for the constraint minimization problem where r = |x‚Ä≤| for x = (x‚Ä≤, z) ‚àä ‚Ñù k √ó ‚Ñù n-k , 2 ‚â§ k ‚â§ n, 1 < p < n, 0 ‚â§ s < p, s < k and . We obtain conditions under which the above problem admits a minimizer.

title: On the Scalar Curvature Equations in high dimension
abstract: Abstract In order to study the scalar curvature problem on spheres S n of dimension n ‚â• 7, A. Bahri introduced, in [4], an invariant for Yamabe-type or scalar curvature flows. In this paper, we show that this invariant is not particularly related to Yamabe-type or scalar curvature flows, but it relies on a more general variational principle; and we give a simple proof of it‚Äôs existence for any variational flow. Through an example, we show how to use this invariant, in order to resolve scalar curvature equations on standard spheres S n of dimension n ‚â• 5.

title: On the Principal Eigenvalue of Disconjugate BVPs with L<sup>1</sup>-Coefficients
abstract: Abstract Establishing some general results on the principal eigenvalues for a class of multipoint boundary value problems, we prove existence and uniqueness theorems for positive solutions of nonlinear multipoint boundary value problems. Our argument is based mainly on the maximum principle [4] (highlighting new ordered Banach spaces of continuous functions) and on the continuity of the spectral radius mapping for compact linear operators.

title: On Uniqueness of Positive Solutions of Semilinear Elliptic Equations with Singular Potential
abstract: Abstract We prove the uniqueness of positive W 0 1,2 solutions for the following problem, which involves the singular potential |x| -2 : where N ‚â• 3, 1 < p < , and 0 < Œª < . We also give a complete description of the set of positive singular solutions of the problem.

title: Existence and Nonexistence of Positive Solutions of Indefinite Elliptic Problems in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract Our purpose is to find positive solutions u ‚àà D 1,2 (‚Ñù N ) of the semilinear elliptic problem -Œîu - ŒªV(x)u = h(x)u p-1 for 2 < p. The functions V and h may have an indefinite sign and the linearized operator need not have a fist (principal) eigenvalue, e.g. we allow V ‚â° 1. We give precise existence and nonexistence criteria, which depend on Œª and on the growth of h - and h + /V + . Existence theorems are obtained by constrained minimization. The mountain pass theorem leads to a second solution.

title: On the Prescribed Scalar and Zero Mean Curvature on 3-Dimensional Manifolds With Umbilic Boundary
abstract: Abstract In this paper we consider the existence and the compactness of Riemannian metrics of prescribed mean curvature and zero boundary mean curvature on a three dimensional manifold with umbilic boundary (M, g 0 ). We prove that for three dimensional manifolds with umbilic boundaries, which are not conformally equivalent to the three dimensional standard half sphere, any positive function can be realized as the scalar curvature of a Riemannian metric g conformal to g 0 with respect to which the boundary has zero mean curvature. Moreover, all such metrics stay bounded with respect to the C 2,Œ± -topology and in the nondegerate case Morse inequalities hold.

title: Persistence for a Class of Triangular Cross Diffusion Parabolic Systems
abstract: Abstract The purpose of this paper is to investigate the dynamics of a class of triangular parabolic systems given on bounded domains of arbitrary dimension. In particular, the existence of global attractors and the persistence property will be established.

title: Qualitative Properties of Solutions of m-Laplace Systems
abstract: Abstract We prove regularity results for the solutions of the equation -Œî m u = h(x), such as summability properties of the second derivatives and summability properties of . Analogous results were recently proved by the authors for the equation -Œî m u = f(u). These results allow us to extend to the case of systems of m-Laplace equations, some results recently proved by the authors for the case of a single equation. More precisely we consider the problem and we prove regularity properties of the solutions as well as qualitative properties of the solutions. Moreover we get a geometric characterization of the critical sets Z u ‚â° {x ‚àà Œ© | Du(x) = 0} and Zv ‚â° Dv(x) = 0. In particular we prove that in convex and symmetric domains we have Z u = {0} = Z v , assuming that 0 is the center of symmetry.

title: Multiple Symmetric Brake Orbits in Bounded Convex Symmetric Domains
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we prove that there exist at least two geometrically distinct symmetric brake orbits in every bounded convex symmetric domain in R n for n ‚â• 2.

title: Existence of Solutions for a Semilinear Elliptic Equation in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup> with Sign-changing Weight
abstract: Abstract We study the existence of solutions for the semilinear elliptic equation where 1 < p < , Q(x) is a sign-changing function such that both the supports of Q + and Q - may have infinite measure. We show that the problem has at least one solution.

title: Exponential Growth Rates of Periodic Asymmetric Oscillators
abstract: Abstract In this paper we will study the dynamics of the periodic asymmetric oscillator x ∫ + q + (t)x + + q ‚Äì (t)x ‚Äì = 0, where q + ; q ‚Äì ‚àä L 1 (‚Ñù / 2œÄ‚Ñ§) and x + = max(x; 0), x ‚Äì = min(x; 0) for x ‚àä ‚Ñù. It will be proved that the exponential growth rate does exist for each non-zero solution x(t) of the oscillator. The properties of these rates, or the Lyapunov exponents, will be given using the induced circle di¬Æeomorphism of the oscillator. The proof is extensively based on the Denjoy theorem in topological dynamics and the unique ergodicity theorem in ergodic theory.

title: Dynamics of a Contact Structure Along a Vector Field of its Kernel
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove that in order to define the homology of [3], the hypothesis that there exists a vector field in the kernel of the contact form which defines a dual form with the same orientation is not essential. The technique is quantitative: as we introduce a large amount of rotation near the zeroes of the vector field in the kernel, we track down the modification of the variational problem and provide bounds on a key quantity (denoted by œÑ).

title: Asymptotic Behavior of The Unique Solution to a Singular Elliptic Problem With Nonlinear Convection Term And Singular Weight
abstract: Abstract By Karamata regular variation theory, we first derived the exact asymptotic behavior of the local solution to the problem -œÜ π π(s) = g(œÜ(s)), œÜ(s) > 0, s ‚àà (0, a) and œÜ(0) = 0. Then, by a perturbation method and constructing comparison functions, we derived the exact asymptotic behavior of the unique classical solution near the boundary to a singular Dirichlet problem -Œîu = b(x)g(u) + Œª|‚ñΩu| q , u > 0, x ‚àà Œ©, u| aŒ© = 0, where Œ© is a bounded domain with smooth boundary, Œª ‚àà ‚Ñù, q ‚àà [0, 2]; g ‚àà C 1 ((0, ‚àû), (0, ‚àû)), is decreasing in (0, ‚àû) with lim s‚Üí0 + g(s) = +‚àû; the weight b is positive in Œ© and singular on the boundary.

title: Non-Radial Very Singular Similarity Solutions of Absorption-Diffusion Equations with Non-Homogeneous Potentials
abstract: Abstract The semilinear heat equation with absorption and a power-type potential, u t = Œîu - |x| Œ≤ |u| p-1 u in ‚Ñù N √ó ‚Ñù + , with p > 1, Œ≤ > -2, is considered. In the subcritical range , this problem is shown to admit a finite set of self-similar very singular solutions (VSSs), where f(y) has exponential decay at infinity and solves the semilinear elliptic equation . Some local bifurcation results are extended to the fourth-order equation u t = -Œî 2 u - |x| Œ≤ |u| p-1 u, with p > 1, Œ≤ > -4.

title: Radial Symmetry of Entire Solutions of a Biharmonic Equation with Supercritical Exponent
abstract: Abstract Necessary and sufficient conditions for a regular positive entire solution u of a biharmonic equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true"> </m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mtext>in </m:mtext> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo rspace="4.2pt">,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>5</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo rspace="4.2pt">,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>4</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>4</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> \Delta^{2}u=u^{p}\quad\text{in }\mathbb{R}^{N},\,N\geq 5,\,p>\frac{N+4}{N-4} to be a radially symmetric solution are obtained via the exact asymptotic behavior of u at <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:math> {\infty} and the moving plane method (MPM). We will see that the behavior similar to that of a radial entire solution of above equation at <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:math> {\infty} , in turn, determines the radial symmetry of a general positive entire solution <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {u(x)} of the equation. title: A Variational Approach for the Neumann Problem in Some FLRW Spacetimes
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study, using critical point theory for strongly indefinite functionals, the Neumann problem associated to some prescribed mean curvature problems in a FLRW spacetime with one spatial dimension. We assume that the warping function is even and positive and the prescribed mean curvature function is odd and sublinear. Then, we show that our problem has infinitely many solutions. The keypoint is that our problem has a Hamiltonian formulation. The main tool is an abstract result of Clark type for strongly indefinite functionals.

title: Fractional Powers of Monotone Operators in Hilbert Spaces
authors: Daniel Hauer; Yuhan He; Dehui Liu
abstract: Abstract The aim of this article is to provide a functional analytical framework for defining the fractional powers <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msup><m:mi>A</m:mi><m:mi>s</m:mi></m:msup></m:math> {A^{s}} for <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mn>1</m:mn></m:mrow><m:mo><</m:mo><m:mi>s</m:mi><m:mo><</m:mo><m:mn>1</m:mn></m:mrow></m:math> {-1<s<1} of maximal monotone (possibly multivalued and nonlinear) operators A in Hilbert spaces. We investigate the semigroup <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msub><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">{</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi>e</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:msup><m:mi>A</m:mi><m:mi>s</m:mi></m:msup><m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mo stretchy="false">}</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo>‚â•</m:mo><m:mn>0</m:mn></m:mrow></m:msub></m:math> {\{e^{-A^{s}t}\}_{t\geq 0}} generated by <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi>A</m:mi><m:mi>s</m:mi></m:msup></m:mrow></m:math> {-A^{s}} , prove comparison principles and interpolations properties of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msub><m:mrow><m:mo stretchy="false">{</m:mo><m:msup><m:mi>e</m:mi><m:mrow><m:mo>-</m:mo><m:mrow><m:msup><m:mi>A</m:mi><m:mi>s</m:mi></m:msup><m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo><m:mi>t</m:mi></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:msup><m:mo stretchy="false">}</m:mo></m:mrow><m:mrow><m:mi>t</m:mi><m:mo>‚â•</m:mo><m:mn>0</m:mn></m:mrow></m:msub></m:math> {\{e^{-A^{s}t}\}_{t\geq 0}} in Lebesgue and Orlicz spaces. We give sufficient conditions implying that <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:msup><m:mi>A</m:mi><m:mi>s</m:mi></m:msup></m:math> {A^{s}} has a sub-differential structure. These results extend earlier ones obtained in the case <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><m:mrow><m:mi>s</m:mi><m:mo>=</m:mo><m:mrow><m:mn>1</m:mn><m:mo>/</m:mo><m:mn>2</m:mn></m:mrow></m:mrow></m:math> {s=1/2} for maximal monotone operators [H.
