title: On an effective equation of the reduced Hartree-Fock theory
authors: Ilias Chenn; Svitlana Mayboroda; Wei Wang; Shiwen Zhang
abstract: Abstract We show that there is a one-to-one correspondence between solutions to the Poisson-landscape equations and the reduced Hartree-Fock equations in the semi-classical limit at low temperature. Moreover, we prove that the difference between the two corresponding solutions is small by providing explicit estimates.

title: Distributional Chaos of Cournot maps
authors: Jos√© Salvador C√°ovas Pe√±a; Gabriel Soler L√≥pez; Manuel Ruiz Mar√≠n
abstract: Abstract We study the notion of distributional chaos for a class of two-dimensional maps called Cournot maps, which models a competitive economic process (Cournot duopoly). Among other results, we prove that a Cournot map has positive topological entropy if and only if it is distributionally chaotic.

title: Asymptotic Estimates of the First Eigenvalue of the p-Laplacian
abstract: Abstract We consider a 1-parameter family of hyperbolic surfaces M(t) of genus ŒΩ which degenerate as t ‚Üí 0 and we obtain a precise estimate of Œª 1,p (t), the first eigenvalue of the p-Laplacian (p > 1) on M(t). In some cases we also give a precise estimate of the first eigenfunctions. As a direct application, we obtain that the quotient (which is invariant under scaling of the metric) is unbounded even on the set of Riemannian manifolds with constant sectional curvature. This is to our knowledge, the first example of a family of manifolds with this property. To prove our results we use in an essential way the geometry of hyperbolic surfaces which is very well known. We show that an eigenfunction for Œª 1,p (t) of L p norm one is almost constant in the L p sense (as t ‚Üí 0) on the parts of M(t) with large injectivity radius, and we estimate precisely its p-energy on the parts with small injectivity radius.

title: Multiple Positive Solutions For Nonautonomous Quasicritical Elliptic Problems in Unbounded Domains
abstract: Abstract The problem with boundary Dirichlet zero data is considered in an exterior domain Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N . Assuming that, as Œµ ‚Üí0, a Œµ concentrates and blows up at a point of Œ©, namely the existence of at least 2 distinct positive solutions is proved, if is suitably small. Furthermore, if a Œµ (x) has a suitable behaviour at infinity, the existence of another positive solution is shown.

title: Regularity of Entropy Solutions of Quasilinear Elliptic Problems Related to Hardy-Sobolev Inequalities
authors: Boumediene Abdellaoui; Eduardo Colorado; Manel Sanch√≥n
abstract: Abstract This article is concerned with the regularity of the entropy solution of where Œ© is a smooth bounded domain Œ© of ‚Ñù N such that 0 ‚àà Œ©, 1 < p < N. and Œ≥ < (N-p)/p. Assuming f ‚àà L q (Œ©, |x| Œ±(q-1) dx) for some q ‚â• 1 and N Œ≥p /(N-p) ‚â§ Œ± ‚â§ (Œ≥+1)p, we obtain estimates for the entropy solution u and its weak gradient in Lebesgue spaces with weights. Moreover, we introduce some explicit examples showing the optimality of our results and a relation between our problem and a Hardy-Sobolev type inequality.

title: Uniqueness and Exact Multiplicity of Solutions For Non-autonomous Dirichlet Problems
abstract: Abstract We consider positive solutions for a class of non-autonomous equations on a unit ball in R n Œîu + f(|x|, u) = 0 for |x| < 1, u= 0 when |x| = 1. We assume that f r (r, u) ‚â§ 0, so that in view of [8] all positive solutions are radially symmetric. If f(|x|, u) = a(|x|)g(u), we obtain several exact multiplicity results for a class of convex-concave g(u), with g(0) = 0. In another direction, we obtain uniqueness and non-degeneracy of positive solutions for a class of equations, modeled on f(|x|, u) = ‚àía(|x|)u + b(|x|)u p , with .

title: Study of the Singular Yamabe Problem in Some Bounded Domain of ‚Ñù<sup>n</sup>
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we extend the result of R. Mazzeo and F. Pacard in the following direction: Given Œ© any bounded open regular subset of ‚Ñù n , n ‚â• 3 and given x 1 , x 2 ‚àà Œ©, we give a sufficient condition on x 1 , x 2 , for the problem to have a positive weak solution in Œ© with 0 boundary data, which is singular at each x i .

title: Bifurcation Analysis at a Singular Soliton State in Fiber Couplers
abstract: Abstract The system describes pulses in nonlinear fiber couplers. It has the family (U 1+Œª , -U 1+Œª ), -1 < Œª < ‚àû, of soliton states (that is, homoclinic solutions to the origin), where For Œª ‚â• 1, the equilibrium (0, 0) is not hyperbolic and therefore the soliton state (U 1+Œª , ‚àíU 1+Œª ) can be qualified as ‚Äúsingular‚Äù. In N. Akhmediev and A. Ankiewicz [1], it is observed numerically that a branch of homoclinic solutions bifurcates subcritically at Œª = 1 from the family (U 1+Œª , ‚àíU 1+Œª ). The aim of the present paper is to give a rigorous proof of the existence of this bifurcation, as desired in A. Ambrosetti and D. Arcoya [3]. A particular feature of the present problem is that the linearized system at (U 2 , ‚àíU 2 ) has a non-constant bounded solution that does not vanish at infinity. Hence the bifurcating homoclinic solutions have a transient ‚Äúspatial‚Äù region where they are well described with the help of this bounded function. Moreover the decay to 0 is governed by two different scales, the larger one originating from the singular aspect of (U 2 , ‚àíU 2 ). The existence proof developed here relies on the ‚Äúbroken geodesic‚Äù technique to match the inside transient region with the outside region.

title: Solutions with Polynomial Growth to an Autonomous Nonlinear Elliptic Problem
abstract: Abstract We study the nonlinear elliptic problem -Œîu = F π (u) in ‚Ñù n where F(u) is a periodic function. Moser (1986) showed that for any minimal and nonself-intersecting solution, there exist Œ± ‚àà ‚Ñù n and C > 0 such that (*) |u - Œ± ¬∑ x| ‚â§ C. He also showed the existence of solutions with any prescribed Œ± ‚àà ‚Ñù n . In this note, we first prove that an solution satisfying (*) with nonzero vector Œ± must be one dimensional. Then we show that in ‚Ñù 2 , for any positive integer d ‚â• 1 there exists a solution with polynomial growth |x| d .

title: An Existence Theorem for Semi-linear Elliptic Systems
abstract: Abstract We study the following boundary value problem of semi-linear elliptic systems Œîu + f(x, u, ‚àáu) =0 in Œ©, u =0 on ‚àÇŒ© where Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù n (n ‚â• 2) is a connected and bounded smooth domain, and u and f are real vector-valued functions. Under appropriate conditions on the function f, we establish a general existence result for positive solutions. We continue our earlier works [15, 16, 17] and, in particular, remove a requirement of the cooperative structure on elliptic systems. As examples, we consider the stationary Klein-Gordon-Maxwell system and Maxwell- Schrodinger system, both lacking the cooperative structure..

title: Odd Homoclinic Orbits for a Second Order Hamiltonian System
authors: Liliane A. Maia; Olƒ±ÃÅmpio H. Miyagaki; S√©rgio H. Monari Soares
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper is to find an odd homoclinic orbit for a class of reversible Hamiltonian systems. The proof is variational and it employs a version of the concentration compactness principle of P. L. Lions in a lemma due to Struwe.

title: Stability and the Growth of the Number of Closed Characteristics on Compact Convex Hypersurfaces
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study relationship between the stability and the growth of the number of closed characteristics on compact convex hypersurfaces in ‚Ñù 2n , and also the stability of closed characteristics on compact convex hypersurfaces in ‚Ñù 2n under some pinching conditions.

title: Asymptotic Approach to Inverse Bifurcation for Nonlinear Sturm-Liouville Problems
abstract: Abstract We consider the nonlinear inverse bifurcation problem ‚àíu‚Ä≤‚Ä≤(t) + f (u(t)) = Œªu(t), u(t) > 0, t ‚àà I := (0, 1), u(0) = u(1) = 0, where Œª > 0 is a positive parameter, and the nonlinear term f (u) is unknown. We show that, if the asymptotic behavior of the L q -bifurcation curve Œª = Œª q (Œ±) (1 ‚â§ q < ‚àû) of the positive solutions is understood well, then we are able to obtain f (u) and to characterize the asymptotic behavior of f(u) as u ‚Üí ‚àû.

title: Functions on Tori with Minimal Number of Critical Points and Rotation Type Solutions of Spatially Periodic Hamiltonian Systems
abstract: Abstract In this paper we use functions on T n‚àí1 with n ‚â• 2 possessing minimal number of critical points given by Ljusternik-Schnirelman theory to construct spatially n-periodic Hamiltonian systems which possess precisely n distinct rotation type solutions with prescribed energy and rotation type vector.

title: On the Cheeger‚ÄìBuser Type Inequalities for the p-Laplacian
abstract: Abstract We study the relationship between the first eigenvalue of the p-Laplacian (p > 1) and Cheeger‚Äôs isoperimetric constant for families of compact manifolds and graphs with the Cheeger constant converging to zero.

title: Least Energy Solutions and Group Invariant Solutions of the H√©non Equation
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the generalized H√©non equation in the unit ball, where the coefficient function may or may not change its sign. We prove that the least energy solution is not radial and moreover we show the existence of a group invariant positive solution without radial symmetry.

title: Count and Symmetry of Global and Local Minimizers of the Cahn-Hilliard Energy Over Cylindrical Domains
authors: Arnaldo Simal do Nascimento; Jo√£o Biesdorf; Janete Crema
abstract: Abstract We address the problem of minimization of the Cahn-Hilliard energy functional under a mass constraint over two and three-dimensional cylindrical domains. Although existence is presented for a general case the focus is mainly on rectangles, parallelepipeds and circular cylinders. According to the symmetry of the domain the exact numbers of global and local minimizers are given as well as their geometric profile and interface locations; all are onedimensional increasing/decreasing and odd functions for domains with lateral symmetry in all axes and also for circular cylinders. The selection of global minimizers by the energy functional is made via the smallest interface area criterion. The approach utilizes Œì‚àíconvergence techniques to prove existence of an one-parameter family of local minimizers of the energy functional for any cylindrical domain. The exact numbers of global and local minimizers as well as their geometric profiles are accomplished via suitable applications of the unique continuation principle while exploring the domain geometry in each case and also the preservation of global minimizers through the process of Œì‚àíconvergence.

title: On the Persistence of Decay Properties for the b‚àíFamily of Equations
abstract: Abstract The b‚àífamily of equations governs evolution of shallow water waves with the horizontal velocities in different depths related to the parameter b. Using the method of characteristics, we obtain the results of the exponential decay properties of the strong solutions for the b‚àífamily of equations. In particular, we show that a non-trivial strong solution with compact initial value can not be compactly supported at any later time.

title: Almost Periodic Solutions of Monotone Second-Order Differential Equations
authors: Moez Ayachi; Jo√´l Blot; Philippe Cieutat
abstract: Abstract We give sufficient conditions for the existence of almost periodic solutions of the secondorder differential equation u‚Ä≤‚Ä≤(t) = f (u(t)) + e(t) on a Hilbert space H, where the vector field f : H ‚Üí H is monotone, continuous and the forcing term e : ‚Ñù ‚Üí H is almost periodic. Notably, we state a result of existence and uniqueness of the Besicovitch almost periodic solution, then we approximate this solution by a sequence of Bohr almost periodic solutions.

title: The Sturm-Liouville Hierarchy of Evolution Equations II
abstract: Abstract In a previous paper [15] we introduced the Sturm-Liouville (SL) hierarchy of evolution equations. This hierarchy includes the Korteveg-de Vries (K-dV) and the Camassa-Holm (CH) hierarchies. We also defined and discussed in detail the algebro-geometric solutions of the SL-hierarchy. In this paper, we broaden the class of algebro-geometric solutions in a substantial way. Namely, we define and discuss solutions of the SL-hierarchy lying in an isospectral class of the Sturm-Liouville problem ‚àí(pœÜ‚Ä≤)‚Ä≤ + qœÜ = ŒªyœÜ, which is determined by data related to a Riemann surface of ‚Äúinfinite genus‚Äù.

title: Existence of Multiple Positive Solutions for N-Laplacian in a Bounded Domain in ‚Ñù<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract Let Œ© be a bounded domain in ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 2, Œª > 0, q‚àä(0, N ‚àí1) and In this article we show the existence of at least two positive solutions for the following quasilinear elliptic problem with an exponential type nonlinearity: We use Monotonicity and Variational methods to obtain this multiplicity result.

title: Homoclinic Solutions for a Class of Hamiltonian Systems
abstract: Abstract We consider the first order Hamiltonian system qÃá = Hp(p, q), ·πó = ‚àíHq(p, q), (HS) where p, q : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 3), H ‚àà C 1 (‚Ñù N √ó ‚Ñù N \ {e}, ‚Ñù ) and behaves roughly like Under the condition that V has a unique absolute maximum at 0 and some technical assumptions on H, we prove that (HS) has a non-trivial homoclinic solution.

title: Periodic Solutions of Symmetric Elliptic Singular Systems
abstract: Abstract We show the existence of periodic solutions of certain singularly perturbed systems having symmetry properties. Our results apply to some singular systems arising in the study of Hamiltonian systems with a strong restoring force.

title: The Wente Problem Associated to the Modified Helmholtz Operator on Weighted Sobolev Spaces
authors: Ines Ben Omrane; Mohamed Jleli; Bessem Samet
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we give a weighted version of regularity of solutions of the Wente problem associated to the modified Helmholtz operator -Œî + Œ±I, where Œ± is a positive constant.

title: On a Q‚ÄìCurvature Equation on Complete Riemannian Manifolds
abstract: Abstract We proceed by variational method to prove the existence of solution of a fourth order partial differential equation on complete non compact manifolds. Sufficient conditions, including the geometry of the manifold, are given to make a minimizing sequence converge to a non trivial solution belonging to C loc 4,Œ± (M) for some Œ± ‚àà (0, 1).

title: On Multiplicity of Positive Solutions for Quasilinear Equation with Co-normal Boundary Condition
authors: Sumit Kaur Bhatia; K. Sreenadh; R. Dhanya
abstract: Abstract Let Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N , N ‚â• 3, be a bounded domain with C 2 boundary, , the critical exponent for the Sobolev imbedding. In this work, we are interested in the following problem: where Œª > 0, 0 ‚â§ q < p - 1. We show that there exists 0 < Œõ < ‚àû such that for suitable ranges of p and q, (P Œª ) admits at least two solutions in W 1,p (Œ©) if Œª ‚àà (0, Œõ) and no solution if Œª > Œõ. The proof of these assertions is done by first finding the local minimum for the variational functional associated to (P Œª ) and then applying mountain pass arguments to obtain a saddle point type solution. In the critical case we are considering, there are technical reasons which make the mountain pass argument work for only certain ranges of p and q.

title: Existence of 2‚ÄìNodal Solutions for Semilinear Elliptic Equations in Unbounded Domains
authors: Tiexiang Li; Huei-Li Lin; Tsung‚Äêfang Wu
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the effect of domain shape on the existence of 2-nodal solutions for a semilinear elliptic equation involving non-odd nonlinearities.

title: Solutions for the Problems Involving Fractional Laplacian and Indefinite Potentials
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider a class of Schr√∂dinger equations involving fractional Laplacian and indefinite potentials. By modifying the definition of the Nehari‚ÄìPankov manifold, we prove the existence and asymptotic behavior of least energy solutions. As the fractional Laplacian is nonlocal, when the bottom of the potentials contains more than one isolated components, the least energy solutions may localize near all the isolated components simultaneously. This phenomenon is different from the Laplacian.

title: Symmetric and Asymmetric Solutions of p-Laplace Elliptic Equations in Hollow Domains
abstract: Abstract In the present paper, we study the p -Laplace equation in a hollow symmetric bounded domain. Let H and G be closed subgroups of the orthogonal group such that <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>H</m:mi> <m:mo>‚ää</m:mo> <m:mi>G</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> {H\varsubsetneq G} . Then we prove the existence of a positive solution which is H -invariant and G -non-invariant. Furthermore, we give several examples of H , G and Œ©, and find symmetric and asymmetric solutions.

title: Near Field Asymptotic Behavior for the Porous Medium Equation on the Half-Line
authors: Carmen Cort√°zar; Fernando Quir√≥s; Noem√≠ Wolanski
abstract: Abstract Kamin and V√°zquez [11] proved in 1991 that solutions to the Cauchy‚ÄìDirichlet problem for the porous medium equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>t</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${u_{t}=(u^{m})_{xx}}$ , <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>m</m:mi> <m:mo>></m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${m>1}$ , on the half-line with zero boundary data and nonnegative compactly supported integrable initial data behave for large times as a dipole-type solution to the equation having the same first moment as the initial data, with an error which is <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>o</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${o(t^{-1/m})}$ . However, on sets of the form <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>0</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>g</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${0<x<g(t)}$ , with <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>g</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>o</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${g(t)=o(t^{1/(2m)})}$ as <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Üí</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚àû</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${t\to\infty}$ , in the so-called near field, a scale which includes the particular case of compact sets, the dipole solution is <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>o</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${o(t^{-1/m})}$ , and their result gives neither the right rate of decay of the solution nor a nontrivial asymptotic profile. In this paper, we will improve the estimate for the error, showing that it is <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>o</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>t</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>m</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${o(t^{-(2m+1)/(2m^{2})}(1+x)^{1/m})}$ . This allows in particular to obtain a nontrivial asymptotic profile in the near field limit, which is a multiple of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${x^{1/m}}$ , thus improving in this scale the results of Kamin and V√°zquez.

title: A Refined Approach for Non-Negative Entire Solutions of Œî u + u<sup>p</sup> = 0 with Subcritical Sobolev Growth
abstract: Abstract Let <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â•</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {N\geq 2} and <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>p</m:mi> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>N</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> </m:msub> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> {1<p<(N+2)/(N-2)_{+}} . Consider the Lane‚ÄìEmden equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mi>p</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\Delta u+u^{p}=0} in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> </m:math> {\mathbb{R}^{N}} and recall the classical Liouville type theorem: if u is a non-negative classical solution of the Lane‚ÄìEmden equation, then <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â°</m:mo> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> {u\equiv 0} . The method of moving planes combined with the Kelvin transform provides an elegant proof of this theorem. A classical approach of Serrin and Zou, originally used for the Lane‚ÄìEmden system, yields another proof but only in lower dimensions. Motivated by this, we further refine this approach to find an alternative proof of the Liouville type theorem in all dimensions.

title: Microglobal Analysis
abstract: Abstract We study some Phragm√©n-Lindel√∂f type results, which were considered as extensions of maximal modulus theorem. We shall consider them from the viewpoint of Fourier analysis. Our analysis shows that the Phragm√©n-Lindel√∂f theorems can be regarded as the convexity of microglobal wave front sets. We prove such theorems for elliptic systems of equations with constant coefficients.

title: A Note on Bifurcation from the Essential Spectrum
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a semilinear elliptic equation in all ‚Ñù N . This equation depends on a parameter Œª, and we obtain, for small Œª < 0, solutins which are small in H 1 (‚Ñù N ). In this sense we have solutions bifurcating from the origin and, as the differential operator involved is the laplacian, we say that we have solutions bifurcating from the bottom of the essential spectrum of the laplacian. By a change of variables we transform the original bifurcation problem into a perturbation one. We adopt a variational procedure, looking for critical points of a suitable functional. We apply a recently developped reduction method, which allows to reduce the original variational problem in H 1 (‚Ñù N ) to a variational problem in a finite-dimensional manifold, and then we solve this last problem. In this way we are also able to manage the presence of critical nonlinearities, in the sense of Sobolev embedding.

title: A Priori Estimates for Solutions of "Sub-critical" Equations on CR Sphere
abstract: Abstract Here we study the precise blow-up behaviour and obtain a priori estimates for the finite energy C 2 -solutions of the equation on the odd dimensional spheres S 2n+1 with standard CR structure, as the exponent for p ‚àà , Q = 2n + 2 is the homogeneous dimension.

title: Non-Degeneracy of Peak Solutions to the Schr√∂dinger‚ÄìNewton System
abstract: Abstract We are concerned with the following Schr√∂dinger‚ÄìNewton problem: <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>V</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mfrac> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mrow> <m:mn>8</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>œÄ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>Œµ</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msub> <m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚à´</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mpadded width="+1.7pt"> <m:mfrac> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mi>Œæ</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>-</m:mo> <m:mi>Œæ</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mfrac> </m:mpadded> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo>ùëë</m:mo> <m:mi>Œæ</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo maxsize="260%" minsize="260%">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo rspace="12.5pt">,</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>x</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>‚Ñù</m:mi> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>.</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> -\varepsilon^{2}\Delta u+V(x)u=\frac{1}{8\pi\varepsilon^{2}}\Bigg{(}\int_{% \mathbb{R}^{3}}\frac{u^{2}(\xi)}{|x-\xi|}\,d\xi\Bigg{)}u,\quad x\in\mathbb{R}^% {3}. For Œµ small enough, we prove the non-degeneracy of the positive solution to the above problem, that is, the corresponding linear operator <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> title: The Moving Plane Method for Doubly Singular Elliptic Equations Involving a First-Order Term
abstract: Abstract In this paper we deal with positive singular solutions to semilinear elliptic problems involving a first-order term and a singular nonlinearity. Exploiting a fine adaptation of the well-known moving plane method of Alexandrov‚ÄìSerrin and a careful choice of the cutoff functions, we deduce symmetry and monotonicity properties of the solutions.

title: Positive Solutions of a System Arising from Angiogenesis
abstract: Abstract We study a system of equations arising from angiogenesis which contains a non- regular term that vanishes below a certain threshold. We are forced to modify the usual methods of bifurcation theory because of this loss of regularity. Nevertheless, we obtain results on the existence, uniqueness and permanence of a positive solution for the time-dependent problem; and the existence and uniqueness of a positive solution for the stationary one.

title: Existence of Nonnegative Solutions For a Class of p-Laplacian Equations in IR<sup>N</sup>
abstract: Abstract We consider the question of existence of nonnegative solutions of a class of p-Laplacian elliptic problems in the whole space ‚Ñù N having a sign-changing nonlinearity of the form a(x)g(u).

title: On the Morse Index of a Functional Arising in Contact Form Geometry
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a functional at infinity associated to a contact form on a three dimensional manifold. The Morse index of this functional at infinity can be decomposed into two parts, one along the characteristic manifold and the other along the normal directions. We prove that we can redistribute the negative directions between the two subspaces through a local deformation of the contact form near a critical point at infinity.

title: Morse Indices of Closed Geodesics on Katok's 2-Spheres
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we compute precisely Morse indices of iterates of the two closed geodesics on the 2-sphere with Katok‚Äôs metric. This information is used to give a direct proof for the Poincar√© series of the free loop space on S 2 .

title: The Multidimensional Bipolar Quantum Drift-diffusion Model
abstract: Abstract We investigate the bipolar quantum drift-diffusion model, a fourth order parabolic system, in two or there space dimensions. First, we establish the global weak solution with large initial value and periodic boundary conditions. Then we show the semiclassical limit by using new methods based on delicate interpolation estimates and compactness argument. Furthermore, when the doping profile is a constant, we find that the weak solution approaches its mean value exponentially as time increases to infinity.

title: Periodic Bounce Solutions of Hamiltonian Systems in Bounded Domains
abstract: Abstract Periodic bounce solutions of the second order Hamiltonian system ‚àíx‚Ä≥ = ‚àáV (x, t), x(t) ‚àà Œ©ÃÖ is studied, where Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N is a bounded domain diffeomorphic to the unit ball and V ‚àà C 2 (Œ©ÃÖ √ó ‚Ñù) is periodic in the time t.

title: Weak Solutions of the Problem ‚àÜ<sup>2</sup>u = u<sup>n/n-4</sup> with Prescribed Singular Sets
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we are interested in the following biharmonic equation: with Navier boundary conditions on ‚àÇŒ©; where Œ© is an open bounded domain of ‚Ñù n , with n ‚â• 5, having a smooth boundary, and ‚àë ‚äÇ Œ© is either a set of finite number of points of Œ© or a smooth closed submanifold of Œ© without boundary. We construct positive solutions to this problem which are singular at ‚àë.

title: On the Solvability of Some Nonlinear Neumann Problems
authors: Anna Maria Piccirillo; Luisa Toscano; Speranza Toscano
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the existence of solutions of some nonlinear Neumann problems and the main tool used is the fibering method.

title: On the Solvability of Some Nonlinear Systems of Elliptic Equations
authors: Anna Maria Piccirillo; Luisa Toscano; Speranza Toscano
abstract: Abstract We study the solvability and the existence of multiple solutions of nonlinear systems of elliptic equations.

title: Preface for the special issue in honor of Joel Spruck
Non-homogeneous fully nonlinear contracting flows of convex hypersurfaces
authors: Pengfei Guan; Jiuzhou Huang; Jiawei Liu
abstract: Abstract We consider a general class of non-homogeneous contracting flows of convex hypersurfaces in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi>n</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{n+1}$ , and prove the existence and regularity of the flow before extincting to a point in finite time.

title: Comparison formulas for total mean curvatures of Riemannian hypersurfaces
abstract: Abstract We devise some differential forms after Chern to compute a family of formulas for comparing total mean curvatures of nested hypersurfaces in Riemannian manifolds. This yields a quicker proof of a recent result of the author with Joel Spruck, which had been obtained via Reilly‚Äôs identities.

title: Liouville theorems of solutions to mixed order H√©non-Hardy type system with exponential nonlinearity
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we are concerned with the H√©non-Hardy type systems with exponential nonlinearity on a half space <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" title: Sharp affine weighted L 2 Sobolev inequalities on the upper half space
authors: Jingbo Dou; Yunyun Hu; Caihui Yue
abstract: Abstract We establish some sharp affine weighted L 2 Sobolev inequalities on the upper half space, which involves a divergent operator with degeneracy on the boundary. Moreover, for some certain exponents cases, we also characterize the extremal functions and best constants. Our approach only relies on the L 2 structure of gradient norm, affine invariance and a class of weighted L 2 Sobolev inequality on the upper half space. This is a simple approach which does not depend on the geometric structure of Euclidean space such as Brunn‚ÄìMinkowski theory on convex geometry.

title: Frontmatter
New multiplicity results in prescribing Q-curvature on standard spheres
authors: Mohamed Ben Ayed; Khalil El Mehdi
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we study the problem of prescribing Q -Curvature on higher dimensional standard spheres. The problem consists in finding the right assumptions on a function K so that it is the Q -Curvature of a metric conformal to the standard one on the sphere. Using some pinching condition, we track the change in topology that occurs when crossing a critical level (or a virtually critical level if it is a critical point at infinity) and then compute a certain Euler-Poincar√© index which allows us to prove the existence of many solutions. The locations of the levels sets of these solutions are determined in a very precise manner. These type of multiplicity results are new and are proved without any assumption of symmetry or periodicity on the function K .

title: Long-time asymptotic behavior for the Hermitian symmetric space derivative nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation
authors: Mingming Chen; Xianguo Geng; Huan Liu
abstract: Abstract Resorting to the spectral analysis of the 4 √ó 4 matrix spectral problem, we construct a 4 √ó 4 matrix Riemann‚ÄìHilbert problem to solve the initial value problem for the Hermitian symmetric space derivative nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation. The nonlinear steepest decent method is extended to study the 4 √ó 4 matrix Riemann‚ÄìHilbert problem, from which the various Deift‚ÄìZhou contour deformations and the motivation behind them are given. Through some proper transformations between the corresponding Riemann‚ÄìHilbert problems, the basic Riemann‚ÄìHilbert problem is reduced to a model Riemann‚ÄìHilbert problem, by which the long-time asymptotic behavior to the solution of the initial value problem for the Hermitian symmetric space derivative nonlinear Schr√∂dinger equation is obtained with the help of the asymptotic expansion of the parabolic cylinder function and strict error estimates.

title: Solitons to the Willmore flow
abstract: Abstract The Willmore flow is the negative gradient flow of the Willmore energy. In this paper, we consider a special kind of solutions to Willmore flow, which we call solitons, and investigate their geometric properties.

Moreover, we obtain some properties of these solutions, such as convergence and decay estimate.

title: Frontmatter
Infinitely Many Solutions for Derrick‚Äôs Equation
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study a class of field equations, in several space dimensions, which admits solitary waves. The equation is a vector-valued version of a field equation proposed by Derrick in 1964 as model for elementary particles. We show the existence of infinitely many solutions with arbitrary topological charge.

title: Equations of p-Laplacian Type in Unbounded Domains
authors: Pablo L. De N√°poli; Maria C. Mariani
abstract: Abstract This work is devoted to study the existence of solutions to equations of the p Laplacian type in unbounded domains. We prove the existence of at least one solution, and under further assumptions, the existence of infinitely many solutions. We apply the mountain pass theorem in weighted Sobolev spaces.

title: On the Existence of Nontrivial Solutions to Some Elliptic Variational Inequalities
abstract: Abstract The paper is concerned with the existence of nontrivial solutions of the obstacle problem: where K = {œÖ ‚àà H 1 0 (Œ©) : œÖ ‚â§ œà a.e. on Œ©}. By using a generalized mountain pass theorem for inequalities, we prove, subject to some restrictions on the obstacle œà, the existence of nontrivial solutions of the above inequality.

title: On uniqueness for ODEs Arising in Blow-up Asymptotics for Nonlinear Heat Equations
authors: Manuela Yuste Chaves; Victor A. Galaktionov
abstract: Abstract We study uniqueness for nonlinear ordinary differential equations arising in constructing blow-up and extinction self-similar solutions of various reaction-diffusion- absorption equations. Such particular similarity solutions describe the asymptotic singular behaviour of wide classes of general solutions of nonlinear heat equations. We prove that under some monotonicity assumptions, such similarity profiles are unique.

title: On the Least Action Principle ‚Äì Hamiltonian Dynamics on Fixed Energy Levels in the Non-convex Case
authors: Roberto Giamb√≤; Fabio Giannoni; Paolo Piccione
abstract: Abstract We review the classical Principle of the Least Action in a general context where the Hamilton functionH is possibly non-convex. We show how the van Groesen [6] principle follows as a particular case where H is hyperregular and of homogeneous type. Homogeneous scalar field spacetimes in spherical symmetry are derived as an application.

title: The Radial Solutions of Monge-Amp√®re Equations and the Semi-geostrophic System
abstract: Abstract We first obtain an (optimal) regularity condition for entire radial solutions of Monge- Amp√®re equations and then study the existence of radial solutions of the Semi-geostrophic system which is coupled by a Monge-Amp√®re and a transport equation.

title: Infinitely Many Solutions of Elliptic Problems With Perturbed Symmetries in Symmetric Domains
abstract: Abstract We study superlinear elliptic boundary value problems with perturbed symmetries in domains which are invariant under the action of a group G. We give conditions on the growth of the nonlinearity which guarantee the existence of infinitely many G-invariant solutions. These conditions improve those obtained by Bahri and Lions (1988) and Bolle, Ghoussoub and Tehrani (2000) if the domain contains a G-orbit of large enough dimension.

title: A Denoised Version of Some Kinds of Set Convergence
abstract: Abstract The aim of this paper consists of introducing on a locally compact and œÉ-compact metric space a notion of set convergence, which generalizes the Hausdorff convergence, the local Hausdorff convergence and the Kuratowski convergence. We analyze the connections beetwen the three new notions: and. in particular, we prove a compactness result. As a first application of this convergence we give, on a sequence of sets, a condition which assures the lower semicontinuity of the Hausdorff measure with respect to this new convergence and we show that this condition is satisfied by any minimizing sequence of Mumford-Shah functional.

title: Blow-up Results for Parabolic Inequalities with Chipot‚ÄìWeissler Nonlinearity in the Gradient Term
authors: Anna Maria Piccirillo; Luisa Toscano; Speranza Toscano
abstract: Abstract We obtain blow-up results for a wide class of nonlinear parabolic problems with nonlinearity of the Chipot-Weissler type in the gradient term. Some of these answer an open question concerning the nonexistence of positive solutions to the problem where Œª > 0 is small, u 0 ‚àà L loc (‚Ñù N ) with u 0 ‚â• 0, when . For this purpose we use the method of ‚Äútest function‚Äù.

title: Precise Asymptotic Properties of Solutions to Two-Parameter Elliptic Eigenvalue Problems in a Ball
abstract: Abstract We consider the simple pendulum type equation with two-parameters Œº, Œª > 0 in a ball B R . For a given Œº > 0, a solution triple (Œº, Œª(Œº), u Œº ) ‚àà R + 2 √ó C 2 (BÃÖ R ) is obtained by a variational method, and u Œº develops a boundary layer as Œº ‚Üí ‚àû. We establish the two-term asymptotic formulas for ‚à•u Œº ‚à• ‚àû , u‚Ä≤ Œº (R) 2 and the variational eigencurve Œª(Œº) as Œº ‚Üí ‚àû. It is shown that the coefficients of the second terms of ‚à•u Œº ‚à• ‚àû , u‚Ä≤ Œº (R) 2 and Œª(Œº) depend on 1/R, the mean curvature of ‚àÇB R . Since the second term of the maximum norm of the solution for the corresponding one parameter problems does not depend on the mean curvature of ‚àÇB R , the results obtained here seem to be new.

title: Periodic Solutions of Symmetric Elliptic Singular Systems: the Higher Codimension Case
abstract: Abstract We show the existence of periodic solutions of certain singularly perturbed systems having symmetry properties. Our result applies to some singular systems arising in the study of Hamiltonian systems with a strong restoring force and extends to a higher codimension the result obtained in our previous paper [4].

title: Remarks on Nonlinear Elliptic Problems on Long Domains
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we discuss the behaviour of solutions near a turning point for weakly nonlinear elliptic equations on long domains. We are looking for results independent of the domain length. In the process we obtain some local uniqueness and non-degeneracy results for homoclinic solutions on infinite strips.

title: Large Time Behavior of Solutions to the Nonlinear Heat Equation with Absorption with Highly Singular Antisymmetric Initial Values
authors: Hattab Mouajria; Slim Tayachi; Fred B. Weissler

title: Preface for the Special Issue Honoring Laurent V√©ron
abstract: Laurent V√©ron was born on February 26th 1949 at Brazzaville, Congo.At that time, Congo was one of the four territories of the French Equatorial Africa, together with Gabon, Tchad and Oubangui-Chari, presently the Center African Republic.His father came to Brazzaville as a Mission Manager in Charge of the Finances for the General Governor of the French Equatorial Africa.Laurent came to France by the first time when he was two years old.Once back in France his father, who was Finances Inspector, occupied several administrative positions closely related to his qualification.In 1954 he took part of the government of Pierre Mend√®s France as Director of Cabinet of several Ministries.After the fall of Mend√®s France, he reintegrated the high administration as General Inspector of Finances, and never had any other political involvement.His family tradition was center-left, in French, radical-socialist, a party which is neither radical nor socialist but has strong roots in the South-West of France.In particular, during the Second World War, since the father of Laurent was taken prisoner in Germany, his grand-father and mother established an escaping road from France to Spain for saving the Jewish people hunted by the Nazis.In recognition, they both received the medal of Righteous among the Nations for their action.Laurent completed his High School studies at the Lyc√©es Pasteur (Neuilly sur Seine) and Louis le Grand (Paris).These studies, shared between sciences and humanities, explain the exceptional humanistic background of Laurent.Laurent was very much tempted to become historian or archeologist as well as astronomer or mathematician.His existential circumstances pushed him finally to become Mathematician.That he took the right decision

title: A sharp global estimate and an overdetermined problem for Monge-Amp√®re type equations
abstract: Abstract We consider Monge-Amp√®re type equations involving the gradient that are elliptic in the framework of convex functions. Through suitable symmetrization we find sharp estimates to solutions of such equations. An overdetermined problem related to our Monge-Amp√®re type operators is also considered and we show that such a problem may admit a solution only when the underlying domain is a ball.

title: Uniform stabilization for a strongly coupled semilinear/linear system
authors: Marcelo M. Cavalcanti; V. N. Domingos Cavalcanti; Dilberto da Silva Almeida J√∫nior; Victor H. Gonzalez Martinez; Mauro de Lima Santos
abstract: Abstract In this manuscript, we analyze the exponential stability of a strongly coupled semilinear system of Klein-Gordon type, posed in an inhomogeneous medium <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:math> \Omega , subject to local dampings of different natures distributed around a neighborhood of the boundary according to the geometric control condition (GCC). The first one is of the type viscoelastic and is distributed around a neighborhood <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi>œâ</m:mi> </m:math> \omega of the boundary <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mo>‚àÇ</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:math> \partial \Omega of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:math> \Omega , according to the GCC. The second one is a frictional damping and we consider it hurting the GCC. The third dissipation, which acts only in the second equation (according to the GCC), is of the frictional type. We show that the energy of the system goes uniformly and exponentially to zero for all initial data of finite energy taken in bounded sets of finite energy phase space. We also prove the exponential decay for the linear problem associated with this same system, and in this case, no restrictions are made with respect to dimension of the space nor with respect to the limitation of the initial data in the phase space.

authors: Qiang Guang; Qi-Rui Li; Xu‚ÄêJia Wang
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider a class of functionals subject to a duality restriction. The functional is of the form <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi mathvariant="script">J</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>*</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚à´</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mrow> <m:mo>‚à´</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mo>*</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:mrow> </m:msub> <m:mi>g</m:mi> </m:math> $\mathcal{J}\left({\Omega},{{\Omega}}^{{\ast}}\right)={\int }_{{\Omega}}f+{\int }_{{{\Omega}}^{{\ast}}}g$ , where f , g are given nonnegative functions in a manifold. The duality is a relation Œ± ( x , y ) ‚â§ 0 ‚àÄ x ‚àà Œ©, y ‚àà Œ©*, for a suitable function Œ± . This model covers several geometric and physical applications. In this paper we review two topological methods introduced in the study of the functional, and discuss possible extensions of the methods to related problems.

title: Geometry of branched minimal surfaces of finite index
abstract: Abstract Given <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mi>I</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>B</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">N</m:mi> <m:mo>‚à™</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">{</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>0</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">}</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> $I,B\in \mathbb{N}\cup \left\{0\right\}$ , we investigate the existence and geometry of complete finitely branched minimal surfaces M in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{3}$ with Morse index at most I and total branching order at most B . Previous works of Fischer-Colbrie (‚ÄúOn complete minimal surfaces with finite Morse index in 3-manifolds,‚Äù Invent. Math. , vol. 82, pp. 121‚Äì132, 1985) and Ros (‚ÄúOne-sided complete stable minimal surfaces,‚Äù J. Differ. Geom. , vol. 74, pp. 69‚Äì92, 2006) explain that such surfaces are precisely the complete minimal surfaces in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{3}$ of finite total curvature and finite total branching order. Among other things, we derive scale-invariant weak chord-arc type results for such an M with estimates that are given in terms of I and B . In order to obtain some of our main results for these special surfaces, we obtain general intrinsic monotonicity of area formulas for m -dimensional submanifolds Œ£ of an n -dimensional Riemannian manifold X , where these area estimates depend on the geometry of X and upper bounds on the lengths of the mean curvature vectors of Œ£. We also describe a family of complete, finitely branched minimal surfaces in <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="double-struck">R</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:msup> </m:math> ${\mathbb{R}}^{3}$ that are stable and non-orientable; these examples generalize the classical Henneberg minimal surface.

title: A C 2,Œ±,Œ≤ estimate for complex Monge‚ÄìAmp√®re type equations with conic sigularities
authors: Liding Huang; Gang Tian; Jiaxiang Wang
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we give an alternative approach to the C 2, Œ± , Œ≤ estimate for complex Monge-Amp√®re equations with cone singularities along simple normal crossing divisors.

title: An upper bound for the least energy of a sign-changing solution to a zero mass problem
authors: M√≥nica Clapp; Liliane A. Maia; Benedetta Pellacci
abstract: Abstract We give an upper bound for the least possible energy of a sign-changing solution to the nonlinear scalar field equation <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" overflow="scroll"> <m:mo>‚àí</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œî</m:mi> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mi>f</m:mi> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mspace width="0.17em" /> <m:mi>u</m:mi> <m:mo>‚àà</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>D</m:mi> <m:mn>1,2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo>(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">R</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msup> <m:mo>)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mo>,</m:mo> </m:math> $-{\Delta}u=f\left(u\right), u\in {D}^{1,2}\left({\mathrm{R}}^{N}\right),$ where N ‚â• 5 and the nonlinearity f is subcritical at infinity and supercritical near the origin. More precisely, we establish the existence of a nonradial sign-changing solution whose energy is smaller that 12 c 0 if N = 5, 6 and smaller than 10 c 0 if N ‚â• 7, where c 0 is the ground state energy.

title: Michael-Simon type inequalities in hyperbolic space H n + 1 ${\mathbb{H}}^{n+1}$ via Brendle-Guan-Li‚Äôs flows

Regularity of Interfaces for an Inhomogeneous Filtration Equation
authors: M. Guedda; Danielle Hilhorst; Sergey Shmarev
abstract: Abstract We study the regularity of the interfaces for solutions of the degenerate parabolic equation p(x)u t =(u m ) xx, m > 1. AS opposed to the classical Porous Medium Equation, the interfaces in this equation may propagate with infinite speed and disappear within a finite time. We establish conditions on the initial function u(x, 0) and the function p(x) sufficient to provide the local C 1 -regularity of the interfaces until the moment of their disappearance. The interface equation (Darcy's law) is derived.

title: Closed Geodesics on Positively Curved Finsler 3-Spheres
abstract: Abstract In [33], Wang proved that for every Finsler three-dimensional sphere <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msup> <m:mi>S</m:mi> <m:mn>3</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi>F</m:mi> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${(S^{3},F)}$ with reversibility Œª and flag curvature K satisfying <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:msup> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> <m:mo>/</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mi>Œª</m:mi> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> <m:mn>2</m:mn> </m:msup> <m:mo><</m:mo> <m:mi>K</m:mi> <m:mo>‚â§</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${(\lambda/({1+\lambda}))^{2}<K\leq 1}$ , there exist at least three distinct closed geodesics. title: Symmetry of Entire Solutions to the Allen-Cahn Equation
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we shall prove even symmetry of monotone entire solutions to the balanced Allen-Cahn equation with one spatial variable. Related results for the unbalanced Allen- Cahn equation are also discussed.

title: On Von K√°rm√°n Equations and the Buckling of a Thin Circular Elastic Plate
abstract: Abstract We shall be concerned with the buckling of a thin circular elastic plate simply supported along a boundary, subjected to a radial compressive load uniformly distributed along its boundary. One of the main engineering concerns is to reduce deformations of plate structures. It is well known that von K√°rm√°n equations provide an established model that describes nonlinear deformations of elastic plates. Our approach to study plate deformations is based on bifurcation theory. We will find critical values of the compressive load parameter by reducing von K√°rm√°n equations to an operator equation in H√∂lder spaces with a nonlinear Fredholm map of index zero. We will prove a sufficient condition for bifurcation by the use of a gradient version of the Crandall-Rabinowitz theorem due to A.Yu. Borisovich and basic notions of representation theory. Moreover, applying the key function method by Yu.I. Sapronov we will investigate the shape of bifurcation branches.

title: Complete Orbits for Twist Maps with Exponential Generating Functions
authors: Qihuai Liu; Yishuang Guo; Hong‚ÄêWu Tang
abstract: Abstract In this paper twist symplectic maps with non-periodicity are considered, where the associated generating functions grow exponentially. Under appropriate assumptions the existence of infinitely many bounded complete orbits is established. An application to Toda-like type lattices may help us to explain our results.

title: Positive Solutions for BVPs with One-dimensional Mean Curvature Operator
abstract: Abstract We discuss the existence and properties of solutions for systems of Dirichlet problems involving one dimensional mean curvature operator. Our approach is based on variational methods and covers both sublinear and superlinear cases of nonlinearities. We also investigate the continuous (in some sense) dependence of solutions on functional parameters.

title: Existence and Asymptotic Behavior for Solutions to Boundary Blow-up Elliptic Problems
abstract: Abstract This paper deals with the existence of solutions to the elliptic equation Œîu = k(x) f (u) in D satisfying the boundary blow-up condition u| ‚àÇD = ‚àû, where D ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N is an open bounded domain with smooth boundary ‚àÇD. Under suitable assumptions on k and f , we show the existence of at least one solution u. Under additional hypotheses on k, we give asymptotic estimate for u near the boundary.

title: A Harnack-Type Inequality for a Prescribed-Curvature Equation on a Domain with Boundary
authors: M. Gl√ºck; Ying Guo; Lei Zhang

Under suitable assumptions on K(x) and c(x), we show that there is a positive constant C such that for all positive solutions u, a Harnack-type inequality holds. As a consequence of this inequality we obtain the following energy estimate .

title: Regularity for Fully Nonlinear P-Laplacian Parabolic Systems: the Degenerate Case
abstract: Abstract This paper introduces new nonlinear heat approximation and L ‚àû preserving homotopy techniques to investigate regularity properties of bounded weak solutions of strongly coupled p-Laplacian parabolic systems which consist of more than one equation defined on a domain of any dimension. The main results imply everywhere H√∂lder continuity of bounded weak solutions and the global existence of strong solutions to nonlinear p-Laplacian systems.

We establish some maximum principles depending on Œ©. In particular, we explicitly characterize the measure of Œ© for which the maximum principles corresponding to this problem hold in Œ©. For this, we derived an explicit lower estimate of principal eigenvalues in terms of the measure of Œ©. Aleksandrov‚ÄìBakelman‚ÄìPucci (ABP) type estimates for the above systems are also proved. We also show the existence of a viscosity solution for a nonlinear perturbation of the nonhomogeneous counterpart of the above problem with polynomial and exponential growths. As an application of the maximum principles, we measure explicitly how small <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo fence="true" stretchy="false">|</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo fence="true" stretchy="false">|</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\lvert\Omega\rvert} has to be to ensure the positivity of the obtained solutions.

title: Elliptic-Parabolic Equation with Absorption of Obstacle type
abstract: Abstract This paper is concerned with existence and uniqueness of solutions for a doubly nonlinear degenerate parabolic problem of the type Œ≤(w) t ‚àí div a(x, Dw) + ‚àÇ j ( ., Œ≤(w) ) ‚àã f, where Œ± is a Leray-Lions operator, Œ≤ is a nondecreasing continuous function and ‚àÇ j(., r) is a maximal monotone graph with respect to r defined on a closed interval of ‚Ñù. Particular cases of j correspond to the so called obstacle problem.

title: On Radial Solutions of the Schr√∂dinger Type Equation
abstract: Abstract We establish compact embeddings of the radial Sobolev space H rad 1,p (‚Ñù N ) into weighted Lebesgue spaces L q w (‚Ñù N ) under various assumptions on the weight function w. We use these, along with a variety of variational techniques, to prove the existence of nontrivial nonnegative solutions for a class of nonlinear Schr√∂dinger type equations.

title: Smooth Dependence of Topological Conjugacies on Parameters
abstract: Abstract For nonautonomous linear equations x π = A(t)x with a nonuniform exponential dichotomy, we show that under sufficiently small C 1 parameter-dependent perturbations, namely of the form x π = A(t)x + f (t, x, Œª), the topological conjugacies in an appropriate version of the Grobman-Hartman theorem are of class C 1 in the parameter. The proof uses the fiber contraction principle.

title: Positive Solutions for Quasilinear Systems with Critical Growth
authors: Yuxia Guo; Xiangqing Liu; Fukun Zhao
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we consider the following system: where Œ© ‚äÇ ‚Ñù N (N ‚â• 3) is a smooth bounded domain and Œ±, Œ≤, Œª, Œº > 1 are parameters with . By using the perturbation method, we prove the existence of positive solutions for the problem (P). Indeed, the method we are using in this paper can be applied to the more general quasilinear system (see (1.7)).

title: Periodic Problems with the Scalar p-Laplacian Resonant at any Eigenvalue via Critical Point Methods
authors: Sophia Th. Kyritsi; Donal 'Regan; ŒùŒπŒ∫œåŒªŒ±ŒøœÇ Œ†Œ±œÄŒ±Œ≥ŒµœâœÅŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ
abstract: Abstract We consider nonlinear periodic problems driven by the scalar p-Laplacian with a Carath√©odory reaction term. Under conditions which permit resonance at infinity with respect to any eigenvalue, we show that the problem has a nontrivial smooth solution. Our approach combines variational techniques based on critical point theory with Morse theory.

title: Addendum to: Supercritical Elliptic Equations
On the Well-Posedness of a Class of Vector Schr√∂dinger Equations
abstract: Abstract We investigate the local and global well-posedness for a class of nonlinear Schr√∂dinger systems with an external time independent electromagnetic field and nonlocal nonlinearities. New conditions related to the growth of the nonlocal term are detected which allow the solvability of the problem.

title: Anniversary
authors: Stephen Cantrell; Vy Khoi Le; Jon Jacobsen

title: Addendum to: Stable and Finite Morse Index Solutions for Dirichlet Problems with Small Diffusion in a Degenerate Case and Problems with Infinite Boundary Values
abstract: Article Addendum to: Stable and Finite Morse Index Solutions for Dirichlet Problems with Small Diffusion in a Degenerate Case and Problems with Infinite Boundary Values was published on November 1, 2013 in the journal Advanced Nonlinear Studies (volume 13, issue 4).

title: Existence and Multiplicity of Positive Solutions for a Dirichlet Boundary Value Problem in ‚Ñù<sup>2</sup>
authors: Vivina Barutello; Anna Capietto; Patrick Habets
abstract: Abstract We deal with the Dirichlet boundary value problem associated to a parameter-dependent second order vector differential equation. Using the method of lower and upper solutions together with degree theory, we provide existence and multiplicity of positive solutions.

title: Asymptotic Analysis of a Radionuclide Transport Model With Unbounded Viscosity
abstract: Abstract We consider a model describing compressible nuclear waste disposal contamination in porous media. The transport of brine and radionuclides is described by a nonlinear coupled degenerate parabolic system. The viscosity of the fluid is unbounded and concentrations and temperature dependent. We study the asymptotic behavior of the model for little Peclet numbers.

title: Uniformly Elliptic Liouville Type Equations Part II: Pointwise Estimates and Location of Blow up Points
abstract: Abstract We refine the analysis, initiated in [3], [4] of the blow up phenomenon for the following two dimensional uniformly elliptic Liouville type problem in divergence form: We provide a partial generalization of a result of Y.Y. Li [18] to the case A ‚â† I. To this end, in the same spirit of [2], we obtain a sharp pointwise estimate for simple blow up sequences. Moreover, we prove that if {p 1 , ...,p N } is the blow up set corresponding to a given simple blow up sequence, then, (‚àÜdetA)(pj) = 0, ‚àÄ j = 1, ...,N. This characterization of the blow up set yields an improvement of the a priori estimates already established in [3].

title: Existence and Blow-up Results for Fast Diffusion Equations with Nonlinear Sources
abstract: Abstract In this paper we prove existence and blow-up results for a class of filtration equations in presence of suitable reaction terms. In particular we cover the case of principal part of fast diffusion type.

title: On the Integrability of a Tritrophic Food Chain Model
abstract: Abstract In this paper we work with a vastly analyzed tritrophic food chain model. We provide a complete characterization of their Darboux polynomials and of their exponential factors. We also show the non-existence of polynomial first integrals, of rational first integrals, of local analytic first integrals in a neighborhood of the origin, of first integrals that can be described by formal series and of Darboux first integrals.

title: On Some Nonhomogeneous Elliptic Problems in Unbounded Domains
authors: Anna Mar√≠a Candela; G. Cerami; Giuliana Palmieri
abstract: Abstract In this paper we consider the problem where Œ© = ‚Ñù N ‚àñ œâÃÖ, œâ being a nonempty open bounded domain of ‚Ñù N having smooth boundary We prove that, if u 0 and f are nonnegative and satisfy suitable conditions, there exist at least two positive solutions. Moreover, the existence of a solution is shown to hold even when no condition on the sign of u 0 and f is assumed.

title: An Asymptotical Stability in Variational Sense for Second Order Systems
abstract: Abstract In this paper, a new, variational concept of asymptotical stability of zero solution to an ordinary differential system of the second order, considered in Sobolev space, is presented. Sufficient conditions for an asymptotical stability in a variational sense with respect to initial condition and functional parameter (control) are given. Relation to the classical asymptotical stability is illustrated.

title: Nonuniform Stability of Difference Equations with Infinite Delay
abstract: Abstract In this note we consider the notion of nonuniform exponential contraction for delay difference equations with infinite delay (one can argue that the only delay difference equations are those with infinite delay, since otherwise we can always bring them to the standard recurrence form in some higher-dimensional space). We consider the general case of a nonautonomous dynamics. Our main objective is to show that exponential contractions persist under sufficiently small linear and nonlinear perturbations. This includes establishing the continuous dependence with the perturbation of the constants in the notion of contraction. We also characterize the nonuniform exponential contractions in terms of strict Lyapunov sequences, in particular by constructing explicitly a strict Lyapunov sequence for each exponential contraction.

title: Forced Duffing Equation With a Resonance Condition
abstract: Abstract This article is devoted to the study of the existence of a solution to the periodic nonlinear second order ordinary differential equation with damping u ∫ (x) + cu π (x) + g(x,u(x)) = f(x), x ‚àà [0, T], u(0) = u(T), u π(0) = u π(T), where c ‚àà ‚Ñù, g is a Caratheodory function, f ‚àà L 1 ([0, T), a quotient lies between 0 and and a nonlinearity g satisfies Landesman Lazer type condition near the zero. The techniques we use are a variational method and a critical point theorem.

title: Global Existence and Blowup for the Cubic Nonlinear Klein-Gordon Equations in Three Space Dimensions
authors: Jian Zhang; Zaihui Gan; Boling Guo
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we apply a cross-constrained variational method to study the classic nonlinear Klein-Gordon equation with cubic nonlinearity in three space dimensions. By constructing a type of cross-constrained variational problem and establishing the so-called cross invariant manifolds, we obtain a sharp threshold for blowup and global existence of the solution to the equation under study which is different from that in [10] . On the other hand, we give an answer to the question that how small the initial data have to be for the global solutions to exist.

title: Positive Solutions for Elliptic Equations With Supercritical Nonlinearity
abstract: Abstract In this paper minimax methods are employed to establish the existence of a bounded positive solution for semilinear elliptic equation of the form ‚àí‚àÜu + V (x)u = P(x)|u| p‚àí1 u + Q(x)|u| q‚àí1 u in ‚Ñù N , where the nonlinearity has supercritical growth and the potential can change sign. The solutions of the problem above are obtained by proving a priori estimates for solutions of a suitable auxiliary problem.

title: Backward Blow-up Estimates and Initial Trace for a Parabolic System of Reaction-Diffusion
authors: Marie‚ÄêFran√ßoise Bidaut‚ÄêV√©ron; Marta Garc√≠a‚ÄêHuidobro; Cecilia Yarur
abstract: Abstract In this article we study the positive solutions of the parabolic semilinear system of competitive type in Œ© √ó (0, T), where Œ© is a domain of ‚Ñù N , and p,q > 0, pq ‚â† 1, Despite of the lack of comparison principles, we prove local upper estimates in the superlinear case pq > 1 of the form u(x, t) ‚â¶ Ct -(p+1)/(pq-1) , v(x, t) ‚â¶ Ct -(q+1)/(pq-1) in œâ √ó (0, T 1 ), for any domain œâ ‚äÇ‚äÇ Œ©, T 1 ‚àà (0, T), and C = C(N, p, q, T 1 , œâ). For p, q > 1, we prove the existence of an initial trace at time 0, which is a Borel measure on Œ©. Finally we prove that the punctual singularities at time 0 are removable when p, q ‚âß 1 + 2/N.

title: Persistence Properties of the Two-Component b-Family System
abstract: Abstract In this paper we study the persistence properties of decay for the solutions to the two component b-family system. Using the method of characteristics, we establish that certain decay properties of the initial data persist as long as the solution exists. We also examine the propagation behavior of compactly supported solutions. We show that solutions have an infinite speed of propagation, that is, a non-trivial strong solution with compact initial value can not be compactly supported at any later time.

title: Anniversary
abstract: Vieri Benci on the occasion of his sixtieth birthday.The issue consists of articles from some leading experts in the field of nonlinear analysis.

title: Anniversary
abstract: Antonio Ambrosetti is an outstanding mathematicians who greatly contributed to the advancement of modern Nonlinear Analysis by introducing new fundamental tools and ideas and applying them to study significant applications.We only recall here the paper in collaboration with his maestro Giovanni Prodi, On the inversion of some differentiable mapping with singularities between Banach spaces, Ann.Mat.Pura Appl., 93 (1972) and the paper in collaboration with Paul Rabinowitz, Dual variational methods in critical point theory and applications, J. Functional Analysis, 14 (1973).Both of them had a great impact on the mathematical community and have helped shape modern Nonlinear Analysis.Antonio is a great teacher and has had positive influence on many mathematicians in Italy and abroad.We both had such an opportunity, while being graduate students at SISSA, and we have experienced personally on one hand his deep mathematical knowledge and his enthusiasm for mathematics and on the other side his patience, his willingness to listen (also to our mistakes) and to collaborate on an equal footing (even with young, inexperienced Ph.D. student like we were).

title: Existence and stability of standing waves for Schrodinger-Poisson-Slater equation
Hypersurfaces of Prescribed k-Order Mean Curvature in Exterior Domains
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we prove some existence theorems for hypersurfaces of prescribed k-order mean curvature in exterior domains, which lead to the study of the existence of k-order mean curvature equation in exterior domains.

title: Branching Points For a Class of Variational Equations Involving Potential With Parameter
abstract: Abstract In this paper, under the framework of Ambrosetti [1], using mountain-pass theorem and topological degree theory, we extend the result of Ambrosetti [1] (in which H is independent of Œª and C 1 ) to the equation Au + H(Œª, u) = Œªu with H jointly continuous in (Œª, u) and H(Œª, ¬∑) of class C 0, 1 . We give a description of the structure of local bifurcation from isolated eigenvalues of A: the set of bifurcation solutions at each isolated eigenvalue of A contains at least one connected branch. Applications to the existence of branching points to semilinear elliptic partial differential equations are given.

title: Existence of Sign-Changing Solutions to a Dirichlet Problem With p-Laplacian and Weights
abstract: Abstract We study the following Dirichlet problem with the p-Laplacian and weights: We show the existence of a positive solution, a negative solution and a sign-changing solution to the problem.

title: Absence of Global Solutions to Systems of Perturbed Parabolic Inequalities with Chipot‚ÄìWeissler Nonlinearity in the Gradient Term
abstract: Abstract For a wide class of systems of nonlinear parabolic inequalities with Chipot-Weissler nonlinearity in the gradient term which depend on two nonnegative parameters Œª 1 and Œª 1 , we study the nonexistence of global solutions according to the \test function" method. We establish theorems that, when Œª 1 = Œª 1 = 0, include and, in some cases, improve, or, in part, yield the results obtained by Es- cobedo and Herrero; Escobedo and Levine; Galaktionov;Levine, Lieberman and Meier; Mitidieri and Pohozaev; Pohozaev and Tesei.

title: Erratum/Compactness/Recent Progress in Conformal Geometry
Computations of Critical Groups and Applications to Nonlinear Differential Equations With Resonance
abstract: Abstract In this paper, we develop a method to compute critical groups at degenerate critical points under more general conditions. The abstract results are used to study the existence and multiplicity of nontrivial solutions for nonlinear differential equations with resonance both at infinity and at zero.

title: Compactness Property of a Singular Quasilinear Elliptic Equation
abstract: Abstract We characterize a compactness property for a quasilinear equation with critical growth and singular term. Some applications of the compactness property are also pointed out.

title: Existence of Infinitely Many Solutions For a Class of Semilinear Subelliptic Equations on Rational Carnot Groups
abstract: Abstract We establish the existence of infinitely many solutions for the equation -Œî G u + u = f(Œæ,u), Œæ ‚àà G where Œî G is a sublaplacian on a rational Carnot group G. The function f is assumed to be periodic with respect to a discrete co-compact subgroup of G and satisfy subcritical growth conditions.

title: A Nonresonance Condition for Boundary Value Problems
abstract: Abstract We consider the boundary value problem u‚Ä≥ + g(u)u = h(t, u, u‚Ä≤) u(0) = 0, u(œÄ) = 0 with g continuous, periodic, and positive and h continuous and bounded. It is shown that there is a solution if the mean value of g is not the square of an integer.

Then we derive from our analysis some existence results in the so-called resonant case, that is, when the parameter œ± is of the form <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mrow> <m:msubsup> <m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚àë</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> <m:mi>œÉ</m:mi> </m:msubsup> <m:mrow> <m:mn>8</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>œÄ</m:mi> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mn>1</m:mn> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>Œ≥</m:mi> <m:mi>i</m:mi> </m:msub> </m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:msubsup> <m:mo largeop="true" symmetric="true">‚àë</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mi>œÉ</m:mi> <m:mo>+</m:mo> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> <m:mi>m</m:mi> </m:msubsup> <m:mrow> <m:mn>8</m:mn> <m:mo>‚Å¢</m:mo> <m:mi>œÄ</m:mi> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${\sum_{i=1}^{\sigma}8\pi(1+\gamma_{i})+\sum_{i=\sigma+1}^{m}8\pi}$ for a subset <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">(</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:msub> <m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:msub> </m:msub> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚Ä¶</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:msub> <m:mi>i</m:mi> <m:mi>œÉ</m:mi> </m:msub> </m:msub> <m:mo stretchy="false">)</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${(q_{i_{1}},\ldots,q_{i_{\sigma}})}$ of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ£</m:mi> <m:mo>:=</m:mo> <m:mrow> <m:mo stretchy="false">{</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mn>1</m:mn> </m:msub> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">‚Ä¶</m:mi> <m:mo>,</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>q</m:mi> <m:mi>N</m:mi> </m:msub> <m:mo stretchy="false">}</m:mo> </m:mrow> </m:mrow> </m:math> ${\Sigma:=\{q_{1},\ldots,q_{N}\}}$ . In particular, we provide an Euler‚ÄìPoincar√©-type criterium for existence of solutions.

title: Ireneo Peral: Forty Years as Mentor
authors: Boumediene Abdellaoui; Juan Antonio Aguilar; Bego√±a Barrios; Eduardo Colorado; Fernando Charro; Jes√∫s Garc√≠a Azorero; Mar√≠a Medina; Susana Merch√°n; Luigi Montoro; Ana Primo
abstract: Abstract In this article we present a survey of the Ph.D. theses that have been completed under the advice of Ireneo Peral.Following a chronological order, we summarize the main results contained in the works of the former students of Ireneo Peral.

By the variational method, we obtain some existence and multiplicity results of the sign-changing solutions (including the radial sign-changing solution in the case of <m:math xmlns:m="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <m:mrow> <m:mi mathvariant="normal">Œ©</m:mi> <m:mo>=</m:mo> <m:msub> <m:mi>ùîπ</m:mi> <m:mi>R</m:mi> </m:msub> </m:mrow> </m:math> {\Omega=\mathbb{B}_{R}} ) for this problem. Our results generalize and improve some known results in the literature. Moreover, we also obtain a uniqueness result of the radial positive solution.

title: Local and Global Existence of Strong Solutions to Large Cross Diffusion Systems
abstract: Abstract We study the solvability of a general class of cross diffusion systems and establish the local and global existence of their strong solutions under the weakest assumption that they are VMO. This work simplifies the setting in our previous work [15] and provides new extensions which are more verifiable in applications.

On degenerate case of prescribed curvature measure problems
abstract: Abstract In this article, we prove the C 1,1 estimate for solutions of prescribed curvature measure problems when the prescribed function may touch zero somewhere.

title: Smooth approximation of twisted K√§hler-Einstein metrics
abstract: Abstract In this article, we prove the existence of smooth approximations of twisted K√§hler-Einstein metrics using the variational method.

title: Sharp profiles for diffusive logistic equation with spatial heterogeneity
abstract: Abstract In this article, we study the sharp profiles of positive solutions to the diffusive logistic equation. By employing parameters and analyzing the corresponding perturbation equations, we find the effects of boundary and spatial heterogeneity on the positive solutions. The main results exhibit the sharp effects between boundary conditions and linear/nonlinear spatial heterogeneities on positive solutions.
